sequence: A Catholic church in Port Aransas is left without a priest after he was removed Wednesday by the bishop of A Catholic church in Port Aransas has been left without a priest following his removal by the local bishop on Wednesday. While specific reasons for the removal were not disclosed, the Diocese of Corpus Christi said that the bishop took the action in light of parish-related concerns. The community remains anxious, waiting for further clarification, as well as a new priest to take on the vacant leadership position. The Diocese, in the meantime, asks the church and the wider public for continued prayer for unity during this challenging time.

Ballinhassig 4-17 Castlelyons 1-12 : A polished second-half performance powered Ballinhassig to a comprehensive win over Castlelyons in the Cork Premier IHC at Páirc Uí Rinn. Ballinhassig secured a dominant victory against Castlelyons in the Cork Premier IHC thanks to an outstanding second-half display at Páirc Uí Rinn. The convincing 4-17 to 1-12 win highlighted Ballinhassig's remarkable comeback from trailing during the first half. Their stellar team effort, featuring top scorers David O'Sullivan and Cillian Tyers, ensured a smooth passage into the next stage of the tournament, leaving Castlelyons to assess and rebuild before their next challenge.

Veteran congressman Jim Leach (R-IA) went down to defeat in the massacre of 2006. I'm no apologist for "moderate Republicans" but it is worth saying that Leach was, in my estimation, fairly clearly the best House Republican. Nevertheless, one can only be thrilled with his defeat. That it happened just goes to show how fundamentally rotten the whole GOP scene had become. Leach was, in many ways, a person possessed of genuinely decent instincts and some fundamentally sound ideas about how the United States should conduct itself in the world. Nevertheless, in practice he was useless.

Professionals gearing up for Olathe ’ s public firework display on Tuesday are taking extensive safety precautions and following many regulations to ensure a safe and successful event. The team has spent countless hours studying weather patterns and conducting inspections to determine the ideal launch area. Additionally, only professional pyrotechnicians are allowed to operate the fireworks to maintain a secure environment for the public. Safety barriers and monitored access points will also be in place. Officials have prepared response plans in case of an emergency, with emergency personnel and multiple evacuation routes in place for smooth execution if needed.

Micron Technology (MU) stock is climbing Tuesday after the company reported third-quarter earnings and revenue above analysts' estimates. NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- Micron Technology (MU - Get Report) stock is climbing Tuesday after the company reported third-quarter earnings and revenue above analysts' estimates. Over its May-ended quarter, the semiconductor specialist earned 79 cents a share, 9 cents higher than what analysts surveyed by Thomson Reuters expected. Revenue of $3.98 billion beat forecasts of $3.89 billion. By early afternoon, shares had popped 5% to $32.83. "We rate MICRON TECHNOLOGY INC (MU) a BUY.

Want to end the war on whistleblowers? Revise the Espionage Act. Over the past 100 years, the act has metastasized into a tool for government secrecy. The evolution of the Espionage Act has done much to shape the freedom of political debate in the modern U.S. What began as a vague statute that gave President Woodrow Wilson power to jail critics and censor the news media during World War I has transformed into a powerful law that regulates political discourse by policing secrets, not speech. Censorship did not end when the war did. It evolved. Despite its name, the Espionage Act has always been a broad statute.

The images we have published out of Yemen may be as unsettling as anything we have used before . Here are photographs showing that after more than two years of civil war, a massive cholera epidemic has further crippled the Arab world's poorest country. This new catastrophe has killed more than 2,000 people and infected around 500,000 others, of whom half are children. Hospitals in the region are severely understaffed and barely functioning. The shortage of food, clean water and medicine combined with near-total health service failure due to the ongoing conflict, are turning a manageable epidemic into a catastrophe on the brink of genocide.

ARLINGTON , Texas ( AP ) - Mike Minor got to finish what he started , something the lefty never got a chance to do before as a starter for Texas. Minor pitched a three-hitter for his first complete game in five seasons, allowing only one extra-base hit while striking out a season-high 13, as the Texas Rangers beat the LA Angels 5-0. This victory pushed Minor's personal record to a league-leading 25 wins since his debut in April, while Ronald Guzmán led the offense with two doubles and two RBIs, supported by Elijha Marrero and Will Trice's homers, powering Texas towards victory.

Progressive Networks ' RealAudio and RealVideo streaming products got a shot in the arm today with the news that Microsoft has agreed to incorporate the company's technology into its multimedia product offerings. This move is expected to boost the prominence and credibility of Progressive Networks' products and bolster Microsoft's competitive stance in the multimedia industry. It also underscores Microsoft's strategic plan to align with top players in cutting-edge technology. The partnership further enhances consumer and corporate access to a variety of audio and video streaming services, providing users with better online multimedia experiences.

US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel in Jeddah. US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel in Jeddah. Gulfwest Company Limited is a Jeddah-based Saudi company that imports US beef, which is used by five-star hotels, fine-dining restaurants, upscale casual dining and fast food restaurants, and catering companies. The company said in a statement that the Gulfwest Food Expo held on Nov.26 is the first-of-its-kind event organized by a food product importer in Saudi Arabia.

AURORA, Ill. – A suburban teen has died after a tragic accident in the parking lot of a high school. Police say 17-year-old Stephen Woodcock of St. Charles died Monday morning, May 16, 2016, after he was injured Friday afternoon in the parking lot of Marmion Academy. Police say the teen was riding on the passenger side running board of an SUV in the parking lot when he lost his grip, according to WGN. He fell backwards and struck the pavement. Police say Woodcock suffered head and other injuries. He was treated by paramedics at the scene then airlifted to the hospital.

Mastering the ins and outs of Obamacare open enrollment can be a daunting task, but experts offer helpful tips for making it through the process with minimal stress. Bob Cannard shovels compost which orignally came from San Francisco food scraps at Green String Farms outside Petaluma , Calif. Bob Cannard is utilizing compost originating from San Francisco's food scraps at Green String Farms outside Petaluma, California. This practice benefits both the city and the farm: San Francisco diverts waste from landfills, and Green String Farms gains access to quality organic material for fertilizing its crops. As more communities become eco-conscious and attempt to cut down waste, using compost from urban sources offers a sustainable alternative, bringing benefits to waste disposal methods and farmers' fields.

The incline bench press is a strength-training move to build your chest and fronts of the shoulders. The move is performed in a face-up position on a workout bench set at an angle. You then grasp dumbbells or a barbell in an overhand position, and extend and bend your elbows to elevate the weight over your chest. Incline chest press machines that simulate the movement in a fixed plane are another way to perform the move. The incline press is one of several exercises that help create symmetry and strength in the muscles of the upper body.

The TTP is appare­ntly not able to fund its operat­ions for the want of money. ISLAMABAD: The Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) is facing a serious financial crisis since its slain founding leader Baitullah Mehsud combined several scattered groups from all over the tribal belt to form the most feared terror network of homegrown militants back in 2007. “The Taliban have seriously run out of funds…they have hardly any money anymore,” at least three associates of the group said amid a surprising halt in their activities – suicide bombings and terror attacks across Pakistan and in parts of Afghanistan – in recent months.

Russian President Vladimir Putin called Turkey ’ s downing of a Russian fighter jet today ( 24 November ) a “stab in the back”. He warned that “serious consequences” should be expected. This may cause additional friction and tension not only between Turkey and Russia, but among all parties operating against the ISIS terrorist organisation in the Middle East, particularly NATO allies. As speculation continues over what those serious consequences could entail, some sources have indicated it might signal the end of their much-needed “turkey for gas” energy partnership.

Guess what? The NBA really is a showbiz affair. Only super-producer David Stern isn’t pulling all the behind-the-curtain strings (otherwise, New York somehow would have won the draft lottery). And to think: We haven’t even mentioned the Los Angeles Lakers. Regrettably, the biggest news of the season has nothing to do with basketball.

Featured as one of America’s 10 Best Towns for Families by Family Circle Magazine, Allen offers a family-friendly community with exceptional schools, excellent city services and facilities, and a nationally recognized parks and recreation system. JURGEN KLOPP has revealed his delight at ending Pep Guardiola 's 22-game unbeaten run with Manchester City , exclaiming live on air, "Wow! What a game!". Liverpool edged out City with a dramatic 4-3 victory in the recent Premier League match, finally bringing an end to their rival's seemingly unstoppable streak. Speaking to a TV network post-match, Klopp praised his players, particularly for their hard work and relentless high tempo throughout the game. The exhilarating win firmly cements Liverpool's top-four status and boosts their chances to play in next season's UEFA Champions League.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Associate to join our specialist Partnership Compliance team . The team is growing rapidly and focuses on providing expert partnership compliance services to a diverse range of clients in various industries. In this role, the successful candidate will be responsible for managing a portfolio of clients, building and maintaining strong relationships, and ensuring timely delivery of high-quality partnership compliance services. Key responsibilities include tax reporting, planning and consulting, reviewing partnership agreements, and liaising with the relevant tax authorities. A CANCER expert has hit on a way to kill tumours in two hours — using light. The technique involves a single jab with a chemical then a flash of ultraviolet. Cancer cells in lab mice were found to self-destruct, with up to 95 per cent dead in two hours. Professor Matthew Gdovin revealed the cells — which he injected with the chemical compound nitrobenzaldehyde — turned too acidic to survive. He said after patenting his “photodynamic” therapy: “There are many different types of cancers. “The one thing they have in common is their susceptibility to this induced cell suicide.

The Planning Commission approved a sidewalk extension along a portion of the Laguna Canyon's frontage road despite opposition from some commissioners and residents during its meeting Wednesday night inside City Council chambers. The commission voted 3 to 2 to remove an existing curb, gutter and four trees and install a new curb, gutter, pedestrian access ramp and sidewalk from Woodland Drive south along Laguna Canyon Frontage Road to connect with an existing sidewalk. The sidewalk would narrow the existing roadway by about 2 1/2 feet, to 15 1/2 feet once completed. The Boys & Girls Club and Sawdust Art Festival sit along the road.

Malawi Parliament has started soliciting views on interest rate capping bill which an opposition legislator moved in the 193 strong House to stop commercial banks from charging high interest rates. Alekeni Menyani, the chairman of the joint Public Affairs Committee, Women Caucus and Government Assurance Committee said there was indeed need for a law to regulate bank interest rates. "But all the players should discuss this important issue with sober minds. There should not be emotions. We should all be guided by facts," said Menyani. Chairlady of Women Caucus Jessie Kabwila said the bill was very important for women.

THE Lifetime TV channel says it will air a movie about Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown’s relationship. And the network has made sure to hire a veteran actress, who starred opposite the singer in Waiting To Exhale, to direct the biopic. Angela Bassett, 55, will make her directorial debut for the TV movie that will centre on the late pop star, who died in 2012. Lifetime announced that the movie will follow the Houston and Brown through their first meeting and tumultuous marriage. It also promises to chronicle the I Will Always Love You singer’s rise to fame.

South Bend ( IN ) -- Thursday morning , the Irish took the practice field for the final time before their season opener. Coach Brian Kelly is focusing on preparing the team and making crucial decisions, including the quarterback situation. With both Drew Pyne and Jack Coan fighting for the starting role, Kelly emphasized that he is confident in both players and believes the offense will be in capable hands regardless of who starts. He added that improving fundamentals and details will be critical going into the game. Fans are excited to see who will emerge as the starting quarterback when the team kicks off its season next week.

Fiji Council of Social Services ( FCOSS ) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by The Fiji Council of Social Services (FCOSS) has given its approval to the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by district representatives. The Code, a self-regulatory tool, was created through partnerships between NGO Accountability Workshops and Peer Advice Group training, held in the FCOSS program earlier this year. Its main aim is to help build capacity and facilitate local groups in understanding the value of collective engagement, whilst creating innovative ideas and improvements for social impact measurement practices, further enhancing their knowledge and working relationships.

“The Monterey Bay has always been a great place to visit for its beautiful scenery. Now you can come for the beer!" Jeff Moses, owner of Night That Never Ends Productions, is hosting the 2011 Monterey Beer Festival, which is being billed as “the greatest assortment of beer ever assembled on the Central Coast.” On Saturday afternoon, June 11, more than 80 brewers will be pouring hundreds of the best beers from around the world. NEW DELHI: A day after declaring its candidate for the seventh Lok Sabha seat, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Monday made it clear that there would be neither any alliance with the Congress nor a rollback of any of its candidates in Delhi. Asserting that "enough is enough", senior AAP leader Gopal Rai said these are the final seven candidates of the party and there is no question of "any roll back". The ruling AAP had earlier on March 2, announced the names of its candidates for the six Lok Sabha seats.

`` Of all the German surface warships , the British feared Bismarck the most . Her size , speed , and firepower made her a formidable adversary, but today marks a new chapter in the history of the mighty Bismarck. In a decisive naval battle off the coast of Denmark, the British Royal Navy successfully sank the German juggernaut. Combining strategic planning, advanced technology, and a coordinated attack from air and sea, the British finally neutralized the Bismarck's threat. The destruction of the iconic vessel not only changes the naval balance in Europe but also symbolizes the relentless determination of Allied forces to overcome tyranny in World War II.

SHENANDOAH -- A church in Schuylkill County is preparing to honor the late Fr . Walter Ciszek , S.J . The Schuylkill County church is organizing a special celebration to honor the life and contributions of the late Father Walter Ciszek, S.J., a Jesuit priest known for his courageous mission work in Russia during the communist era. Fr. Ciszek spent 23 years in harsh captivity and unwaveringly spread faith amidst persecution. His cause for sainthood is under examination by the Vatican, and the community seeks to recognize his enduring commitment and spirituality in these celebrations.

Without much fuss or fanfare, but, happily, with plenty of shoppers, Salisbury quietly reopened its central shopping centre on Saturday, almost three months after it became the site of an international incident. The Maltings, which connects the coach park to the city centre, has been off-limits to the public and shielded by safety cordons and tents since the former spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were found slumped on one of its park benches after being poisoned. Market traders were moved behind the shopping precinct by Wiltshire county council while the decontamination operation was under way.

Rep. Francis D. Gibson speaks on the Utah Inland Port Authority Bill that he sponsored as Utah Legislators gather at the State Capitol in Salt Lake City for a special session on Wednesday, July 18, 2018. Just because something is allowed doesn’t mean it is advisable. The three subcommittees of the Utah Inland Port Authority Board may legally meet behind closed doors under the state’s Open and Public Meetings Act. Each subcommittee consists of four or five members of the 11-member Port Authority board, which doesn’t constitute a quorum.

The Green Bay Press-Gazette reports that authorities say they are two to three weeks away from completing an investigation into an alleged sexual assault involving Packers cornerback Brandon Underwood. Underwood has been accused by two Milwaukee women of assaulting them in Lake Delton, Wis., a resort area, following a charity event. The alleged incident happened on June 5 and days after the incident police officials said they doubted any charges could result from the incident. One of the big hang-ups? The stories told by the women reportedly changed, at first implicating multiple Packers and then just Underwood.

Mindfulness and meditation have made deep inroads into the corporate world . The benefits are proving out , notes this Harvard Business Review article. Companies, including Apple, Google, and Procter & Gamble, have introduced mindfulness programs for employees, and an array of research backs up their effectiveness. Studies have found mindfulness can improve creativity, productivity, and engagement while reducing stress, anxiety, and absenteeism. Furthermore, team leaders who practice mindfulness can cultivate better work cultures that emphasize empathy and better decision-making. Experts emphasize mindfulness techniques, such as short breathing exercises, must be customized to be integrated effectively into the workplace.

The Grant bar and grill is a lively place with local musicians playing Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights and Sunday afternoons on the outdoor dining deck. If The Old Fish House could talk, just imagine the mesmerizing stories she’d share about 100 years of residence alongside the Indian River Lagoon. She could tell us about the early days when entire families slept on their fishing boats. We’d hear tales about the break of morning on the river, when husbands took those same boats and joined the fishing fleet going out to sea while families stayed behind with wives working hard in the fish house, processing fish.

A man has been jailed for keeping dogs for fighting at his home in Ayrshire. Tony Barbara, 50, was found guilty of having two pit bull terrier-type dogs for fighting despite being subject to a 10-year ban from keeping the animals. Kilmarnock Sheriff Court heard animal welfare officers and police searched Barbara's home in High Street, Newmilns, East Ayrshire, on November 12 2014 after being given a tip-off. The officers found two dogs with puncture wounds and scars. The animals, named Kira and Jackie, had been kept in crates in the kitchen and the bedroom.

A man was booked for allegedly flashing a 45-year-old woman while she was out on a morning walk in Sector 9 of Gurugram, India. According to the victim, the man passed obscene gestures before flashing her. She promptly lodged a complaint, following which police launched a search for the culprit. With the help of CCTV footage and other resources, they were able to arrest him within a day. An FIR has been filed against the man under the Indecent Representation of Women Act. Authorities urged the public to not remain silent and come forward to report such incidents.

As minutes turned to hours, images and reports began pouring in, depicting the grim aftermath. Thousands were injured, with numerous casualties reported. Amidst the chaos, brave rescue teams and volunteers fought against the clock to search for survivors in the rubble.

The Maine State Lottery tapped Fuseideas as its advertising agency of record . NL Partners of Portland , Maine , The Maine State Lottery has appointed Boston-based advertising firm Fuseideas as its advertising agency of record. The previous agency, NL Partners of Portland, Maine, had managed the lottery's account for three decades. As part of the deal, Fuseideas will manage marketing strategy, media planning and buying, research, and digital efforts for the lottery. Maine State Lottery had set a new record in fiscal year 2021 with $324m in revenue and approximately $89m of profit sent back to the General Fund of the State of Maine.

If you have flexible working arrangements and do not work at a fixed location every day , and are looking to find office spaces for occasional use, Coportate, a UK-based startup, might have the solution. Launched on June 1, the mobile app allows users to browse and book co-working spaces, conference rooms, and meeting rooms across various locations at the touch of a button. Additionally, the app offers hassle-free billing and contract processes. By targeting independent professionals and entrepreneurs, Coportate aims to meet the demand for convenient, low-cost alternatives to traditional office spaces as remote work culture gains popularity.

Delicious , the original king of shared online bookmarking , is now in the hands of YouTube 's founders , Chad Hurley and Steve Chen. Having purchased Delicious from Yahoo in 2011, science research company Science Inc. announced its sale to Hurley and Chen, without revealing the transaction's financial details. While originally positioned for rebranding and transition under Science Inc., Delicious reportedly remained largely underdeveloped. Although now in Hurley and Chen's hands, its unclear whether the YouTube founders will choose to update the once massively popular service or implement its unique features into their current blockchain project.

WASHINGTON ( CN ) – Republicans heaped ridicule on Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood at a Wednesday hearing after LaHood suggested At a hearing last Wednesday, US Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood faced criticism from Republican representatives after proposing to provide tax breaks for single income households through miles travelled, with income-adjusted programs on a "breakthrough traffic-signal technology". He says these potential changes would take about 15-20 years to consider, depending on conversations with Congress, regulators and automobile experts. Lawmakers say they will allow LaHood to reach back in conversation regarding financing infrastructure, using results to find agreement to funding projects to improve communities without driver congestion tax.

What exactly separates people from machines ? Two things , actually : creativity and empathy . No matter what gets programmed into artificial intelligence (AI) or robots, these human traits remain challenging to replicate. However, developments in AI continue to evolve, enabling machines to mimic creativity and exhibit some form of empathy. Despite the incredible advancements, human empathy, encompassing understanding emotions and reacting with compassion, remains unmatched by machines. Furthermore, the uniquely human capability of generating diverse and innovative ideas to adapt to various situations continues to distinguish people from their machine counterparts.

Wearing a black athleisure ensemble and exuding charm and energy, Akshay left the audience enthralled, even doing a jig and playful "jumla" kicks down the runway. BLAKELY, Pa. --More than 170,000 pounds of food was handed out to those in need in Lackawanna County. Newswatch 16 found cars lined up outside Peckville Assembly of God Church waiting to take advantage of the generosity. The church gave out hundreds of hams, turkeys and other meat as well as fresh produce and toiletries. "I do not know how to explain it to you but the food helps me pay medical bills because I save money here and I pay my bills, ya know?" said William Carter of Dickson City. Peckville Assembly of God Church gives out free food every Friday.

ZAMBOANGA CITY—Terror is stalking residents of the island town of Pata in Sulu and it ’ s not coming from the Abu Sayyaf terrorists who often prey on isolated towns. Dozens of adult pigs have reportedly been killed by mystery assailants and 35 breeding dogs stolen over a two-month period on Pata Island in the Philippines. Many fear the situation is the work of "shapeshifters," creatures believed in folklore to be witches that can turn into animals. Governor Abdusakur M. Tan Sr. has instructed the Provincial Peace and Order Council to determine the facts about these incidents and help with policing.

To a watching world, the sight of Britain on fire this week has surely been shocking. The looting and torching has revealed an inner-city London, Birmingham and Manchester seldom glimpsed in the England usually offered for export via soft-focus period dramas, Hugh Grant movies or stories on Will and Kate. If the revelation has puzzled outsiders, it has confused Britons no less. The mood here is a mixture of rage, fear and bafflement. Not that we’re not used to riots: We are. England caught fire during that other royal-wedding year, 1981.

The overstuffed roster for X-Men: Days of Future Past just got a little bit smaller. Although Anna Paquin‘s Rogue was reported as being part of the sequel all the way back in January, director Bryan Singer now reveals that the character has sadly been cut out of the film altogether. Hit the jump to find out why. According to EW, Paquin was set for just one scene in the movie — a big rescue sequence featuring Rogue, Magneto (Ian McKellen), Professor X (Patrick Stewart), and Iceman (Shawn Ashmore).

Everyone knows where and what they were doing when this nightmare called 9/11 happened . Chuck was getting ready for work when he first heard about the devastating terrorist attacks. Today marks the 20th anniversary of 9/11, a dark day that forever changed history, leaving thousands dead, wounded and still grieving. Brazil is currently implementing the Brasil Sem Miséria programme — a continuation of the successful Fome Zero— which aims to do just that, Marques Porto says. President Barack Obama has postponed two stops on his four-nation Asian tour because of the government shutdown . NEW YORK — Just before noon on Wednesday , Australian ambassador and president of the United Nations Arms Trade Treaty Conference, Peter Woolcott, expressed grave concern over the continuous global increase in arms sales during the treaty conference at the UN headquarters in New York. He emphasized that it exacerbates conflicts, fuels violence and increases instability around the world. Participants highlighted the significance of a strong international system to govern conventional arms trade and establish guidelines to avoid misuse. Attendees advocated for strengthening the Arms Trade Treaty, greater global participation, and comprehensive action by UN member states to achieve disarmament and non-proliferation of conventional weapons.

Summer is the time to start thinking of how to pack a delicious — and smart — picnic . WASHINGTON -- An Iowa egg producer at the center of a nationwide outbreak of salmonella apologized to a Congressional panel on Wednesday and admitted that his family operation "got big quite a while before we stopped acting like we were small." "What I mean by that is we were big before we started adopting sophisticated procedures to be sure we met all of the government requirements," the egg producer, Austin J. DeCoster, said in testimony before a House Energy and Commerce subcommittee. He is the founder of an egg empire that has been linked over three decades to multiple deadly outbreaks of salmonella poisoning in many states.

U.S. government debt yields rose on Friday after the U.S. government said that job creation was stronger than expected in March, but wages grew at a sluggish pace. The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note rose to 2.538%, while the yield on the 30-year Treasury bond climbed to 2.947%. Bond yields move inversely to prices. GENEVA – The Head of the UN Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict, Justice Richard Goldstone, today urged the international community to put an end to impunity for violations of international law in Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territory as he presented the report of the Mission* to the Human Rights Council. Following its three-month investigation, the four-person Mission concluded that serious violations of international human rights and humanitarian law were committed by Israel in the context of its military operations in Gaza from December 27, 2008 to January 18, 2009, and that Israel committed actions amounting to war crimes, and possibly crimes against humanity.

There are a range of useful commands which can be accessed through the game console, or entered into the .con files. To open the console, press the tilde (~) key. To close the console, press ~ again. The lead seal is the first found bearing the image of St. Sabas , local big shot 1,500 years ago A remarkable 1,500-year-old lead seal featuring the image of St. Sabas has been unearthed during archaeological excavations in Jerusalem. It marks the first discovery of such a seal bearing his likeness. St. Sabas, an influential local figure in his time, founded several monastic institutions and engaged in diplomacy during the Byzantine period. The rare artifact, which helped in protecting written documents, offers researchers a glimpse into Jerusalem's history and contributes valuable information about the period's social, economic, and religious developments.

Shares of AOL Inc. shot up 19% in premarket trade Tuesday, after the Internet content company agreed to be acquired by Verizon Communications Inc. in a deal valued at $4.4 billion. Under terms of the deal, which will take the form of a tender offer that is followed by a merger, Verizon will pay $50 for each AOL share, which represents a 17% premium to Monday's closing price. Vodafone Hutchison Australia (VHA) chief Iñaki Berroeta has sought to temper expectations about the imminent rise of 5G networks in Australia, saying although his company is forging ahead, he doesn’t anticipate consumer devices to be in market until at least the end of 2019. Berroeta declined to talk about any spectrum ambitions for Australian 5G, instead stressing that the new “ecosystem” for the mobile technology need to be put into place first before carriers started pushing product. He said he expected “most of the market” would be launching 5G either side of a one or two month window period when it arrived.

Companies looking to offer retirement plans will soon have a new alternative . Automated investment adviser Betterment said today that it is launching its Betterment for Business offering that helps people manage 401(K) accounts, which will begin trading later this month. The so-called 'Robo-401(k)' will manage traditional pension schemes, automatically guiding both employees and employers to which they say, offer greater customised plans at a far cheaper fee than a person can, optimising plans more regularly. Tech analysis firm Forrester Research claims that financial planning robots and self-direction systems will control at least $785bn worldwide by the end of the year.

Not only did former BP chief executive Tony Hayward go sailing on his yacht at the height of the oil-spill crisis in 2010, but documents recently obtained through a freedom of information request revealed that the ex-BP CEO took part in several regattas on his $3.5m yacht after being sidelined to a director's role in BP. Hayward, who also deflected blame onto the contractor and the media, will be questioned during the ongoing Deepwater Horizon trial. He retired with an annual pension of $961k per year and set up investment fund Vallares which led to another oil-spill after merging with oil-producer Genel.

Nobody asked me , but … if you pay dues to a neo-Nazi organization , subscribe to racist publications , post hateful content on social media, or attend far-right rallies, chances are, you're supporting and perpetuating racism and discrimination. Society must unite against these extremist beliefs that divide us and foster a sense of inequality among individuals. Governments, corporations, and institutions should collaborate in spreading awareness, reinforcing anti-discrimination laws, and combating misinformation, thus promoting tolerance and empathy across the globe. Additionally, individuals should work towards cultivating an inclusive community, rejecting and dismantling the ideologies of racial supremacy and racial divisions.

The carrier operates 744 mainline planes that vary in size, carrying 50 to 366 passengers each. For a typical 737 plane carrying 179 passengers, the reduction would mean about 11 pounds per flight. Per the paper, stopping on-board sales of duty-free items like “perfumes, chocolates and liquor” also saved 1.4 millions of gallons of fuel annually, saving United Airlines $2.3 million. Presumably that also means United was making less than $2.3 million selling the items in-flight or calculated that allowing passengers to pick them up at ground level would not dent its revenue significantly.

UNITED NATIONS , July 6 , updated -- With the mandate of the UN Mission in Sudan set to expire on 15 July, Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has warned of an increasing risk of confrontation between South Sudan's government and the main opposition party if a consensus to form a joint administration is not reached. Guterres has requested that the UN Security Council act to continue support and engage with other parties. Furthermore, experts caution of regional unrest due to conflicting international policies. The US special envoy has returned to the region and urged both parties to resolve political and governance disputes urgently.

Northern Ireland was today branded the race hate capital of Europe, in a report on racist violence in the province. Human rights campaigner Doreen Lawrence, mother of murdered black teenager Stephen Lawrence, was in Belfast for the launch of the report by the Northern Ireland Council for Ethnic Minorities (NICEM). The report identified institutionalised racism in the criminal justice system and asked how it should be addressed. Racist violence has been growing in Northern Ireland in recent years, not just against blacks and Asians, but almost anyone considered an outsider.

The life of the mind puzzles poets and neuroscientists who go about mapping it and labeling it , and , despite their efforts, many mysteries remain unsolved. Recent advancements in the study of the human brain have fostered innovative and potentially groundbreaking discoveries in fields such as artificial intelligence and medicine, yet the understanding of the mind continues to elude even the brightest thinkers. Experts remain fascinated and determined in their pursuits to decipher the enigma of human consciousness, emphasizing the complex and interdisciplinary nature of this phenomenon. As research continues to develop and expand, the journey towards comprehending the wonders of the mind is both thrilling and deeply challenging.

RICH KARLGAARD : You should look at 4 areas . One is financial regulations , which still makes it hard for smaller banks to compete against larger ones. Second is healthcare, where the removal of the individual mandate has resulted in instability, leading to higher insurance costs. Third is education, which needs better vocational programs and career mentorship in addition to reformed accreditation laws for colleges. Finally, global relationships, where a successful Phase-1 trade deal with China was concluded, are essential for further progress in international trade policies. Policymakers must prioritize these issues in the coming months to sustain American progress and support growth across different sectors.

In a rare instance , Dhoni , who was not even meant to be on the field of play , interacted with the opposition team in a unique way. During the Celebrity Clasico Charity Football match, former Indian cricket team captain, Mahendra Singh Dhoni, switched roles from playing to refereeing, guiding the All Heart FC and All Stars FC teams throughout the game. While originally not meant to be part of the event, Dhoni made his presence known and showcased his abilities as a fair and effective football referee. The match, which featured actors and cricketers, aimed to raise funds for charity in this special celebrity-driven sporting event.

Rediff.com » Cricket » IPL : Do money , country and age matter ? IPL : Do money , country In the Indian Premier League (IPL), a player's monetary value, age, or nationality don't necessarily define their impact on their team's performance. Regardless of price tag, veteran or upcoming talents like Rashid Khan and Yuzvendra Chahal have shined, showcasing a blend of international experience and fresh ideas. Even if cricketers come from varying backgrounds, the IPL celebrates each team's diverse blend and hails its unity in one goal - striving to lift the coveted IPL trophy.

Less than two years ago , I was seated at a South Atlantic League baseball game ( low A ball ), and now I find myself immersed in a transformative baseball journey. After recent renovations and league restructuring, the league is buzzing with new talent, energetic fan bases, and heightened competition. From improved stadiums, passionate rivalries, to outstanding on-field performances by both established prospects and emerging talents, the South Atlantic League is experiencing an exciting resurgence. With fan attendance consistently rising, it is becoming a staple of summer entertainment and paving the way for a bright future of professional baseball in the region.

When I went to meet Bono at the bar of his hotel, I saw Richard Gere seated at a table with a gorgeous woman in a little fur jacket and a leather cap. Bono, on the other hand, had removed himself to a quiet back room, where he was keeping company with a plump, middle-aged white guy in a suit and tie. (Bono was wearing a T-shirt and a fuzzy sweater whose sleeve needed mending.) This was Randall Tobias, head of the Bush administration's AIDS program. The administration had just announced that the program was providing antiretroviral drugs to 155,000 Africans with AIDS.

A father who broke his back trying to stop thieves from stealing his car has stunned doctors by walking down the aisle at his son’s wedding. Bryan Wright, from Sapcote Road, Burbage, was crippled and left with a punctured lung, eight broken ribs and a broken collarbone when he tried to stop thieves getting away with his car last February. But despite being told he would never walk again, Bryan, 54, defied doctors by walking down the aisle at his son Oliver’s wedding on Friday to Kelly Pickering after months of practice and hard work.

The fourth episode of Aaron Sorkin’s The Newsroom is called “I’ll Try to Fix You.” That may as well be the title of the whole series. Like Sorkin’s The West Wing, the show wants to fix America, this time through the story of Will McAvoy (Jeff Daniels), a successful, cynical and bland cable-news anchor who decides that he, and journalism, and yea, democracy, can do better. Which means what? Will’s producer/ex-girlfriend MacKenzie McHale (Emily Mortimer) explains: “Reclaiming the fourth estate.

( Host ) Two groups involved with mental health care want to know which Vermont doctors got thousands of dollars Two mental health organizations in Vermont are seeking information on which local doctors have received thousands of dollars from major pharmaceutical companies in recent years. These groups believe the pharmaceutical donations could potentially sway the doctors to prescribe particular drugs that might not be suitable for their patients, causing conflicts of interest. The concerned mental health organizations plan to use this information to raise public awareness about the influence of financial incentives and assess the potential impact on overall mental health care in the state.

The Israeli ambassador and almost all staff have been evacuated from the country ’ s embassy in the Jordanian capital The Israeli ambassador and most staff members were evacuated from their embassy in Jordan's capital, Amman, following escalating tensions. This comes after Israeli police killed two Jordanians on 23 July at the Amman embassy compound. Although it was reported as a security incident by Israeli officials, the families of the victims argue they were murdered in cold blood. There is potential for further escalation between Israel and Jordan, already facing political instability amid increasing protest movements demanding for political reforms in both countries.

THE pound has surged against the euro and dollar as Theresa May announced plans to launch a snap election later this year. The Prime Minister plans to hold a General Election on June 8, she said outside Downing Street this morning. The pound is now at its highest level against the US dollar since last December. Sterling ended up 1.6 cents at 1.2762 against the US dollar - a four month high. It has also hit an eight-week high against the euro, ending at 1.1926. The pound had hit a three-week high against the dollar but dropped to 1.25, ahead of May's announcement.

BRUSSELS ( Reuters ) - The European Union is investigating a cyber hack of its diplomatic communications , allegedly by Chinese hackers, after reports indicated over 1,000 sensitive cables were released. The cables exposed EU's concern over Trump's tactics towards adversaries and allies alike, highlighting internal worries over Trump-Russian relations. China’s foreign ministry denied knowledge of the issue, and stated that China "opposes all forms of cyber-attacks". Authorities are continuing investigations and have reinforced data security protection protocols while being in close cooperation with global partners, the EU's External Action Service noted.

COUNTY and district councillor for Axminster, Cllr Ian Hall, has spoken out on his support for the recently agreed Axminster masterplan. Cllr Hall says he “makes no apology” for speaking out on what he believes to be a “once in a lifetime opportunity” for the town. His latest comments follow a decision by East Devon District Council’s strategic planning committee to support the masterplan, which sets out how the town should be developed. Cllr Hall said: “The world around us is changing and we need to evolve as well if we are to avoid our town stagnating or dying.

Nobody can predict with accuracy when stock markets will end their record-setting bull run . But the best way for investors to prepare for an eventual downturn is by focusing on portfolio diversification and long-term investment strategies. Experts advise individuals to balance their asset allocation between different asset classes, such as equities, fixed income, and alternative investments to minimize risk. They also recommend considering the benefits of dollar-cost averaging, a strategy that involves investing equal amounts periodically, regardless of market conditions. By staying disciplined, well-diversified, and focused on long-term goals, investors can weather potential market volatility and build resilient portfolios in uncertain times.

There is no stronger motivation to bury the hatchet than ratings and pending contract negotiations. High above Midtown Manhattan, the front-runner in the Republican race for the presidency and the leading woman in prime-time news met to settle a score. Donald Trump and Megyn Kelly, who have spent the better part of the election cycle publicly feuding, privately fuming, or ignoring one another, met at Trump Tower on Monday, seemingly ending the silence between them. “Yes, the doormen appeared a bit stunned when I walked in,” Kelly said on her Fox News show Wednesday night.

GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Officials with the Piedmont Triad International Airport announced Thursday that Allegiant Air will begin a new, nonstop low-fare flight service from PTI to Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport. The service will begin June 6 with twice-weekly flights from PTI on Thursdays and Sundays. “We’re pleased to announce yet another affordable and convenient way for our Piedmont Triad customers to get away,” said Allegiant president Andrew Levy. The flight time is estimated to be about two hours. Allegiant is offering a special introductory, one-way fare of $64.99.

LATROBE - Ainsley Battles is back in a Pittsburgh Steelers uniform. Battles, a safety, was brought in as a free agent to provide depth in the defensive secondary. Battles, who played his college ball at Vanderbilt, was one of the few undrafted rookie free agents to earn an opening day roster spot for the Steelers in 2000. He spent two seasons with Pittsburgh and one with Jacksonville, playing in 45 games, starting 17, and intercepting three passes. But, Battles lost his love for the game last year and quit just two weeks into training camp with the Buffalo Bills.

Delicious, the original king of shared online bookmarking, is now in the hands of YouTube's founders, after a popular outcry saved it from being shut down by Yahoo. Chad Hurley and Steven Chen, who sold YouTube to Google for $1.65 billion dollars in 2006, will integrate Delicious into their new company, AVOS, and start running Delicious in July. Delicious, one of the pioneers of the idea of taking something users used to do privately and making it public, was snapped up by Yahoo in 2005 for a reported $30 million.

The data center market in Russia continues to grow. One needs to look only at the considerable increase in commissioned facilities to find evidence of this. Consumers are no longer impressed by data centers spanning several thousand square meters, containing 1000 or more racks—these have become de rigeur. According to data provided by Datacenter Dynamics, for the last two years the Russian data-center market is ahead of India, China and Brazil in terms of total investment. Similarly, based on recent construction data from the same period, Russia places second only to Brazil from BRICS nations in terms of total area.

The General Accounting Office reported last month that the Small Business Administration needs to improve its planning for a new financial technology platform to better serve small businesses. According to the GAO, the Small Business Administration's current strategies and estimates lack detail and a proper contingency plan, potentially causing issues for the smooth roll-out of the platform. The SBA agreed with the GAO's findings and pledged to improve its plans by updating project strategies, clarifying costs and timeframe estimates, and addressing risks before the platform's implementation. Enhanced technology will assist small businesses by expediting loans and providing essential support in times of disaster and economic turmoil.

A family travels to a remote island in southern Chile. In the trip they try to convince the grandparents to support them financially to build a hotel in the place. Nicolás, the man who took them over on his boat, disappears, leaving the family trapped on the island, the smiles begin to disappear. With cold, without water and without certainties, tempers are diluted, exposing the tensions that each member of the family hides. Selva (13) discovers that death is just the shedding of our skin. We can become wolfs, goats, shadows or anything that fantasy allows.

That is not surprising considering the nature of the regime. However, in spite of the fact that these were in no way “free” elections, and that many people could not vote as they were in refugee camps beyond the borders of the country, what emerged was that a significant section of the population is backing Assad. Why is this? Stop criminal attack on Gaza! Yesterday, the Israeli army embarked on a ground offensive into Gaza.

There is no stronger motivation to bury the hatchet than ratings and pending contract negotiations . High above Midtown Manhattan , in the penthouse of Fox News, star host Tucker Carlson and Republican leader Senator Lindsey Graham are reportedly negotiating new deals, motivated by impressive ratings and contracts due for renewal. This development comes as both powerhouses look to maintain momentum in their respective spheres and strengthen Fox News' viewer appeal. Their willingness to work together on this may just set a new precedent, leaving the public with the impression that strong ratings trump any past disagreements. Fox News has yet to confirm or comment on these negotiations.

A CONSERVATIVE candidate standing in the local election has been suspended from the party after failing to declare a pending A Conservative party candidate, participating in local elections, has been suspended after neglecting to disclose a pending investigation related to false compensation claims in 2017. An administrative issue had previously halted the unnamed candidate's application to appear as a runner for a council seat. However, after assurances from the person in question regarding no investigations, they were cleared to represent the party. Now that the oversight has come to light, they have been temporarily removed until further clarity can be ascertained on their eligibility.

I have just been reminded of why I quit financial journalism after 11 years in the saddle , including a stint as editor of this website. Yesterday, an influential money manager tore my painstakingly prepared story on alternative lending platforms apart with one line: “PeertoPeer? Alternative lending? Institutional lending already runs 1Huntingdon11lan It!”It’s hardly ground-breaking news that institutional money is spilling into marketplace lending as ‘Pure P2P’; what sets this major British stock-picker apart, he claims that institutions – investors ranging from insurers, investment funds, endowments to local councils, outweigh small investors and pretty much run this segment of finance.

It's been more than a decade since Eminem's one and only starring role in 8 Mile, and you would be fair to assume his acting career had begun and ended right there. But the erstwhile Marshall Mathers was in the running for years to play the lead role in Antoine Fuqua's boxing drama Southpaw, which, like so many other projects, wound up languishing in development. Now the project has been picked up by the Weinstein Company, and though Eminem isn't technically out of the running, he may be on the verge of being replaced by some of the biggest starts out there.

(CNN) - After 8 hours of deliberations Thursday, a St. Louis jury awarded $4.69 billion to 22 women who sued pharmaceutical giant Johnson & Johnson alleging their ovarian cancer was caused by using its powder as a part of their daily feminine hygiene routine. The jury award includes $550 million in compensatory damages and $4.14 billion in punitive damages. It's the largest verdict against the company that has sold Baby Powder and Shower to Shower brand talcum powder for decades. A jury ruled in Johnson & Johnson's favor in one lawsuit in California last November.

DENVER (AP) — The nonpartisan administrator of Colorado’s state Senate has warned staff, aides and interns that policy forbids them from speaking to journalists about workplace issues — including sexual harassment. KUNC-FM reported Tuesday that Senate Secretary Effie Ameen sent two emails reminding workers that giving interviews to reporters is a violation of chamber policy. Ameen sent the emails in February and March as the Senate’s GOP leadership was insisting that sexual misconduct and workplace harassment complaints against lawmakers either be handled confidentially — per the Legislature’s workplace harassment policy — or by prosecutors.

Northern Ireland was today branded the race hate capital of Europe , in a report on racist violence in the A recent report has named Northern Ireland the race hate capital of Europe due to the sharp increase in racist violence throughout the region. Reports show a shocking rise in the number of recorded incidents during the last year. It's suggested that this surge can be partially attributed to Brexit rhetoric and more opportunities for integration and diversity during the post-Covid recovery phase. To mitigate this issue, several organisations are pushing for more unity, strong social ties, and education around anti-racism throughout the nation.

OTTAWA , March 20 ( Reuters ) - In a fresh blow to the embattled government of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, a member of his own party who previously backed the leader, Celina Caesar-Chavannes, decided not to run for re-election in October amid recent accusations of Trudeau meddling in a criminal case. She will sit as an independent MP until October's federal election. This news followed on from an Ipsos poll suggesting that only 22% of Canadians would vote for Trudeau if the election took place today, resulting in Trudeau losing both his majority and leadership status in parliament.

We are recruiting for a Freelance Trainer Assessor to work with us at Apprentice Assessments Limited ( AAL ) . Apprentice Assessments Limited (AAL) is seeking a dedicated Freelance Trainer Assessor to join its team, enabling them to maintain their commitment to providing excellent apprentice assessment services. The ideal candidate would be a motivated self-starter who is able to work closely with apprentices and employers, adapting to various learning styles. In addition to managing assessments and coaching, this opportunity allows individuals to contribute to AAL's reputation and foster career success for apprentices.

BASEL, Switzerland – Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche Holding AG said Monday that it has had reports of 13 cases the H1N1 flu becoming resistant to Tamiflu, which it calls a very low percentage. A good sign is that the people who had the resistant strain have not passed the disease on to other people, said David Reddy, leader of Roche's Tamiflu pandemic task force. And the resistant variety has been like the widespread version of the virus in that it typically produces only mild symptoms. The 13 cases were scattered around the world in Europe, the United States and Asia, said Reddy.

A CANCER expert has hit on a way to kill tumours in two hours — using light . The technique The technique involves inserting optical fibres into a tumor, which then deliver a fatal "dose" of light, destroying cancerous cells within two hours. Oncologist Anant Madabhushi is confident that his groundbreaking research offers a possible "panacea" for all cancer types. It is hoped that the method could not only improve the chances of a complete cure for millions of cancer sufferers, but also result in fewer side effects compared to conventional radiotherapy and chemotherapy. Further trials are set to continue.

Dec 25 ( Reuters ) - The Saudi market fell on Tuesday , as plunging oil prices pressured petrochemical stocks The Saudi stock market fell on Tuesday as collapsing oil prices hit the petrochemical sector. This is the latest dip in a challenging environment that has seen oversupply, geopolitical tensions and faltering investor confidence shaking both economies and markets in the region. Stocks fell over concerns of how decreased oil profits might hurt government income in the hydrocarbon dependent states. Future short term movements for oil markets are said to be tied to multiple complex factors which adds difficulty to setting precise patterns.

When the theme of the convention seems to have been, “Drill, baby, drill,” which is an energy policy in exactly the same way that, “Tax, baby, tax” is a fiscal policy (i.e., it isn’t), slogans are obviously all that the party has left. Even if you think that increasing oil exploration and supply through more offshore drilling makes sense, you cannot really take these people seriously. Unfortunately, yes you can. This, by the way, was the moment when I completely gave up on the convention.

A facility manager wears many hats . It isn ’ t uncommon for a facility manager to lead a meeting discussing budget proposals in the morning and then be seen fixing a leaky faucet later in the day. Due to the versatile nature of their responsibilities, effective facility management is crucial for business efficiency and success. Their key role in coordinating between departments ensures streamlined operations and cost management. With an increased focus on sustainability, many facility managers are now prioritizing green solutions for buildings and spaces. Experts emphasize the need to recognize and adapt to the growing demands placed upon today's facility managers for the greater success of businesses.

NEW DELHI : A day after declaring its candidate for the seventh Lok Sabha seat , the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is stepping up its efforts for the upcoming Lok Sabha elections in New Delhi. AAP named candidates for six out of seven constituencies and is actively working to garner support. Party members have launched campaigns, stressing on increasing resources and votes from door-to-door campaigns and public gatherings. Furthermore, AAP is targeting specific voter groups, such as tenants and people belonging to unauthorised colonies, in order to maximize support for the party in the upcoming elections.

A meeting on the future of Kirkcaldy town centre should include discussions on disabled access , campaigners have insisted . Campaigners have urged a meeting on the future of Kirkcaldy's town centre to discuss improving disabled access to various facilities. With regeneration efforts underway, these activists have highlighted the significance of creating an inclusive environment that addresses mobility issues, while ensuring easier access for wheelchair users, parents with prams, and elderly residents. The meeting will evaluate potential plans to breathe new life into the struggling shopping and leisure centre to rejuvenate Kirkcaldy's local economy.

L.A. cats are cooler. Nite Jewel + Dâm-Funk = Nite Funk in the citay. There's been movement from the highly anticipated Nite Jewel and Dâm-Funk collaboration, Nite Funk. The two first came together for XLR8R magazine's blog, to record a "Tune in an Afternoon," which wound up being called "Am I Gonna Make It." In January, Stones Throw Records CEO Peanut Butter Wolf confirmed that more would come from the freshly dubbed Nite Funk via his label. It seems that day is fast approaching, and as an EP.

Rep. Francis D. Gibson speaks on the Utah Inland Port Authority Bill that he sponsored as Utah Legislators gather at the Utah Capitol in Salt Lake City. Rep. Gibson expressed his satisfaction on the progress made through bipartisan efforts towards the Utah Inland Port Authority Bill. He stressed the bill's ability to foster economic development and job creation in the state by constructing an inland port infrastructure for enhanced global trade. Stakeholders are carefully weighing the port's projected environmental and traffic impact on local communities, while striving for sustainable and inclusive development benefiting all of Utah's citizens.

The lead seal is the first found bearing the image of St. Sabas, local big shot 1,500 years ago. A rare seal from the Crusader era has been found in the Jerusalem neighborhood of Kiryat Yovel. The lead seal, which dates to some 800 years ago, bears the likeness of St. Sabas, one of the most important people active in Jerusalem during the Byzantine period, some 1,500 years ago. Despite the importance of St. Sabas — whose Syriac name is Mar Saba — to Christian history in Israel, no seals with his image had been found before.

Avid has ‘ redesigned and reimagined ’ Media Composer , relaunching it to appeal to future generations of editors . Avid has revamped and relaunched Media Composer, redesigning it to appeal to upcoming generations of editors. The popular video editing software now offers a customisable, paneled interface for greater flexibility, a powerful bin system, dynamic workspaces, and native frame rendering support, along with shared audio libraries and universal mastering across local storage and in the cloud. Additionally, new machine learning-driven audio and visual enhancement tools have been added to streamline and improve the post-production process.

The infamous Kiran Dhawan murder case is all set to take centre stage once again with the police trying to reopen and re-examine the evidence. Kiran Dhawan, a young and aspiring professional, was brutally murdered six years ago in what appeared to be a violent and mysterious crime. The police initially faced multiple dead-ends and lacked substantial leads; however, recent breakthroughs in forensic analysis may help provide new angles in solving the murder case. The case, which once rocked the local community and garnered national attention, could provide much-needed closure to Kiran Dhawan's grieving family and offer justice for her untimely and tragic death.

TRUSTEES of Settle 's Victoria Hall were celebrating this week after hearing they would receive a grant of more than Settle’s Victoria Hall has been granted over £50,000 in a grant awarded by the Garfield Weston Foundation. The funds will go toward repairing the hall's clock tower, balcony, roofs and stonework, among other improvements to its structure. Trustees said the community landmark could have suffered severe long-term damage if it hadn't been able to carry out the repairs. Once completed, the building, which houses more than 180 events and receives nearly 16,000 attendees each year, can continue operating as a leading entertainment venue.

BLOOMINGTON – The U.S. Attorney’s office has charged two local men with conspiring to distribute crack cocaine in the Bloomington area, and a former McLean County assistant state’s attorney is leading the government’s case against the pair. Raymone Stephens,30, and 23-year old Khalil Hood, 23, were two of the four men arrested early Friday morning when authorities raided two apartments on East Empire and another on Fairmont Drive. Stephens and Hood are charged with conspiracy to manufacture and distribute more than 28 grams of crack cocaine, which carry penalties of five to 40 years in prison if they’re found guilty.

Less than two years ago, I was seated at a South Atlantic League baseball game (low A ball) between the Hagerstown Suns and the visiting Greensboro Grasshoppers. Behind me were two Greensboro pitchers — Trevor Richards and Ben Meyer. They were charting the game. As I discussed in this post, neither pitcher seemed destined to make the major leagues. Richards had been undrafted in 2015 coming out of a small college, and thus had to start his career with the Gateway Grizzlies of the Frontier League, an independent league. The Miami Marlins signed him in 2016 and he was pitching well for Greensboro.

After tracking mostly on pace through the first two months of the year , Summit County ’ s real estate market witnessed an uptick in sales during March 2022, according to local reports. Home prices remained high as the limited inventory continued to drive demand in the region. Local real estate agents credited the upswing to an influx of out-of-town buyers seeking resort town homes and properties amid pandemic-driven lifestyle changes. However, affordability challenges persist for the local population, which may fuel further talks about providing more affordable housing solutions. Future real estate growth depends on several factors, including rising mortgage rates and geopolitical influences on the economy.

Austria , Spain and South Korea have been approved as founding members of the Asia Infrastructure and Investment Bank ( AIIB). The multilateral lender said yesterday that this will increase the size of the Bank's potential capital, improving access to global development initiatives. With the new countries approved as Prospective Founding Members, the membership of AIIB will be enlarged to 32. Being an early part of AIIB offers certain countries bargaining powers on different aspects, like governance issues. Founding members have offered subscriptions worth a total of $50 billion while other members joining later will provide about $100 billion additional capital to support AIIB.

The state Board of Corrections at a special called meeting this morning voted without dissent to name interim chief Kevin Murphy as the permanent chief of the state Department of Corrections. The decision came after a comprehensive search for potential candidates to fill the position, with Murphy ultimately deemed the most suited for the role. His extensive experience within the corrections industry, including his recent successful term as interim chief, convinced board members to entrust him with the responsibility of leading the department. Murphy now faces various challenges, such as addressing the overcrowded state prison system, ensuring the welfare of inmates, and overseeing facility improvements.

Girls Like Biology, Boys Like Physics? We all have our stereotypes about which subjects appeal more to girls or boys. Well, in perusing a new report on the Advanced Placement program, I was intrigued to discover some hard data to help shed light on the matter. In addition to reporting participation on AP exams by racial and ethnic groups, the College Board's eighth annual "AP Report to the Nation" includes the gender breakdown for all subjects tested. The data are for public school test-takers from the class of 2011. Some of what I learned may not surprise readers.

The extraordinary mummified remains of a 50-year-old woman discovered in a fetal position is set to go on display at a museum in France. As reported in The Independent, the 1,000-year-old mummy was discovered in 2012 at the ancient Peruvian settlement of Pachacamac near Lima. French archaeologists, who found the mummy crouched in a fetal position, have been careful to preserve the integrity of the remains by keeping it in the same configuration as when it was discovered. The new exhibition at the Musee de Confluences in Lyon will explore various human representations of death in different ages and cultures from around the world.

Summary: Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC (SET) is recalling certain model year 2016 Toyota Yaris, Rav4, Land Cruiser and 4Runner vehicles, and Scion FR-S, iM, and TC vehicles manufactured January 28, 2016, to March 14, 2016. The Load Carrying Capacity Modification Label may not reflect the correct added weight of the installed accessories. As a result, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard number 110, "Tire Selection and Rims for Passenger Cars." Consequence: An incorrect label may result in the vehicle being overloaded, increasing the risk of a crash.

Hudson Technologies Co. , * Pearl River , New York , has been awarded a maximum $ 148,514,169 fixed-price with economic-price-adjustment contract for refrigerant products and accessories. A report is expected to be released Tuesday detailing how an unknown cyber hacker broke into South Carolina's computers and stole millions of tax returns from residents dating back years. NBC's Michael Isikoff reports. COLUMBIA, S.C. -- A single malicious email sent to workers at the South Carolina Department of Revenue last August enabled an international hacker to crack into state computers and gain access to 3.8 million tax returns, including Social Security numbers and bank account information, in what experts say is the biggest cyber-attack ever against a state government, according to details in a report released Tuesday.

WASHINGTON — South Florida has long been a laboratory for some of the nation’s roughest politics, with techniques like phantom candidates created by political rivals to siphon off votes from their opponents, or so-called boleteras hired to illegally fill out stacks of absentee ballots on behalf of elderly or disabled voters. But there was never anything quite like the 2016 election campaign, when a handful of Democratic House candidates became targets of a Russian influence operation that made thousands of pages of documents stolen by hackers from the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee in Washington available to Florida reporters and bloggers.

Google is updating its Google Drive Android app with a new Material Design look, as well as a few new features. First is a small improvement to its search tool – it now updates the results while you’re typing to save you some time while looking for a document. Next up, you can now add messages when you share a file to give details about why you’re sharing, as well as change privacy sharing for files. Finally, the PDF viewer is getting an update to let you search for and copy text from a PDF without needing to enter a separate app.

Volunteer divers have recovered the body of a teenager who went missing when he went swimming in the River Thames after police halted their underwater searches due to poor visibility. Ellis Downes jumped into the water to cool off with friends on Saturday evening, but got into difficulty as he tried to swim back to the riverbank and disappeared from view. The 16-year-old's family were highly critical of Thames Valley Police after the force said it was awaiting specialist teams to continue the underwater searches. Ellis' mother Emma thanked the volunteers, saying: "If it wasn't for you our little boy would still be in that river now."

For small businesses that sell on credit, accounts receivable can make up a substantial portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, auditors will check to see if your claims regarding the accounts receivable balance can be proved. These claims are known as assertions. The most common audit procedure related to accounts receivable is confirmation, in which the auditor will ask your customers to confirm their account balance. Knowing which assertions can be proved by confirmation can help you understand why your auditor asks for multiple audit procedures on the same account. Accounts receivable confirmations mainly serve to prove the existence assertion.

BRUSSELS (Reuters) - The European Union is investigating a cyber hack of its diplomatic communications, allegedly by Chinese hackers, that revealed EU concern about U.S. Donald Trump, Russia and Iran, the bloc said on Wednesday. “The Council Secretariat is aware of allegations regarding a potential leak of sensitive information and is actively investigating the issue,” the body that represents EU governments in Brussels said in a statement. The Secretariat declined to comment further but said it “takes the security of its facilities, including its IT systems, extremely seriously”, referring to concerns about vulnerabilities in its data systems across 28 EU states.
