WASHINGTON -- A Marine who was declared a deserter nearly 10 years ago after disappearing in Iraq and then returning to the U.S. claiming he had been kidnapped, only to disappear again, is back in U.S. custody, officials said Sunday. Cpl. Wassef Ali Hassoun, 34, turned himself in and was being flown Sunday from an undisclosed location in the Middle East to Norfolk, Va. He is to be moved Monday to Camp Lejeune in North Carolina, according to a spokesman, Capt. Eric Flanagan. Maj. Gen. Raymond Fox, commander of the 2nd Marine Expeditionary Force at Lejeune, will determine whether to court martial Hassoun.

Kent, United Kingdom (March 25, 2019) – Hawk-woods, developer of power solutions for the broadcast, film and pro-video industries, is pleased to announce the new 48V-RP power station, a unique power solution which allows users to power ARRI Skypanels and other 48 volt (V) LED lighting when mains power is not available. Hawk-woods new 48V-RP is one of the first power solutions which enables users to run high voltage LEDs at 100% light output via a DC input. “The new 48V-RP power station is an incredible breakthrough that provides ultimate flexibility to content creators.

A father who broke his back trying to stop thieves from stealing his car has stunned doctors by walking down the hospital corridor. The man from Oldham, England was initially told he would not walk again after attempting to save his vehicle from being hijacked in his own driveway. Defying the odds, he spent several weeks in a specialist unit and bravely went through several physiotherapy sessions to rebuild his strength. Amazed doctors credited his rapid progress to the victim's unwavering determination, resilience, and ongoing support from his loved ones, despite initially devastating prospects.

The University of Sri Jayewardenepura celebrated 60 years of excellence in higher education on 18th February 2019, reaching a significant landmark in its historical journey. The Diamonds Jubilee will be celebrated with the participation of President Maithreepala Sirisena, Chancellor, Most Venerable Dr. Ittapana Dhammalankara, Vice Chancellor of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura Senior Prof. Sampath Amaratunge and other dignitaries at the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH) on 2nd April 2019. The rich and vibrant history of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura - initially as the Vidyodaya Pirivena - dates back to 1873.

DENVER -- During the summer of 2002, Colorado state officials were dealing with the 138,000-acre Hayman Fire while trying to let potential tourists know the state was still open for business. That comment all but short-circuited the state’s summer vacation season. This time around, the travel and tourism folks want potential visitors to know less than one-percent of public lands are impacted by wildland fires. When Owens uttered his comments, Colorado had 24 million visitors which spent about $7 billion annually. Denver had 10 million visitors who spent about $2.3 billion. In 2011, Colorado welcomed 58 million visitors who spent $10.7 billion.

Johnny Depp has broken his silence about his controversial casting in Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald. Depp has been off in his world for quite some time now, which has led to some very public controversies. The actor has been accused of domestic violence by his ex-wife Amber Heard, which has not sat well with Harry Potter fans. The fact that the production and J.K. Rowling kept him in the film has left many fans with a feeling of disappointment. When asked about the controversy surrounding his casting in Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald, Johnny Depp did not sidestep the question and answered it.

Can you put a price on faith? That is the question churchgoers are asking as the tradition of tithing -- giving 10% of your income to the church -- is increasingly challenged. Opponents of tithing say it is a misreading of the Bible, a practice created by man, not God. They say they should be free to donate whatever amount they choose, and they are arguing with pastors, writing letters and quitting congregations in protest. In response, some pastors have changed their teaching and rejected what has been a favored form of fund raising for decades.

The likeliest of sources stepped up for the Boston Red Sox on Sunday. David Ortiz, never one to shy away from the big moment, jacked a three-run homer off Joba Chamberlain in the ninth inning to give the Red Sox a 5-3 win over the Detroit Tigers at Comerica Park. The victory snapped Boston’s five-game losing streak and stopped the club’s streak of seven consecutive series ending in sweeps. Ortiz’s heroics obviously put the Red Sox over the top. But there was much more to Sunday’s win, so let’s go over some notes from the nationally televised affair.

The weight-loss company has seen a 66 per cent drop in share prices since the firm's November 2015 high after the former TV host announced she would become the face of the firm. As Oprah Winfrey and her fellow board members hunt for the next CEO of Weight Watchers International (WTW), analysts who follow the company have put forward some suggestions about the top priorities for a successful turnaround. Neither Chambers nor the firm elaborated on the reason for the sudden corporate exit. Shares of Weight Watchers fell more than 7 percent in after-hours trading yesterday following the announcement. The stock has since retreated.

If this was supposed to be a measuring stick game for the Flyers , they came up a bit short The Philadelphia Flyers were hoping to prove their mettle in a crucial game against a formidable opponent, but fell short in their recent match. The team faced fierce competition on the ice and were unable to deliver a winning performance, showing their current standings and statistics don't necessarily correlate with playoff success. This has left fans questioning whether the Flyers have what it takes to be serious contenders, and if the current roster is sufficient to go the distance and potentially take home a championship title in the near future.

The state Board of Corrections at a special called meeting this morning voted without dissent to name interim chief Kevin Murphy as permanent head of the Community Correction Department. There was no change in his existing pay of $123,380. Murphy was put in charge after Gov. Asa Hutchinson fired Sheila Sharp for raising questions about the sufficiency of agency parole and probation officer staffing. Murphy brings a checkered resume to the job. At one time he had a deal being paid by a nonprofit that worked in behalf of agency employees and also drew Correction Department retirement.

The US is pursuing a plan to push Palestinians into northern Sinai and transfer part of the West Bank to The US is reportedly advancing a plan to relocate Palestinians to the northern Sinai region and transfer parts of the West Bank to Israel, sparking outrage and backlash from Palestinians who strongly object to the proposed moves. Despite persistent rejections of the US administration's Middle East proposals by Palestinian leadership, American efforts to resolve the Israeli-Palestinian conflict seem focused on pressuring key players in the region to acquiesce to their proposals, potentially further escalating tensions and frustrations within an already volatile environment.

Albion striker Simon Cox has emerged as a a transfer target for Championship club Derby County . Rams boss Nigel Clough is reportedly interested in the West Bromwich Albion forward, who is set to be out of contract in the summer, as he aims to strengthen his squad for a Championship promotion push. It is unclear whether Albion boss Slaven Bilic will look to cash in on the player in the upcoming January transfer window, or wait for a possible free transfer in the summer. Derby County will be hoping Cox's addition can improve their chances of securing promotion to the English Premier League.

The fourth episode of Aaron Sorkin ’ s The Newsroom is called “ I ’ ll Try to Fix You. In the fourth episode of Aaron Sorkin's The Newsroom, titled "I'll Try to Fix You," the News Night team faces multiple challenges while striving to provide quality news reporting. They take on controversial topics, including a New York law enforcement operation involving an individual on trial for financing terrorist operations. The journalists attempt to seek justice and make personal sacrifices, embodying Sorkin's belief in journalism as a noble and vital force in society.

Maenga is disappointed over your press release against the statement of apology from UTM president Saulos Chilima . If you recall, Chilima issued a public apology for the recent misconduct of UTM members. Maenga, a UTM representative, expressed discontent with your press release, stating that it undermines the party's sincere efforts towards accountability and reconciliation. The representative urges everyone to promote unity and political maturity in addressing such issues. UTM and its leadership will continue their commitment to uphold transparency and adherence to the party's values despite criticisms, with a renewed call for collaboration in pursuing progress for their nation.

England have called up Fulham's uncapped goalkeeper Marcus Bettinelli for the games against Spain and Switzerland, while midfielder Adam Lallana has withdrawn. Bettinelli, 26, was not in Fulham's squad for the first two matches of the season but has regained his place. First-choice keeper Jordan Pickford did not take part in the squad's main training session on Tuesday. Lallana has returned to Liverpool to have a groin strain assessed. The 30-year-old, who did not feature at the World Cup after an injury-disrupted season in 2017-18, joins Raheem Sterling in withdrawing from the squad.

Volunteer divers have recovered the body of a teenager who went missing when he went swimming in the River Thames Volunteer divers have recovered the body of a teenager who went missing when he went swimming in the River Thames on Sunday. The Thames Valley Police revealed that the teenage boy got into difficulty while trying to swim, prompting rescue teams to commence searching the area. Marine volunteers and specialist underwater search teams, including diving specialists from Bristol’s Studio Avon Lake Watch, helped recover the teenager’s body from Cookham Lock.

Japanese manufacturer Mitsubishi will make its first major move into the full-sized MPV market this summer with a stylish and well-equipped competitor to rivals such as the Ford S-MAX and SEAT Alhambra. The new Mitsubishi will target growing families and adventurous travellers alike, focusing on space, comfort, and versatility, offering numerous seating configurations and up to 2,339-litre cargo capacity. Under the hood, expect efficient powertrains and technologies such as smartphone link displays, radar-controlled Forward Collision Mitigation, Mis-Acceleration Mitigation System and Driver Monitoring system to enhance both comfort and safety. Prices for the European market are yet to be announced.

John Tory has his first real competition in the mayor ’ s race . Jennifer Keesmaat , the city ’ 's former chief planner, filed her nomination papers for Toronto's mayoral candidacy just hours before the registration deadline. With Keesmaat now officially entering the race, this could shake up Tory's comfortable position for re-election in the October 22 vote. Keesmaat served as the chief planner of Toronto from 2012 to 2017 and has been an outspoken advocate for various urban issues. In her impromptu campaign launch, she cited Premier Doug Ford’s cuts to the size of Toronto’s city council as motivation to seek the top office.

In the lead up to the Super Bowl last week, NFL Hall of Famer Ladainian Tomlinson gave his projection for the No. 1 pick in the 2019 NFL draft. In the lead up to the Super Bowl last week, NFL Hall of Famer LaDainian Tomlinson offered his prediction for the No. 1 pick in the 2019 NFL draft. Heisman Trophy winning Oklahoma quarterback Kyler Murray. "I think he's going to be the No. 1 pick," Tomlinson said on NFL Network. "I think he's going to be the No. 1 pick.

Hearst Magazines will be busy in 2018 , finalizing the acquisition of Rodale , snapping up some magazines in the Hearst Magazines will be continuing a major expansion of its portfolio in 2018 with the finalisation of its Rodale acquisition and the potential purchase of select Netherlands-based magazine titles. Upon completion, the purchase will see Men's Health, Women's Health, Runner's World and several more Rodale magazines added to Hearst's substantial stable of over 300 publications worldwide. The titles included in this large deal represent an opportunity for Hearst to strengthen its health-focused magazine lineup and foster future growth.

The General Accounting Office reported last month that the Small Business Administration needs to improve its planning for a new database system. SBA had planned to bring the Electronic Loan Input Processing System (ELIPS) which is used to track government-backed small-business loans online last week but GAO said the agency has not shown the project is a good investment. SBA said it did not have time to complete the analysis required by the Clinger-Cohen Act because Congress demanded the system be in place by June 30. The U.S. Army Materiel Command has published a guide for improving teamwork between agencies and contractors.

Bella Hadid Wild Partying And Drinking In NYC: RHOBH Star Gigi Hadid Refuses To “Babysit” Little Sister – Too Busy Modeling! Bella Hadid is a party animal, and the 18 year old’s boozing is getting out of control. Bella, the younger sister of model and fashion icon Gigi Hadid, recently moved to New York City to kickstart her own modeling career, but her modeling gigs have taken a backseat to her partying and excessive drinking. This season of Real Housewives of Beverly Hills featured a distraught Yolanda Foster rushing home from a vacation when she learned that her teen daughter had been arrested for a DUI.

With the economy beginning to stall, Ben Bernanke's war on the nation's savers rolls on. A few of these funds even pay juicy double-digit yields — like the one my Permanent Wealth Investor subscribers have earned 20% on in two years. Dividend harvest funds: These funds buy shares in companies that are about to pay a dividend, and then sell the stock after the dividend is paid. By doing this, they can rotate through companies with different payment dates, and thereby achieve a high dividend payout. The problem is that shares generally trade lower after a dividend is paid, by the amount of the dividend.

The best element of M. Night Shyamalan's 2017 horror film, Split - and one of the few things it did right - happened at the very end. The brief, surprising reveal of Bruce Willis reprising his David Dunn character from Unbreakable created a shared universe that Shyamalan was all-too-eager to exploit. Unfortunately, there's a wide gulf between teasing fans with a momentary appearance and building a story around it. Glass, the third film in what has become a trilogy, comes across as a mix of half-formed ideas baked into an uneven casserole.

Some apps set out to change the world, others are hell-bent on bringing beauty to your pocket gadgets. Beautiful Clock Widgets falls into the latter category. This little Android app does exactly what it says on the label, featuring a collection of clock widgets with the choice of additional data, such as the local weather and battery information. Some are cool, others are funky…and a handful are downright quirky. It’s worth noting here that some are only available through the Pro Version, which costs $1.26, or your local currency equivalent.

The Planning Commission approved a sidewalk extension along a portion of the Laguna Canyon 's frontage road despite opposition from some Laguna Beach residents. The project aims to improve pedestrian safety, particularly for those accessing local homeless services in the area. Although it received approval from the Planning Commission, some residents expressed concerns that the project would lead to more homeless people seeking assistance, potentially impacting public safety and sanitation. The new sidewalk will stretch over half a mile from El Toro Road to the 405 Freeway and is slated for completion in summer 2021.

Former Chicago police officer Jason Van Dyke was sentenced Friday to six years and nine months in the killing of Laquan McDonald. Van Dyke, convicted of second-degree murder and 16 counts of aggravated battery, shot the black teenager 16 times in 2014. This case has received widespread attention due to the initially withheld video of the shooting, and the calls for changes within the Chicago Police Department, resulting in the firing of the police superintendent and changes to training policies. The judge stated that, for this high profile and "polarizing" case, it was the "right decision based on the evidence and the law."

When the theme of the convention seems to have been , “ Drill , baby , drill , ” which echoed across the political landscape and propelled the importance of fossil fuels and natural resources extraction in the United States, a surprising development is now underway. Renewed interests in renewable energy sources and technologies are taking center stage as world leaders and environmental experts recognize the long-term viability and ecological importance of pursuing a greener energy sector. Investment in renewable projects has risen dramatically and initiatives, like electric vehicles and solar power plants, continue to receive growing public support, indicating a turning tide in global efforts toward sustainability and clean energy innovation.

to go on for years ? According to analyses by Net experts , the mass-mailing MyDoom worm , which began spreading rapidly last week, is now one of the most destructive computer viruses ever created. Cybersecurity experts predict that the MyDoom worm could potentially plague users for years due to its advanced spreading capabilities, morphing nature, and strong persistence mechanism. In an effort to fight the malware, tech firms are currently working on providing system updates to block its spreading, but its changing features make it hard to fully prevent damages. Authorities encourage users to remain vigilant about email attachments and constantly update their security software.

Saturday night 's game was exactly like Friday night 's game for the Amarillo Bulls in terms of score and outcome, as they secured another victory against their rivals. Following a tight match, the Amarillo Bulls managed to replicate their Friday night success by defeating their opponents with an identical score on Saturday. With the fans on the edge of their seats, the high-stakes game kept the momentum and excitement alive throughout the night. This back-to-back triumph showcased the Bulls' prowess on the field, putting them in a strong position in the ongoing season, with their sights firmly set on continued success and bringing home further titles.

TICKETS for Manchester United's pre-season friendly against Barcelona are on sale for almost £1,000 each. And a season ticket at Liverpool, at £710, costs less too. Fans are being told to pay £973 for the most expensive seat at the 68,500-capacity Levi's Stadium in California when the footballing giants meet on July 25. It's £48.66 for the cheapest ticket. The Levi's Stadium, which is home to the San Francisco 49ers, is hosting an MLS game between San Jose Earthquakes and Houston Dynamo a day before. Fans who want to see United in action will have to purchase a ticket for that game as well.

Google has long had a testy relationship with China, with the search giant largely pulling out of the Chinese market after alleging that state-backed hackers had targeted the company's systems and employees. Chairman Eric Schmidt's forthcoming book, "The New Digital Age," will not smooth things over, judging by a description of the work by the Wall Street Journal, which has reviewed galleys of the unreleased title. "... in this all-Internet world, China, the book says again and again, is a dangerous and menacing superpower," Tom Gara writes.

NEW YORK — A lawyer whose rant against workers speaking Spanish at a New York City restaurant issued an apology on Tuesday. "To the people I insulted, I apologize. Seeing myself online opened my eyes — the manner in which I expressed myself is unacceptable and is not the person I am. I see my words and actions hurt people, and for that I am deeply sorry. While people should be able to express themselves freely, they should do so calmly and respectfully. What the video did not convey is the real me. I am not racist.

Vodafone has announced changes to its roaming data charges. The new changes will benefit those who useless than 5MB of data per day while abroad. The network's daily charge in Europe from 15 June will be £1 per megabyte for the first 5MB, then £5 for every 5MB thereafter. Outside Europe, the charge is £3 per megabyte for the first 5MB, then £15 per 5MB. The changes will benefit those with minimal data requirements - but those who need to be connected to the internet at all times will be charged more for the privilege.

Keen to kickstart pension reforms, the finance ministry has asked the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) to notify all regulations by the end of the month. The government is also considering giving tax breaks to customers of National Pension Scheme (NPS) at the time of exit. The regulator will soon notify 14 or 15 regulations which will bring in more clarity in the segment. The PFRDA Act was passed in 2013 and notified in February, 2014. The norms will cover the role of various stakeholders, aggregators, trustees, record-keeping agencies and custodians.

A five-day event to promote cultural tourism using creative media will be held in August in the Gobi Desert, in the Inner Mongolia autonomous region. The event, called GobiHeaven, combines camping and creative cultural activities and is intended to create a temporary community where human interaction and co-operation are encouraged. The activities will include music performances, film screenings and a wide range of artwork displays, from painting and sculpture to installation and animation, presenting an inclusive and interactive fusion of culture, creativity and entertainment. The event is being hosted by the China Cultural Media Group.

Ben Finkelor MBA 04, Executive Director of the Energy Efficiency Center (EEC), will introduce GSM Business Partners to the EEC and activities on campus in lighting, HVAC, agriculture, and water efficiency with an eye towards its mission to accelerate the development and commercialization of energy efficient technologies. Ben will then provide a walking tour of West Village, the EEC’s home and the largest planned zero net energy community in the United States, focusing on its technologies and areas of business collaboration. For more information on the EEC, click here.

The entry below is by Katrine Øgaard Jensen , who is one of the founding editors of EuropeNow , a journal of political research, art, and culture. Katrine states that EuropeNow aims to serve as a nexus for European culture in a global context, challenging Eurocentrism and connecting ideas across borders. Recent articles have focused on topics such as Brexit's impact on cultural relations, democracy in post-pandemic Europe, and social integration policies for migrants. As the discourse surrounding the European Union intensifies, EuropeNow seeks to facilitate dialogue and understanding of European culture within an ever-changing global landscape.

JAIPRAKASH HOSPITAL is undergoing a face-lift these days with the wards being whitewashed , painting of walls , etc . Jaiprakash Hospital is currently undergoing renovations to enhance patient care and create a welcoming environment. These refurbishments include a much-needed facelift, consisting of a complete whitewashing of wards, painting the hospital walls and updating the general facilities within the medical centre. These enhancements aim to improve patients' wellbeing and overall healthcare experience, promoting a comfortable and positive atmosphere for the surrounding community as they attend the rejuvenated Jaiprakash Hospital for their health needs.

After the Chiefs’ season came to an end in the AFC Championship Game, Dee Ford said he has no problem with the team using the franchise tag to keep him in the fold in 2019. The Chiefs have not made any announcements about their plans on that front, but it certainly sounds like there are no plans to let Ford get away this offseason. The defensive look is expected to change with Steve Spagnuolo taking over as defensive coordinator for Bob Sutton, but pass rushers are always at a premium and General Manager Brett Veach didn’t sound like he’s preparing to say goodbye to Ford.

Georgetown University is a respected, private university located in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C. This area is also a desired address among the politicians and diplomats that call the nation's capital their home away from home. Georgetown also plays athletics in the Big East Conference. Within three miles of the university you'll find several options that allow you to enjoy everything this area offers. The Georgetown University Hotel and Conference Center (acc-guhotelandconferencecenter.com) is on the north end of the Georgetown University campus, next door to the university hospital and the Lombardi Cancer Center.

Narendra Modi’s Election Challenge: Create Jobs. Lots of Them. The Indian government’s failure to create millions of new jobs for its young population may be its undoing in elections. Aashique Ahmed Iqbal had no reason to think he wouldn’t find a job. Although from a modest background, he’d studied at one of India’s top schools, attended one of its best universities, and completed a doctorate in history at Oxford University after being awarded a highly competitive scholarship. When he returned to India, in 2017, he was optimistic that he could find work as an academic.

A popular chippy which closed in the summer is set to re-open under new management - with a trendy twist The well-loved chippy that closed earlier this summer is gearing up for a reopening with an exciting and fashionable twist, thanks to its new management. Enthusiastic about injecting some modern energy into the iconic food spot, the new owners have re-imagined the chippy, showcasing innovative fish and chip pairings and appealing aesthetics to create an unforgettable dining experience. Details about the reopening date and menu offerings will be announced soon. Stay tuned to indulge in a delectable meal, blending traditional charm with contemporary flavors!

The Korea Offshore and Shipbuilding Association has released numbers confirming the expectations of many analysts: the number of actively operating shipyards around the world has fallen by more than 40 percent from what it was seven years ago. The study defined an active yard as a facility with at least one ship on its backlog. Active Chinese yards were down from 380 to 140 and Japanese yards fell from 70 to 60 over the same period, the association said. Even worse, the biggest shipyards in the world – DSME, Hyundai Heavy and Samsung Heavy – may well have empty space and unused capacity sometime next year.

OMAHA, Neb. – Nebraska men's basketball player Deverell Biggs has been cited on suspicion of driving under the influence and leaving the scene of an accident in Omaha last weekend. According to a police report, Biggs backed his Chevrolet Suburban into a Bellevue man's vehicle about 1:35 a.m. Sunday. Biggs spoke briefly to the other driver and drove off. Police stopped Biggs several miles away. His blood-alcohol content measured .134, over the legal limit of .08. The 20-year-old Biggs also was cited for minor in possession and unsafe backing.

Khloe Kardashian and Kylie Jenner apparently share a ‘ similar ’ due date , following their speculative pregnancies . The Kardashian-Jenner clan might be expecting two new additions as rumors intensify that Khloe Kardashian and her half-sister, Kylie Jenner, are both pregnant with similar due dates. Neither star has officially confirmed the pregnancies, however, sources have cited late February as the due date for Khloe and early March for Kylie. The news follows recent confirmation of Kim Kardashian's surrogacy, creating further anticipation in the entertainment world for the impending expansion of the famous reality TV family.

HARRISBURG, Pa. -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General's Office announced it is releasing more than $55 million in funding to thousands of volunteer fire departments. Officials say the money will be distributed based on population and the number of volunteer fire departments. Excluding Philadelphia, all of the state's remaining 66 counties will receive money. That includes at least $57,000 to every county in northeastern and central Pennsylvania. Luzerne County will receive the largest amount: $1.1 million. Volunteers at the Lake Silkworth Fire Department are dispatched at all hours of the day all over Luzerne County's Back Mountain.

Washington D.C. , Jul 31 , 2018 / 03:01 pm ( ) .- The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority was recently sued for refusing to allow a Christmas-themed advertisement. The Archdiocese of Washington sued the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) after it declined a 2017 advertisement for the archdiocese’s annual “Find the Perfect Gift” campaign. WMATA claimed the advertisement was a breach of their guidelines against the promotion of any religion or religious practices. The Supreme Court refused to hear an appeal in the case, letting a federal appeals court decision to stand, effectively agreeing with WMATA's policy.

Mickey Boodaei has been a leading entrepreneur in the security space for years . He co-founded Imperva , which went public in 2011 and was recently acquired by Thoma Bravo for $2.1 billion. Now, Boodaei's current venture Transmit Security, a digital identity orchestration platform, is worth around $12 billion after it closed a funding round in 2022 led by Lightspeed, Eclipse Ventures, and DoorDash founders Tony Xu, Andy Fang, and Stanley Tang. The funding will be used to expand global presence, grow strategic partnerships, and expedite product innovation, allowing Transmit Security to reinforce its dominance in the global identity management market.

Millennials are not a homogenous group of individuals, so a one-size-fits-all marcomms approach won't work. Millennials want healthy food and are willing to spend more on it. Oh wait, no – Millennials are in debt and want healthy food at affordable prices. They are also self-entitled. But they’re creative and tech-savvy, so that’s a good thing. And don’t try traditional advertising with them, stick to social media. If all of this sounds familiar, that’s because it’s a small glimpse of the countless contradicting reports on Millennials.

In order to cause “a diversion,” foreign actors hit the nation’s key power stations which “had equipment manufactured in Canada,” Maria Zakharova explained, adding that the perpetrators were well aware of “all the algorithms and weak spots” of Venezuela’s power grid. He said that several “saboteurs” have been apprehended while trying to tamper with the power grid. He earlier accused Washington of plotting a coup against him, among other alleged subversive activities.

The response to the bombs by the crowd at the finish line was , I think , exemplary . Sure , there was panic and fear, but overall the people displayed great strength, resilience and solidarity in the face of such a horrific attack. Bystanders immediately rushed to help the injured, demonstrating tremendous compassion and selflessness. Medical staff on site worked tirelessly to provide care, while spectators and local businesses opened their doors and offered shelter and resources. This incident ultimately showcased the collective determination of a community coming together to overcome tragedy and terror.

She ’ d grown up in a predominantly white , working class housing estate . “ We were the only Asian family on the estate and I experienced racism from an early age," she recalls. Through hard work and dedication, she successfully led initiatives to promote cultural understanding, tolerance, and improved living conditions for her community members, contributing to significant progress in overcoming the racial divide that she faced in her childhood years.

A pair of Metro Vancouver thieves have been arrested and charged after they allegedly conducted an extended period of mail and identity theft. After Coquitlam RCMP and Canadian Postal Inspectors worked together to investigate the thefts, investigators identified a primary suspect, made arrests, and used search warrants to acquire a large amount of evidence, according to a November 11 news release from Coquitlam RCMP. Heine Hut, a 49-year-old Surrey man who is well-known to police, is facing six counts of charges that include mail theft, unlawful using a mail key, and possessing stolen mail and a stolen credit card.

He looked the part in his denim and lean muscles. Many fans feel the nickname was an unfortunate byproduct of his success at the time. The Sparks added some much-needed inside muscle Wednesday when they completed a three-team trade with the Charlotte Sting and the Sacramento Monarchs. Center Rhonda Mapp and guard E.C. Hill of Charlotte and forward Latasha Byears of Sacramento joined the Sparks, who sent swing player Allison Feaster and center Clarisse Machanguana to Charlotte and forward La'Keshia Frett to Sacramento. Shiv Sena executive president Uddhav Thackeray has urged Union agriculture minister and Nationalist Congress Party supremo Sharad Pawar to resign from the Union cabinet and come to Maharashtra to protect the interest of farmers reeling under drought. After visiting the house of farmer Gajanan Ghotekar, who recently committed suicide and blamed the Congress and NCP for the plight of farmers in a suicide note, Thackeray told mediapersons here yesterday that he has appealed to the farmers not to vote for NCP and Congress. Uddhav met the family members of the deceased and though he did not offer any instant financial assistance, he promised to bear the expenses of his kids' education.

Arsene Wenger believes the return to fitness of England forward Theo Walcott and imminent recovery of Germany international Lukas Podolski means Arsenal are not under extra pressure to buy another striker in January. The Gunners resume domestic action on Saturday looking to respond from the 1-0 defeat at Manchester United with victory over third-placed Southampton to stay top of the Barclays Premier League. Walcott is set to face his old club following some two months sidelined by an abdominal problem which needed surgery. Podolski, meanwhile, is on course to be available again by the end of December after being out since August 27 with a hamstring injury.

KARACHI : Chief Minister Murad Ali Shah on Tuesday extended Pakistan Rangers , Sindh ’ s special powers , which Chief Minister Murad Ali Shah has extended the special powers of Pakistan Rangers in Sindh province for another 90 days, in a bid to assist law enforcement agencies. The Pakistan Rangers have been stationed in Karachi since 2013, supporting local police in maintaining peace and order, conducting targeted operations against criminals and various politically-affiliated armed wings. They also provide protection for significant installations, sites and personalities. This latest extension will help support police counter ongoing threats in the city of Karachi.

The voter scam has been confirmed in several states , including Mississippi . Louisiana 's chief election officer is warning of similar potential issues as the US general elections approach. Scammers are providing individuals with fraudulent mail-in ballot requests or wrong information regarding mail-in voting, hampering citizens' right to vote. The chief election officers across the states are working closely with law enforcement agencies to counter these tactics, and urge the public to rely on credible sources like state election officials for voting information. As election dates close in, authorities remain vigilant to protect the integrity of the voting process and encourage public awareness.

Trisha Pollard believes the Texas social services system relies too much on the courts to police Medicaid fraud and not Trisha Pollard claims that Texas social services depend excessively on courts to control Medicaid fraud and neglect provider audits. She has called on lawmakers to assist her and her partners in a clinic chain offering behavioral health treatment to mentally ill or violent children from Medicaid families. Pollard highlighted the pressures placed on therapy providers facing tight regulations in Texas to track whether medication billing matched care needs. As well as ending payments if they refused or returned it late, and fined clients and prescribed plans to protect abuse.

Members of Lubbock 's Muslim community reacted with surprise and dismay at the news of the Feb. 23 arrest of Members of Lubbock's Muslim community were shocked and concerned about the arrest of Khalid Ali-M Aldawsari, a 20-year-old student in Lubbock, on February 23. Dr. Sameer Islam, a Muslim community leader, highlighted the importance of providing support for their fellow students in ensuring mental health and social well-being to prevent similar incidents in the future.

COUNTY and district councillor for Axminster , Cllr Ian Hall , has spoken out on his support for the recently launched Mental Health Hub in Axminster, stating its importance for the community amid the challenges faced during the COVID-19 pandemic. Councillor Hall emphasized the need to focus on mental health issues and encourage conversation around the topic, while reducing stigma associated with it. The hub is expected to offer invaluable support to residents by providing assistance with mental health concerns, pointing people in the right direction, and bringing necessary services to the area to combat the existing mental health crisis.

Pine Forest 3, Booker T. Washington 2: Timmy Williams finished with two hits and one RBI to help propel Pine Forest to Wednesday's semifinal game against Tate. Washington tied the game in the top of the seventh before Pine Forest closed the game with authority. Jason Roberts earned the win and had four strikeouts in six innings of work.Pine Forest is the fourth seed in the 1-7A tournament but has a win over top two seeds Tate and Pace this year. Navarre 7, Milton 6: Navarre raced to a 6-1 lead and survived a late rally to advance to the 2-7A finals and clinch a postseason berth.

This month , Drake finished his residency at the O2 Arena in London . But he wasn ’ t quite done with the city, as he surprised fans by making an unexpected appearance at an amateur rap event. Drizzy popped up at the House of Vans's Frampark last night to perform a few of his own songs and show support for London's flourishing underground scene. Fans were thrilled to witness the Canadian star on such an intimate stage and later flooded social media with gratitude. With a high-profile artist like Drake engaging directly with new talent, London's hip-hop scene continues to grow and earn international attention.

President Barack Obama has postponed two stops on his four-nation Asian tour because of the government shutdown. The White House said it was "logistically... not possible" to go ahead with the trips to Malaysia and the Philippines at the end of his tour. But he would still be attending regional summits in Indonesia and Brunei, the White House added. The US government has partially shut down after the two houses of Congress failed to agree a new budget. More than 700,000 federal employees face unpaid leave, and national parks, museums and many buildings are closed.

( CNN ) - After 8 hours of deliberations Thursday , a St. Louis jury awarded $ 4.69 billion to 22 women who alleged Johnson & Johnson's talcum powder products contained asbestos and caused their ovarian cancer. The verdict is a massive blow to the company which currently faces more than 9,000 lawsuits. The damages awarded include $550 million in compensatory damages and $4.14 billion in punitive damages. Johnson & Johnson insists its talc-based products are safe, asbestos-free and are backed by decades of scientific studies, announcing plans to appeal against the verdict.

German business sentiment dropped sharply in October to its lowest in more than 2-1/2 years , the sixth consecutive fall German business sentiment experienced a significant decline in October, reaching its lowest point in over 2.5 years. This marks the sixth consecutive fall for business confidence in the nation, likely fueled by increasing concerns regarding international trade conflicts and potential post-Brexit difficulties for European economies. As Germany is the Eurozone's biggest economy, weakened sentiment may result in heightened caution from consumers and corporations across the zone. This also presents further challenges for European Central Bank as it considers further expansion moves, while hoping for signs of improved momentum.

A collection of powerful short films where children explain , in their own words , what it is like to live with autism is set to be launched online during World Autism Awareness Week, taking place from 29 March to 4 April 2021. The poignant films aim to provide insight into the daily struggles and triumphs of these remarkable youngsters and highlight the importance of understanding, acceptance, and support for those living with autism. As each child shares their unique perspectives and experiences, the project hopes to spark conversation and bridge the communication gap between those on the autistic spectrum and neurotypical individuals, promoting greater inclusion in society.

There ’ s a Speed Graphic camera , once standard equipment in newsrooms across the country . You may have seen one before in old photographs capturing monumental moments in history. This vintage camera model was once considered an essential tool for news photographers and it dominated press photography in the mid-20th century. The Speed Graphic is currently witnessing a revival among photo enthusiasts and collectors, who cherish its impressive build quality, iconic look, and the captivating results it produces. Despite the advent of modern, digital technology in the photography realm, this resurgence reminds us of the charm and significance of traditional, classic equipment in shaping our visual past.

The Weeknd will team up with Daft Punk for a performance at the Grammy Awards. LOS ANGELES (AP) — The Weeknd will team up with Daft Punk for a performance at the Grammy Awards. The collaboration between the singer and the electronic music duo is one of a number of pairings announced Tuesday. Anderson .Paak will take the stage with A Tribe Called Quest and Dave Grohl. Manatees are large , gray aquatic mammals . They have fat bodies — I believe that “ husky ” is the term used these days — with flat , paddle-like tails , flippers , and a couple of deep-set eyes . Unfortunately , manatees are a threatened species . Recent efforts to protect them , however , have shown some success , as the West Indian Manatee population has steadily increased . Now , an influx of the creatures is congregating in Three Sisters Springs , a major habitat , making conservationists cautiously optimistic . To continue safeguarding manatees , it is vital to maintain protections in place and promote their habitats and recovery .

So the Cleveland County native was caught off guard when a powerful hurricane developed in the Atlantic. By Monday, an evacuation order was issued for Jacksonville, North Carolina, where Haire lives now. Haire and her husband, Austin, packed their two cars and headed west toward Cleveland County on Tuesday. Olentangy quarterback Deeb Haber (4) looks for running room during the first half of last Saturday’s first-round showdown against visiting Elyria. Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze is Ukraine's deputy Prime Minister in charge of European affairs. Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze, tasked with European integration, described in an interview the importance of the country’s Association Agreement with the EU. EURACTIV Spain reports. The Ukraine–European Union Association Agreement entered into force on 1 September 1 – an important step for bilateral relations. For the past three months, Ukrainians have been able to travel to the EU without a visa. Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze explained what this agreement entails for her country, what her government has done until now and what Ukraine can offer to the EU.

When George Orwell wrote â€œ1984â€ he included a vision of the future in which people would converse in a language called "Newspeak." While that specific term might not have gained popularity in today's world, Orwell's predicted simplification and transformation of language is evident through various channels, especially with the increased usage of text message and social media abbreviations. Many of today's conversations occur on digital platforms and rely on abbreviations like "OMG," "LOL," and "IDK," while emoji symbols often supplement or even replace textual explanations.

Patrick Warburton, the actor who portrayed David Puddy on "Seinfeld," was in attendance at Wednesday night's Devils game to support the team for Game 4 of New Jersey's first-round series against the Lightning. Warburton painted his face just as he did in the 1995 episode of "Seinfeld" called "The Face Painter." The actor also painted a "D" on his chest and pumped up the crowd with his signature line from the show. "Don't mess with the Devils! We're the Devils! We can beat anybody! The Devils!"

A rumored-to-be pregnant Kylie Jenner was finally caught in public . The 20-year-old was spotted at a construction site in Hidden Hills, California, with her mother Kris Jenner and best friend Jordyn Woods. She sported baggy clothes, continuing to fuel speculation of a potential pregnancy. South Dade will be looking to win its sixth straight Class 3A state title this weekend. South Dade enters the FHSAA state wrestling tournament this weekend as the favorite to win a sixth-straight Class 3A team title, but not as big a favorite as they’ve been in recent seasons. Leading the way for the Bucs are returning state champions Bretli Reyna, Brevin Balmeceda, and Todd Perry. Tyler Orta, Joshua Swan, and Eric Temes have finished on the podium before and their performances this weekend will go a long way toward assuring South Dade wins another team title.

Hetton-born Northern Powergrid boss remembers dad as he gets OBE The Queen ’ s New Year ’ s Honours list Phil Jones, the President and CEO of Northern Powergrid, received an OBE in The Queen's New Year's Honours List. Hetton-born Jones, a fellow at The Energy Institute, dedicated his recognition to his late father. The 28-year Northern Powergrid veteran has successfully led teams that manage investments, construction and performance of a network servicing around 8 million customers. He will work alongside universities and technology leaders under Northern Powergrid's Active Network Management Partnership to push electricity grid developments and position the north of England for economic development.

Brandon Raub , the former Marine taken into custody after federal agents questioned him about Facebook posts critical of the US government, won a free-speech legal battle when the case was dismissed. Authorities involuntarily detained Raub in 2012 due to fears over his mental stability caused by conspiracy-themed Facebook posts. A federal court later ruled that the detention had violated his free-speech rights, and officials recently paid Raub $30,000 as part of the case's settlement. While still critical of the US government, Raub admits he uses better discernment in his postings, seeing the attention his previous actions garnered.

Oden Technologies, a fledgling startup that’s setting out to make factories smarter via big data and its industrial internet of things (IIoT) platform, has raised $10 million in a series A round of funding led by Atomico, with participation from EQT Ventures, Inbox Capital, and a number of other seed investors. Founded out of London in 2014, Oden Technologies provides the hardware and software that lets manufacturers access analytics to track faults and establish patterns that may impact performance. It’s ultimately all about improving efficiency and cutting down on production waste.

Summer is the time to start thinking of how to pack a delicious — and smart — picnic. Eating al fresco isn’t just for Fourth of July. You can pack a basket or cooler and take in free outdoor concerts, simply go for a picnic or whatever you want. Time to start thinking of how to pack a delicious — and smart — picnic. Dover (Del.) Post food columnist Judi Leaming is an avid traveler, so she’s no stranger to packing food to go. She said fresh fruit is one of the best items to pack.

Some apps set out to change the world , others are hell-bent on bringing beauty to your pocket gadgets . As a myriad of smartphone apps become an integral part of our daily lives, there are some apps that aim to have a profound global impact, while others simply enhance the aesthetics of our devices. Apps focused on empowering communities and tackling climate change sit alongside those that enable users to customize their gadget with distinctive and pleasing designs. A seamless blend of practicality and appeal in one app might lead to unique creations catering to users seeking positive change with just a touch of visual charm.

Nobody can predict with accuracy when stock markets will end their record-setting bull run. But the best way for investors to deal with the next downturn is to remain calm and stick to a well-crafted plan. The Star asked Ashley Feinstein Gerstley, author of The 30-Day Money Cleanse: take control of your finances, manage your spending, and de-stress your money for good, about why people have so much trouble handling their own finances — and how they can do better. The Momtract by agency Mother New York gives bossing privileges Instead of flowers or cards . Ad agency Mother New York has created a unique gift idea called the "Momtract" for this year's Mother's Day celebration. This specially designed "contract" will provide moms with a "Day of Yes" in which children are contractually obliged to say "yes" to all the requests and preferences of their mom throughout the day, giving mothers ultimate bossing privileges. Moving away from the conventional Mother's Day gifts, this concept empowers mothers to indulge in all their favorite activities and desires without any pushback from their children.

The foremost name among all such group is that of Bajrang Dal whose activist burnt alive , an Australian missionary Bajrang Dal, the controversial group recently gained international notoriety when one of its activists brutally burned an Australian missionary alive. Despite the appalling incident, no strict measures have been taken against the organization or its members by Indian authorities, prompting concerns over rising religious intolerance and unchecked extremist groups in the country. Experts urge swift legal action and policies that condemn such abhorrent behavior in order to curb extremism and promote peace and religious tolerance across the nation.

President Jacob Zuma believes that the public protector ’ s report on state capture was a political tool meant to South African President Jacob Zuma has dismissed the public protector's state capture report, describing it as a political tool designed to manipulate public perception, rather than reveal a crisis of constitutional government. Amid accusations that Zuma granted favours to an influential family in exchange for lucrative government deals, his legal team insisted the contents of the report should be cross-examined, further delaying a hearing in which opposition parties are calling for Zuma's removal from office.

“ Interaction of Color , ” the landmark 1963 book by Josef Albers — the German-born artist and educator who taught at the famous Bauhaus and Black Mountain College — is getting an AI makeover. The book is a comprehensive study of how color works and influenced countless designers, artists and writers. Researchers from NVIDIA and The Josef & Anni Albers Foundation will use Generative Adversarial Networks to enable color- and data-sensing machines that facilitate creating more interactive applications inspired by Albers' teachings. The project is expected to generate various graphics patterns which have potential applications in textiles, displays and graphic designs while upholding Albers’ color theories.

The best Halloween costumes are inspired by the year ’ s most memorable moments , and 2016 has been nothing short of unforgettable. From high-profile sports stars, like the swimmers at the Rio Olympics, to politics with both controversial candidates and entertaining caricatures, Halloween 2016 is sure to bring interesting costumes. Even some socially provocative attire may make its appearance this year. Popular culture continues to serve as a major source for costumes; shows like Netflix’s 'Stranger Things' or comic book movie sensations like Harley Quinn, have potential for wide popularity, both globally and throughout different age ranges.

Britain's double Olympic triathlon champion Alistair Brownlee claimed a dominant win at the Ironman 70.3 in Dubai in his first event after injury. Brownlee's 2017 season ended in August when he had hip surgery. His time of 3 hours 35 minutes 32 seconds was more than six minutes ahead of second-placed Swiss Sven Riederer. The Dubai event is the first of a triple crown series, with Brownlee on course for a $1m (£703,000) bonus if he claims all three. An Ironman 70.3, or half Ironman, combines a 1.2-mile swim, a 56-mile bike ride, and a 13.1-mile run.

TOKYO ( AFP ) - Nearly half of Tokyo 's residents could not name a single Paralympian and international sporting Almost half of Tokyo residents are unable to name a single Paralympian, suggesting that the athletes lack support and visibility in Japan. Tokyo, which hosts the 2020 Olympic and Paralympic Games, will likely work to raise awareness, bridge the knowledge gap and eliminate the 'root discrimination' by utilizing national sports stars as spokespersons, just as Tatsuru Ueyama urged in Japan’s House of Councilors on World Sight Day, earlier this month.

January 6 , 2017 Affordable Care Act , health insurance , Uncategorized . A new poll released Friday finds one -third of Americans are not aware that Obamacare is another term for the Affordable Care Act (ACA). The findings are relevant since the ACA is about to undergo the threat of dissolution due to partisan conflict between Democrats and Republicans, following calls from president-elect, Donald Trump. As yet, no effective plans have been put forth to replace the policy once removed, a move that would mean the loss of medical insurance to over 20 million people who gained health care access after the passage of the 2010 act.

What Would You Give Up at Work for the Ability to Choose a Mobile Device ? Sybase , a database management company, conducted a study that showed many employees are willing to sacrifice certain perks at work for the ability to choose their preferred mobile device. The study highlights the increasing value workers place on flexibility, functionality and usability of technology to achieve better productivity at work. This preference for user-friendly gadgets and advanced applications also poses a challenge for businesses to provide employees with optimal digital work environments while maintaining high levels of information security and privacy.

The weight-loss company has seen a 66 per cent drop in share prices since the firm 's November 2015 high Weight loss company, Nutrisystem's share prices plummeted by 66% since its peak in November 2015 due to fierce competition from digital apps like Noom and PlateJoy as well as intensified criticism of meal kits’ high content of single-use plastics. To fight back, the company recently introduced personal coaches and engaged new audiences with a range of offers. Nutrisystem currently aims at reversing these market losses in line with expectations in FY2020 following a recovery plan focused on lowering prices and responding to users’ environmental concerns.

The Maine State Lottery tapped Fuseideas as its advertising agency of record. NL Partners of Portland, Maine, previously handled the account. Work will be handled out of the Fuseideas' Portland office and include broadcast, print, out-of-home, point-of-purchase, digital and social media programs for the lottery. The agency will also handle media buying and planning duties. New work debuts in the spring. The Maine State Lottery spent $655,000 on measured media in 2013 and $565,000 in 2014, according to Kantar Media. The Variable was named agency of record for Soffe, an athletic apparel brand, following a competitive pitch.

Guernsey voters are set to elect politicians from an entire island constituency , rather than by the current district system Guernsey voters are set to adopt an entire island constituency electoral system, abandoning the current district setup, as reported by Bailiwick Express. Island-wide voting (IWV) is anticipated to be implemented in 2020 after it gained support during a Guernsey general election on Wednesday. Encompassing around 63,000 people, the move toward an IWV could lead to enhanced inclusivity and democratic processes. It remains to be seen what impact it will have on party politics, campaigning and voter turnout in the coming years.

The traditionally conservative Michelin guide, celebrating its 100th year and a new, leaner look for its mascot, Bibendum, has been generous with stars in France and Switzerland this year. On March 2, three French restaurants were elevated to the highest level in the ratings, three stars. Alain Ducasse's Louis XV in Monte Carlo regained the third star it lost last year, giving Mr. Ducasse a total of six stars; his second three-star restaurant, in Paris, bears his name. Pierre Gagnaire, whose restaurant bears his name, regained the third star he lost in moving from St.-Etienne to Paris two years ago.

Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze is Ukraine 's deputy Prime Minister in charge of European affairs . Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze , responsible for European affairs, recently discussed the country's ambitions to integrate further with Europe, as well as concerns about Russia's influence on its western neighbors. She expressed commitment to deepen cooperation with European nations, not only in trade and politics, but in defense too, adding that she wishes Ukraine to be considered a dependable NATO ally. The minister urged unity between all member states in order to send a clear message of Western principles to counter Moscow's hostility in the region.

Rawalpindi : The secondary students of Sadeeqa ’ s Learning System ( SLS ) Montessori & High School celebrated Autism Awareness Day at their Harley Street campus in Rawalpindi. The event aimed to raise understanding about autism and promote a culture of inclusion for students with autism. Students organized different activities, including informational presentations, skits, and posters, to highlight the importance of empathy and compassion for autistic individuals. The principal of SLS Montessori & High School, Ms. Sadeeqa, emphasized the need for students to support and uplift autistic individuals to ensure they have the best possible quality of life.

I have just been reminded of why I quit financial journalism after 11 years in the saddle, including a spell as a Wall Street correspondent. While the world of finance had its fascinations, I grew increasingly disillusioned by the dominant narrative that it was always about the money, rather than any other considerations such as values and social impacts. They never registered on the radar. That's not altogether surprising, given the testosterone-fuelled dealing rooms and the fact there is very little connection between the decisions of City executives and their impact on ordinary peoples' lives.

Randy Pausch died last Friday . He was the Carnegie Mellon Professor who ’ s “ Last Lecture ” became an internet sensation, inspiring millions worldwide. Pausch, 47, was diagnosed with terminal pancreatic cancer in September 2006 and delivered his profound lecture in September 2007. The poignant speech touched upon living one's dreams and the value of determination, humor, and humbleness in life. It eventually became a best-selling book titled "The Last Lecture." As a lasting testament to Pausch's legacy, the virtual reality pioneer leaves behind powerful life lessons for generations to come.

This quaint home is located at the end of a cul-de-sac which is situated on the highest point in Fairfield Glade. It offers 3BR/2BA with tile or laminate floors throughout. The centerpiece of the rebuild is the warehouse , which was constructed in 1943 , according to the date scrawled on the structure's exposed cement wall. The recent renovation breathes new life into the historical warehouse, transforming it into a versatile and contemporary space for the community. Upgraded with the latest technological features and sustainable materials, the revamped facility now serves as an innovative hub for cultural and educational activities. Local leaders anticipate the project to further boost economic growth and encourage social interaction in the area, with plans for various events such as workshops, seminars, and exhibitions set to be hosted in the rejuvenated venue.

Google is trying to save presentation audiences from having to sit through long rambling questions with a new feature it added to its Slides software on Wednesday. Slides Q&A will let audiences send text questions through the Web when listening to a presentation using Google's software. As a presenter is talking, she can see the questions and respond to them, without waiting for someone to speak into a microphone. Google Slides Q&A's presenter view lets presenters see what people in their audience want to know. In addition to submitting questions, audience members can also vote on which ones they want to see answered.

Richard Randolph Lamb, a resident of Dunsmuir, passed away on September 17, 2009 at Mercy Medical Center in Mount Shasta. Richard was born in Fairview, Montana. He moved to Siskiyou County from Oregon in 1919. Richard was a veteran of the US Navy serving in the Pacific Fleet during World War II. He worked as a railroad engineer for Southern Pacific Railroad for 34 years. Richard was a member of the Veterans of Foreign Wars of Dunsmuir. His hobbies included bowling, cars, music, traveling and love for his family.

From M1917 to M1A2, American tanks have dominated the battlefield. The U.S. Army and Marine Corps are on the cusp of a centennial—the 100th anniversary of the tank in U.S. service. This animated GIF, put together by the folks at partcatalog.com, shows the evolution of the American tank—from the clanky M1917 light tank to the M1A2 Abrams—and shows how the U.S. went from a newcomer to the world of tanks to world leader. The M1917 light tank, for example, was merely a copy of the Renault FT-17. That kind of copycat engineering is an idea that would be unthinkable now.

A bride and groom in Canada spent their first night of marital bliss behind bars after their wedding party turns A Canadian couple began their married life with an unusual twist, as they spent their first night as a married couple in jail due to their wedding reception turning into a drunken brawl. According to local reports, multiple guests in varying stages of inebriation got involved in the fight at the hotel. The exact cause of the fight remains unclear. Police charged the newlyweds with 'causing a disturbance', while guests who allegedly ignited the chaotic situation received one-year bans from staying in that particular hotel.

While giant and spectacular circus shows now roam the Earth , it ’ s good to be reminded how they originated from smaller, more intimate performances that prioritized storytelling and artistry. As large circus companies take center stage globally, local and community-based troupes continue to keep this traditional essence alive. Through carefully crafted acts combining breathtaking acrobatics, thrilling fire shows, and charming character-driven storytelling, these local groups bring a unique touch of nostalgia, magic, and amazement to diverse audiences worldwide. By preserving the cultural roots and reviving interest in traditional circuses, these remarkable troupes contribute to maintaining an important art form for generations to come.

JURGEN KLOPP has revealed his delight at ending Pep Guardiola's 22-game unbeaten run with Manchester City, exclaiming live on air: "What the f**k was that?!" And the Liverpool boss also blasted critics taking aim at his leaky defence, adding: "Blow up my boots!" Klopp was on cloud nine after masterminding a breathless 4-3 win over the title favourites at Anfield this morning. A second-half blitz saw Liverpool race into a 4-1 lead before City grabbed two late goals to set up a nervy ending.

Paytm Money recently added a few features into its iOS app to make it easy for consumers to invest their money. Consumers will now be able to control the app by simply using voice commands. Paytm has integrated Apple’s digital assistant Siri support within its investment and wealth management focused app, Paytm Money. Now iOS users will now be able to view their portfolio value and status upcoming SIPs (Systematic Investment Plans) of mutual fund investments via voice commands. Consumers will be able to get this new feature by updating the app via the app store.

The tide is turning at Frankston, with the Dolphins scoring successive victories for the first time in almost six years with a 13-point win over Collingwood at Victoria Park on Saturday. Coach Simon Goosey had a five-year plan to transform the competition's whipping boys into finals contenders and the results are evident. Frankston knocked off last year's grand finalist Port Melbourne last week and held off a fast-finishing Pies outfit on Saturday. The key, said Goosey, has been getting players drafted into the AFL system. Michael Hibberd, Dylan Van Unen and Mark Baguley are at Essendon while Marcus Marigliani was on the Bombers' list in 2011.

The 27th annual Southwest Iowa Hot Air Balloon Days is underway this weekend in Creston . Balloon committee spokesman Bill The 27th annual Southwest Iowa Hot Air Balloon Days kicked off this weekend in Creston, promising a colorful spectacle for attendees. According to Balloon Committee Spokesman, Bill Dougherty, visitors can expect up to 21 hot air balloons and a host of related activities, including races, night balloon glows, parades and family activities. Furthermore, aircrafts including WWI-era Biplanes, the Wings of Blue parachute team, and experimental airplanes were showcased, attracting visitors and enthusiasts to share in the celebrations.

Magic — that ’ s the best way to describe the Lytton High School Rugby Academy ’ s Hurricanes Championship The Lytton High School Rugby Academy has stunned fans and competitors alike by winning the Hurricanes Championship in spectacular fashion. Health authorities have issued another measles warning after a person travelled on public transport and visited two universities and a grocery shop while infected. The alert is the fourth of its kind in recent weeks. The most recent infected person visited a number of public spaces between Sunday January 27 and Wednesday January 30. 30 January: on train from Aubin Grove to Perth between 10:25 - 11:15am, and from Canning Bridge to Mandurah between 2:20-3:15pm. On bus 100 between Canning Bridge and Cannington between 10:50-11:40am, and bus 101 from Curtin University to Canning Bridge between 2-2:50pm.

Getty Images photographer John Moore will receive the inaugural Impact Award from the Lucie Awards program Sunday at Carnegie Hall in New York City. The awards honor great achievements in photography. Moore will join eight other honorees who will be recognized for their work at the gala ceremony. It's not the first award for the photojournalist who grew up in Irving and graduated from the University of Texas at Austin. He won the 2005 Pulitzer Prize for breaking news photography in 2005, two awards from the Overseas Press Club and Photographer of the Year from Pictures of the Year International, among other honors.

The tide is turning at Frankston , with the Dolphins scoring successive victories for the first time in almost six years. This recent triumph against arch-rival Port Melbourne comes after last week's breakthrough win against Northcote, positioning Frankston Dolphins for a stronger season. Team captain and star player Joe, has made significant contributions in their victory, focusing on enhancing team spirit, discipline, and performance. With renewed confidence, the team and coaching staff remain committed to pursuing further improvements, working on their offensive strategies and agility on the field, potentially paving their way into a championship playoffs run this season.

The New York Knicks approach the quarter-mark of the schedule with a middling 9-9 record as they aim to end their 43-year championship drought. Coach Jeff Hornacek and the Knicks will have the upper hand against opponents in December. In the 15 games they will play this month, only five of those will be against teams with winning records. They’ll host the 5-13 Minnesota Timberwolves on Friday. Joakim Noah, Derrick Rose and Carmelo Anthony are arguably the biggest names on the roster, but they are not playing up to expectations. Anthony’s team-leading 22.2-point scoring average is up slightly from last season.

Without a doubt, the addiction drama “Beautiful Boy” – not the slasher-flick “Halloween” – is the most terrifying movie opening at the multiplex this weekend. Starring Steve Carell (“Foxcatcher”) and Timothee Chalamet (“Call Me by Your Name”), the movie is a chilling and unsettling look at a young man’s plunge into meth addiction (and heroin, pills, pot, etc.) and a devoted father’s efforts to save him. It’s a true and horrifying story so powerful that an uninspired director and clichéd script can’t dilute its impact.

The Internet has changed beyond anything could have foreseen just five years ago. It is no longer a browsing medium: it is full of Web 2.0 applications, real time communications challenges and a whole range of threats that are designed to piggy back on this new usage. As a result, Web security has changed immeasurably - it's no longer enough to block, stop or inhibit IP sessions. Web filtering cannot hope to meet the security challenge. This Webinar will explain how Internet usage has changed and how your perception of IT may not match what your users are actually doing, resulting in your security controls being by-passed.

Brandon Raub, the former Marine taken into custody after federal agents questioned him about Facebook posts critical of the government, has been transferred to a Veterans Administration (VA) psychiatric ward on the other side of the Virginia. The Rutherford Institute, Raub's legal council, released this statement: "Special Justice Walter Douglass Stokes for the General District Court for the City of Hopewell, Va., has denied an emergency motion filed ... to stop ... Raub from being forcibly transferred to a psychiatric facility more than three hours away from his family, friends and legal team."

The overstuffed roster for X-Men : Days of Future Past just got a little bit smaller . Although Anna Paquin 's character, Rogue, had an important role in the comics version of Days of Future Past, her role was significantly reduced in the film adaptation. However, according to Bryan Singer, she is back on board and has "one final entry" with the team. While Anna Paquin herself has remained quiet about the role, we do know that Rogue appears in just one action-packed scene in X-Men: Days of Future Past.

The Supreme Court on Friday asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute ( NEERI ) , Nagpur , and the The Supreme Court has directed the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) and the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board to assess pollution in the Mula and Mutha Rivers due to untreated domestic sewage, including that of approximately 3,600 housing societies in the area. Expressing concern for marine life, the Court asked both organisations to take measures against real estate projects disposing untreated sewage. They will provide their responses by October, determining what action should be taken by relevant agencies and bodies to address the pollution.

Don Draper: Who's crying now? When Jon Hamm last hosted “Saturday Night Live” in January, his monologue traced his supposed pre-“Mad Men” career, featuring clips of him – looking and acting very much like buttoned-down, hyper-self-controlled 1960s ad man Don Draper – in roles ranging from QVC host and to “Def Comedy Jam” comic. “Have you seen them? You know what I’m talking about. Those roundaway girls with their big booties,” a deadpan Hamm/Draper tells the “Def Comedy Jam” audience, clad in a gray suit, scotch in hand.

Vodafone has announced changes to its roaming data charges . Under the updated scheme, Vodafone pay-as-you-go customers will enjoy data access while roaming in Europe, with the new plans cutting down the costs for travelers who want limited data on their devices. The revised structure intends to encourage flexibility and make Vodafone's offers more appealing and cost-effective for those users with moderate data needs when abroad.

VOLGOGRAD/GELENDZHIK , Russia ( Reuters ) - Iceland will try not to melt in the fierce heat of Volgograd when Iceland faces Nigeria in their 2018 FIFA World Cup Group D clash on Friday. Both teams are seeking their first victories of the tournament, with Iceland coming off a strong 1-1 draw against Lionel Messi’s Argentina, and Nigeria aiming to recover from their 2-0 defeat against Croatia. Iceland must now adjust to the sweltering conditions, with the thermometer set to soar over 32C (89.6F), well beyond the Icelandic players' typical experience.

Manfred Weber ( 41 ) is the newly elected chairman of the European People ’ s Party ( EPP ) Manfred Weber (41) has been elected as the new chairman of the European People’s Party (EPP). Weber has the unanimous backing of German Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservative party CDU. During his campaign for the EPP chairmanship, Weber stressed the need for European unity and focused on promoting European values such as solidarity and the defence of fundamental human rights. Weber will guide the largest political party in the European Parliament as it looks to retain its position in the lead up to the 2024 EU parliamentary elections.

Magic — that’s the best way to describe the Lytton High School Rugby Academy’s Hurricanes Championship win in Levin. In only the academy’s second year, the Trish Hina-coached Lytton under-15 girls beat Wanganui 66-0, Feilding 42-0 and Kapiti 49-0 on Day 1. On Day 2, they beat Wairarapa-Bush Combined 61-0 and Mana College 73-5 before hammering Feilding 63-10 in the final. The Lytton team are a tight unit and conceded only three tries in six games. “The girls have worked really hard to get to where they are now,” said Hina, a former Black Fern.

The new head of the national children ’ s hospital board has said it would be “ bad business ” to increase the final cost of the project in line with builders BAM’s claim of over €350m. Tim Bickerstaff, chairman of the Children's Health Ireland board, told the Oireachtas Health Committee that it is working hard to contest the claims, examining each individual bill to determine validity. He emphasized the commitment to maximize public resources without affecting clinical operations. It is essential to find a viable resolution on both cost and claim, as significant public funds must be optimized in delivering essential infrastructure projects, added Bickerstaff.

Moshiach ( also known as messiah ) is the long awaited Jewish leader who will usher in an era of peace and prosperity for all humanity. According to Jewish tradition, Moshiach will gather the Jewish people from exile, rebuild the Holy Temple in Jerusalem, and establish God's rule over the entire world. It is said that there will be no war, disease, or hunger, and love, understanding, and righteousness will reign supreme. Recently, many Jews believe that the world events are leading towards Moshiach's imminent arrival.
