Margaret O ’ Brien , 69 , moved from Canada to Wolverhampton in 1971 , got married , had three children, and established a life in the UK. After applying for a biometric card in 2019 to remain in the country post-Brexit, O’Brien learned that she might not qualify because of a tax error in the 1990s that could affect her eligibility. Though the error was subsequently corrected and taxes were paid, O'Brien faces uncertainty as the UK government conducts a thorough review. She worries about her ability to continue her life in the UK and stay connected to her husband, children, and grandchildren.

Will UBS Tap Bob McCann Or Sallie Krawcheck For Top Wealth Management Job? Former Merill Lynch brokerage head Bob McCann and former Citigroup wealth management bosslady Sallie Krawcheck are both under consideration to take over the top job at UBS's wealth management unit. Investment News reported that two industry recruiters say both names are "already circulating." Earlier, the Financial Times had reported the UBS new chief executive, Oswald Grubel, had decided not to sell the company's US wealth management business yet, despite speculation in recent months that he might offload this business following tax-evasion accusations and the ensuing scandal.

Why’s an incendiary Dutch journalist on the payroll of the ex-Alaska governor’s political action committee? A Mother Jones investigation. In recent months, Sarah Palin’s political action committee, SarahPAC, has paid thousands of dollars to a mysterious company that’s gone to significant lengths to mask its ownership. Addresses linked to the firm lead to mail drops. It has no website. No phone number. Not even the California lawyer who incorporated the company knew who was behind it. But a Mother Jones investigation has found that this firm is run by an unlikely foreign political operative.

Dec 25 (Reuters) - The Saudi market fell on Tuesday, as plunging oil prices pressured petrochemical stocks, while Riyad Bank was the top gainer, reaching a four-year high after saying it was in merger talks with National Commercial Bank (NCB). The Dubai index was the sole gainer of the session, inching up on the back of rises in its banking shares, with most major Gulf bourses slipping on tepid global sentiment and weak oil prices. Oil prices plunged to their lowest level in more than a year on Monday, as fears of an economic slowdown weighed on the market.

There are plenty of products out there that make it possible to create narrated walk-throughs of content, but most of these tend to be either static PowerPoint-style slide shows or video-based walk-throughs. What if instead of static images and files, you wanted to walk people through live Web pages, or even a mix of live Web pages and static content such as images and media? That's the purpose of FlowGram's Flowgrams. Available at flowgram.com, Flowgram is a free beta Web service that lets users combine live Web pages and other content and create a shareable narrated walk-through.

On a chilly winter Tuesday evening, with the sun setting fast, John Stewart almost had the City Park Golf Course to himself. TORONTO — Businesses are asking for major changes to the King St. pilot project or they’ll be considering their options including legal action, says the head of the Ontario Restaurant Hotel and Motel Association. ORHMA President and CEO Tony Elenis said his group has a meeting with Mayor John Tory this Friday where they’re hoping to hear the city will lift its restrictions on private vehicles after 7 p.m. and on weekends. Measures taken by the city to attract customers back to King Street – including $5 off parking – have failed, he said.

There has been a wealth of recent research that has demonstrated that dementia patients greatly benefit from participating in art therapy. Without much fuss or fanfare , but , happily , with plenty of shoppers , Salisbury quietly reopened its central Salisbury's central market quietly reopened without much fuss or fanfare but happily welcomed plenty of shoppers. The event marks a positive step towards returning to normalcy for the local community after recent difficulties due to the pandemic. The return of the market signifies the beginning of the recovery for Salisbury's businesses, which have faced many challenges over the last couple of years.

Google is trying to save presentation audiences from having to sit through long rambling questions with a new feature it calls Q&A in Slides. With the new addition, audience members can submit questions digitally to a speaker during a presentation, which the speaker can either display on the Slides app or on their smart phone. Speakers can also assign a “question sorter” to moderate queries and choose which should be responded to, and a voting mechanism allows audiences to give popular questions prominence. The app updates on 16 November for English speaking iOS and Android users.

Companies looking to offer retirement plans will soon have a new alternative. Automated investment adviser Betterment said today that it will soon offer a 401(k) platform for employers. In other words, your retirement fund may one day be run by code. The wealth management startup has made a name for itself in the past few years for its so-called robo-adviser services. Investors hoping to do more with their money, but who might not be able to afford the hefty fees that come with financial advice from a human, have turned to companies like Betterment, Wealthfront, and FutureAdvisor for help.

The New England Patriots continued their dream run, moving one step closer to a historic NFL season with a flawless record of 17-0. The Pats will now compete in the upcoming AFC Championship game, where a win could secure their place in Super Bowl history as an undefeated team. Battfleck is officially no more! Ben Affleck is officially out as Bruce Wayne in The Batman. And he is passing the torch to a new actor, who has yet to be cast. Recently , my elderly mother visited her bank located in Eastland shopping center in West Covina . On leaving , she realized that she had misplaced her purse containing her bank cards and cash. Panicking, she returned to the bank and reported the loss. Thankfully, a Good Samaritan had found the purse and returned it to the bank staff, who held onto it until her arrival. My mother was incredibly grateful to the unknown individual who helped her in her time of need. This heartwarming incident has reminded her and all of us that there are still kind, caring people in the world.

MELBOURNE, Australia - Defending champion Victoria Azarenka struggled to hold off injured American Jamie Hampton 6-4, 4-6, 6-2 on Saturday before advancing to the fourth round of the Australian Open. Hampton, who needed a medical timeout for a lower back problem before she served out the second set and winced in pain, frequently on the verge of tears, throughout the third, still managed to hit 41 winners to keep the top-ranked Azarenka under pressure. Azarenka appeared frustrated at times, but overcame an early break and fended off triple break point in the seventh game of the deciding set before clinching the match in 2 hours, 9 minutes.

WASHINGTON, March 1 - Coming off a year of record-setting $1 billion-plus natural disasters, representatives of leading insurance companies said today that costs to taxpayers and businesses from extreme weather will continue to soar because of climate change. The insurers joined Sens. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Sheldon Whitehouse (D-R.I.) at a press conference to discuss the mounting financial impact of global warming. Both Vermont and Rhode Island last August felt the brunt of Tropical Storm Irene, one of the record 14 natural disasters in the United States last year that each caused more than $1 billion in damage.

Every year the Howick Village Business Association , in conjunction with Bernard and Diana Harding , host the Howick Village Classic Car Show, which has become a popular annual event, drawing both car enthusiasts and tourists alike to the vibrant town. The Harding's passion for classic cars will once again be showcased, bringing people of all ages together for a day of community celebration. The event promises food, music, entertainment and great local businesses on display to truly put Howick Village on the map as a cultural hub.

Could drain tubes solve Compact conflict ? How do we get more water into the Republican River ? Could it be done by digging trenches, strategically installing drain tubes, and finding a practical and amicable resolution to longstanding water-related disputes between Nebraska and Kansas? Both states, among several others, draw on this critical water source, especially for agricultural purposes. By diverting floodwater through subterranean drain tubes to infiltrate deep underground water systems, the riverside region can manage water surpluses during wet times and return water in dryer times, equitably augmenting overall flow into the Republican River without stirring up legal battles or hampering individual water rights.

Health experts, however, are urging caution and encouraging everyone to maintain COVID-19 safety measures, including social distancing and wearing face masks in public settings. OTTAWA, March 20 (Reuters) - In a fresh blow to the embattled government of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, a legislator quit his ruling Liberal Party to sit as an independent on Wednesday after defending a former minister at the center of a political scandal. Trudeau has been on the defensive since Feb. 7 over allegations top officials working for him leaned on former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to ensure construction firm SNC-Lavalin Group Inc avoided a corruption trial. The political crisis threatens the government's chances of re-election in a vote scheduled for October this year.

GREENSBORO , N.C. -- Officials with the Piedmont Triad International Airport announced Thursday that Allegiant Air will begin a new Officials at Piedmont Triad International Airport have announced that Allegiant Air will launch a new, non-stop service from Greensboro, North Carolina, to Southwest Florida International Airport, beginning November 18, 2021. The route, which is set to offer two flights per week on Sundays and Thursdays, strengthens Greensboro’s domestic network, creating improved access for business and leisure travelers in the Southeast to Florida. Allegiant has also extended its St Petersburg-Clearwater, FL service throughout November and introduced twice-weekly flights to Daytona Beach in August.

This quaint home is located at the end of a cul-de-sac which is situated on the highest point in Fairfield , offering picturesque views of the surrounding area. PREBLE COUNTY — With two serious crashes involving young people occurring in Preble County over the past week , Preble County officials are urging drivers, especially younger ones, to prioritize safety on the roads. Authorities stress the importance of safe driving habits, including following speed limits, wearing seat belts, and avoiding distractions such as texting. Moreover, parents are encouraged to regularly discuss the dangers of reckless driving and possible consequences with their teenagers. Local law enforcement remains committed to educating and assisting residents in keeping the roads safe, reminding everyone to stay vigilant and make responsible choices when behind the wheel.

Singer-turned-actor Kim Hyun-joong is considering a return to the small screen , his agency said Tuesday . According to KeyEast Entertainment agency KeyEast has confirmed that Kim Hyun-joong, the singer-turned-actor, is considering a return to the small screen. He is currently reviewing his casting offer for the new Korean series, That Guy’s Affection (tentative title). It was a situation which baffled many around the world , let alone the passengers on board the British Airways flight. A stowaway clinging to the undercarriage of the plane miraculously survived an almost 10-hour, 5,600-mile journey from South Africa to London in sub-zero temperatures at 38,000 feet. As passengers marveled at his survival story, others raised concerns about airport security. This unlikely occurrence sparks an investigation into the integrity of security measures in airports globally, emphasizing the potential dangers and ensuring necessary precautions are taken to prevent stowaways from putting themselves and others at risk.

JERUSALEM (JTA) — Israel’s military used unnecessary force against protesters in Lebanon who tried to breach the border during demonstrations on Nakba Day, a United Nations report said. The report, given to members of the U.N. Security Council and obtained by the Israeli daily newspaper Haaretz, was prepared by U.N. special coordinator for Lebanon, Michael Williams. Israel’s Foreign Ministry has severed contact with Williams until further notice over the report, according to the newspaper. Seven Lebanese protesters died during the May 14 demonstrations marking the day that Israel became an independent state.

(WXIA) -- New Year's Eve is one of the deadliest drinking holidays of the year. This year, the Governor's Office of Highway Safety is doing more to prevent alcohol-related crashes. According to a release, law enforcement will distribute 50,000 drink coasters in some of the state's busiest bar districts. The coasters will contain a QR code to guide patrons to a directory of services that will help them get home safely if they've had too much to drink. THe GOHS also offers a smartphone app that connects users to cab and tow companies. Check out the Drive Sober app.

There’s a Speed Graphic camera, once standard equipment in newsrooms across the country. You may have seen them in 1930s and ’40s-era movies that featured gaggles of photographers, “Press” placards stuck in there fedora hatbands. Heavy, bulky and requiring light-bulb-sized flashbulbs to shoot at night, a Speed Graphic was the first camera I used professionally, for my high-school yearbook and the paper I worked for part-time while in high school and college. The one in my office used sheet film -- you’d take a shot, pull out the sheet holder, put in another.

BlackBerry has decided not to renew T-Mobile 's license to sell its products . A promotion that went awry last February was partly to blame, it sent a number of BlackBerry customers an offer to switch to the iPhone for $0 down. Despite the hiccups, T-Mobile assured its remaining BlackBerry customers that it will not disrupt ongoing business as they will support BlackBerry’s customers even after discontinuing new products. T-Mobile states the partnership expired naturally after April 25, and not taking the opportunity to sign a new one sends BlackBerry in search of another U.S carrier to help it sell and distribute handsets directly to business customers.

Donald Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's rules prohibiting abusive behavior on the service. On Monday, after a Trump tweet threatened that North Korea might not "be around much longer," Twitter was forced to explain why the President was not banned from the service. In a six-part tweet from Twitter's public policy account, the company said that Twitter takes "newsworthiness" and "public interest" into account when determining whether a user has violated its rules. Those considerations have long been used internally when deciding the fate of a problematic user, Twitter said.

MELBOURNE , Australia - Defending champion Victoria Azarenka struggled to hold off injured American Jamie Hampton 6-4 , 4-6 , 6-2 on Saturday before advancing to the fourth round of the Australian Open. Hampton, playing with a lower back injury, did not give up easily and challenged the defending champion throughout the match, taking the second set from Azarenka. Despite a valiant effort from Hampton, it was ultimately the two-time Australian Open winner who managed to move forward in the Grand Slam, demonstrating that she would not easily be overthrown from her spot.

Royals Hang On For 3-2 Win To Take Lead In World Series : The Two-Way Following two high-scoring games in Kansas City, the World Series has now taken a close-turn, with the Royals beating the Mets 3-2 on Friday to claim the 2-1 advantage in the best-of-seven matchup. Mets' Steven Matz impressed, retiring eight batters and showcasing one memorable offensive play after only five innings. Meanwhile, the Royals bullpen including Hochevar, Morales, Madson and Holland kept up their strengths. Both teams look forward to Game 4 in New York tonight, while maintaining tensions and individual talent.

Californians, of all people, should recognize what it means to drive people off their land. In the 1850s and 1860s, the state funded yearly expeditions that emptied entire areas of their Native American presence. But this is not only a historical phenomenon: In the West Bank, Israeli settlers and the Israeli government have attempted for decades to eradicate the small Palestinian village of Susiya. The village has existed near Hebron since at least the 19th century. In the 1980s, it was declared an archaeological site to enable settlers to move in and replace the former inhabitants.

Ely , in northeastern Minnesota , is the gateway to the sprawling Superior National Forest and its 1 million-acre Boundary Waters Area. Known for its picturesque wilderness and array of recreational activities, Ely and the Superior National Forest have attracted outdoor enthusiasts and nature lovers from across the country. Unfortunately, an extensive drought has now put these popular destinations under threat. Crews of firefighters from the US and Canada are working tirelessly to contain numerous wildfires within the region, with changing weather patterns, such as windy conditions, adding further challenges to their efforts.

Kent , United Kingdom ( March 25 , 2019 ) – Hawk-woods , developer of power solutions for the broadcast industry, announced their innovative Sticky Batteries will soon become the primary portable power source for Cloud One Limited, a professional live production firm. Lightweight and equipped with D-tap sockets and USB outputs, Sticky Batteries can be fastened with multiple attachments directly onto any equipment without the need for cabling or external clamps. According to Tom Whyte, Cloud One Limited Project Engineer, this capability provides enhanced flexibility during live production, potentially speeding up crew response times and lowering system downtime.

First, we looked at which major brands cost the most to maintain over the first 10 years of a car's life. We grouped all years of all models by brand to compute their average cost by brand. In order to estimate annual maintenance costs, we found the amount spent on every two oil changes (as oil changes are generally done every six months). German imports lead the list by a fair margin, which isn't too surprising. Toyota and its two brands, Lexus and Scion, are among the cheapest, saving owners on at least $10,000 over ten years compared to a BMW.

Thr best place to start the mortgage process is to get preapproved by a lender. An important step to buying a home is getting a mortgage. For a first-time buyer, the process can be intimidating, but the best place to start the mortgage process is to get preapproved by a lender. Here are some tips on the process. A preapproval (or prequalification) letter is a document from a lender stating that they are tentatively willing to lend you up to a specific amount of money. Different lenders use the terms prequalification and preapproval differently.

Warm at last, he boarded the bus Wednesday night with a backpack full of supplies and a pocketful of cash from helpful Troy residents.

A focus on community-based and highly personalized experiences, using tools like AI chatbots and immersive property visuals, could be crucial for these platforms. Expect sunshine today as high pressure builds in this weekend . After a cold start , temperatures will warm to the upper 60s to mid-70s, offering a comfortable and bright weekend. Skies will be mostly clear throughout the day, with only occasional patches of clouds. As nighttime falls, temperatures are expected to dip back into the 50s, so make sure to dress warmly for any evening activities. Sunday is projected to follow a similar pattern, allowing for perfect outdoor plans. Overall, residents should enjoy a picture-perfect weekend of great weather before any possible changes arrive in the coming week.

Tech execs discuss the impact automation technologies are having on their organisations . For many organisations and their workers , automation technologies are significantly changing the work landscape. Top tech executives emphasize that automation brings increased productivity and cost reductions, benefiting companies overall. As the technology evolves and advances, job roles may be modified or made obsolete; however, opportunities for upskilling and re-skilling employees in specialized or emerging sectors become available. Executives underscore the importance of adapting to and embracing the changes automation presents, with long-term visions focusing on developing the human potential alongside advancing technology, and driving progress for organizations in a competitive global market.

Edgar Wright has never made a bad movie . He ’ s never even made less than a very good movie. Continuing his impressive streak, Wright's latest project has been generating buzz and excitement among both critics and audiences alike. Expectations are undoubtedly high for this acclaimed filmmaker's next cinematic outing. The success of his past works has established him as a true creative force in the industry. While details remain under wraps, one can safely assume that his newest endeavor will further showcase his ability to craft innovative, entertaining films with his signature visual style and wit.

Rock your worries away from this covered rocking chair porch , while enjoy all the sights and sounds of nature The newly unveiled covered rocking chair porch offers a serene retreat for those seeking solace in the comforting sway of the rocking chairs, coupled with the harmonious symphony of nature's delights. With magnificent views and lush surroundings, one can easily forget their worries while enjoying the quaint charm of this porch. Surrounded by flourishing plants and stunning sceneries, it serves as an ideal destination for contemplation, rejuvenation, and even a leisurely afternoon chat with family and friends.

FOXBOROUGH - They are Camelot's football team, extending perfection (17-0) into the new year, one victory shy of playing in their fourth Super Bowl in seven seasons. The New England Patriots advanced to the AFC Championship game with a 31-20 victory over the Jacksonville Jaguars at Gillette Stadium last night. One week from today Bill Belichick's History Boys will play the San Diego Chargers or Indianapolis Colts in Foxborough for the right to advance to Super Bowl XLII in Arizona Feb. 3. "We played well enough to win," said Belichick. "It gets tougher every step of the way in the playoffs.

BlackBerry has decided not to renew T-Mobile's license to sell its products. A promotion that went awry last month has led BlackBerry to cut ties with T-Mobile after numerous years of working together. BlackBerry on Wednesday announced that it will not renew T-Mobile's license to sell its products when it expires April 25. T-Mobile offended the Canadian phone maker in February when it messaged its BlackBerry users with an offer to switch to the iPhone 5s for $0 down. The Seattle carrier tried to make amends with a second promotion, offering BlackBerry users $200 in credit when they traded in their device for any new T-Mobile phone.

Amitabh Bachchan is not just a legend for his contribution in Hindi cinema but also his inclination towards social welfare Legendary actor Amitabh Bachchan has continued his dedication to social welfare by focusing on vital issues such as child health, literacy, and disaster relief. With his enormous influence, he has consistently drawn public attention to causes that matter, utilizing various mediums such as television shows, online blogs, and social media platforms to raise awareness and funds. Furthermore, the veteran star has associated himself with notable campaigns and non-governmental organizations in order to expand his positive impact on the lives of numerous individuals throughout the nation.

Margaret O’Brien, 69, moved from Canada to Wolverhampton in 1971, got married, had three children and worked for the local council for more than 25 years as a dinner lady, meals on wheels driver, lollipop lady and cleaner. A spinal injury a few years ago meant she had to give up her job, leading her to apply for benefits for the first time. In 2015, she was told her disability payments had been suspended because she was an illegal immigrant. The letter informed her “of our intention to remove you from the UK to your country of nationality if you do not depart voluntarily.

Young African-Americans embrace computers as integral to their futures, but they may be missing out on key opportunities to learn to code, develop apps and software, and innovate with technology, concludes a new national survey. Clark, Arizona State University women and gender studies professor Kimberly A. Scott, and consultant Victoria J. Rideout are the authors behind "The Digital Lives of African American Tweens, Teens, and Parents: Innovating and Learning with Technology." The study, released this month, is based on a national survey of more than 1,000 pairs of African-American teenagers and their parents, as well as focus groups.

Suzuki unearthed improper tests on 6,401 units out of 12,819 since 2012. In a major blow to the Japanese carmaker, Suzuki Motor announced that the company used improper fuel economy and emissions tests on its vehicles in Japan. According to Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport of Japan, Suzuki, along with Mazda and Toyota have accepted to having cheated on the emissions tests and submitted a report of samples of manufactured vehicles selected during the quality assurance process. Moreover, the samples were found to have been tested under incorrect driving conditions. However, the company is not considering product recall at this moment.

If this was supposed to be a measuring stick game for the Flyers, they came up a bit short. Coming off a 12-1-1 dash since Jan. 12, the Flyers skated squarely into a wall named the Tampa Bay Lightning on Tuesday night and it was a reality check. The team with the best record (46-11-4) in the NHL easily skated past the Flyers on the way to a 5-2 win at the Wells Fargo Center, sweeping the season series. With Pittsburgh winning at New Jersey, the Flyers fell back to eight points out of a playoff spot again.

The ride-hailer returns to Taiwan with a redesigned business model that it claims will meet local regulations this time . Ride-hailing giant Uber is making its return to Taiwan with a new business model which it says is compliant with local regulations. Earlier this year, Uber withdrew from the Taiwanese market amid conflicts with government officials over driver permit requirements. The new model focuses on strategic collaboration with taxi and car rental partners rather than recruiting its own private drivers. Uber is keen to avoid repeating tensions that led to millions in unpaid fines and complete suspension of its services in the country.

Moving into modern times, mobile game tool developer Corona Labs has acquired mobile cloud services startup Game Minion. Terms of the deal weren’t disclosed. Corona has one of the most popular software development kits for making mobile games, with more than 200,000 users. But the acquisition will help accelerate the creation of apps for all developers, according to the two companies. The Game Minion services will be rebranded as Corona Cloud. Game Minion, headed by Mohamed Hamedi (pictured right), has developed a full suite of cross-platform cloud services that mobile game developers can adopt and easily insert into their games.

Most Indians do n't ride horses or wear feathers , but in the movies , they always do . Watch A growing awareness regarding cultural representation and stereotypes has been identified in the film industry. Yet, in many movies, Native Indian characters continue to be portrayed as wearing feathers and riding horses, despite such portrayals lacking accuracy for the majority of Indian tribes. Industry experts highlight the need for proper research, consultation, and education about Native cultures to challenge and shift these misconceptions. Authentic and meaningful representation can lead to more opportunities and recognition for indigenous talents while enhancing cultural diversity and historical accuracy in entertainment.

ROSES to actor Donal Logue , known for roles on everything from “ ER ” and “ Grounded for Life Actor Donal Logue is to be commended for his roles on television series such as "ER" and "Grounded for Life". Logue is also remembered for playing Harvey Bullock in "Gotham" and Detective Declan Dunn in the supernatural-themed show "Revelations". He has become a beloved figure in Hollywood with fans appreciating his consistent portrayal of diverse and engaging characters over the years, and it appears that we will be looking forward to more impressive and outstanding work from Logue in the coming years.

Speaker Nabih Berri and Syria ’ s ambassador to Lebanon Friday discussed “ Israeli-Western schemes ” in the Syrian civil Lebanese Speaker Nabih Berri and Syria's ambassador to Lebanon, Ali Abdel Karim Ali, discussed alleged Israeli-Western plans to stir further conflict in the region in relation to the Syrian crisis on Friday. Both called for unity and rejection of occupation policies amid plans by Tel Aviv and Washington to expand influence in the Middle East. Furthermore, Ali presented Berri with a letter from his Syrian counterpart, congratulating the Lebanese speaker on his re-election and urging regional leaders to promote peace and bilateral interests in Syria.

WINTER HAVEN - The city of Winter Haven is offering boxing fitness classes that give everyone who participates a challenging and effective workout, while also providing support to a worthy cause. The program, named 'Give A Hand Up and Boxing', welcomes participants of all ages and abilities for a six-week session, teaching fundamentals and techniques in boxing as a form of exercise. It aims to not only promote physical fitness, but also to develop mental strength, discipline, and self-confidence. Proceeds from the classes will be donated to the Boys & Girls Club of Polk County, positively impacting the lives of many young people.

Brands should resist the temptation to take on a hot-button issue in the Super Bowl as a way to stand out, said Aimee Drolet, professor of marketing and behavioral decision making at the University of California, Los Angeles’s Anderson School of Management. “It’s generally not the best venue for doing that because the audience is so broad, so invariably you’re going to piss off half the people,” she said. Twitter used to be a cool place to share your succinct thoughts. Now al-Shabab, the vicious Somali allies of al-Qaida, is using it as a propaganda venue. al-Shabab began tweeting in English on Wednesday using the handle @HSMPress. (HSM is the English acronym of al-Shabab's more grandiose name, the Harakat al-Shabab al-Mujahideen.) Jack Dorsey and company have yet to verify the account, but it sounds fairly authentic: one Wednesday tweet said the terrorists "welcomed" the surrender of seven Somali government soldiers after they "proclaim[ed] repentance from apostasy."

In fact, the implication from this historically unusual tale is that the Tax Commissioner, Chris Jordan and his team have been doing such a great job cracking down on excessive deductions claims, especially from business. Because of the productivity delivered via computer technology, the tax take for Government is surging.

It's safe to say Cleveland Browns cornerback and ASU alum Damarious Randall wasn't expecting a response like this. After the Warriors advanced to the NBA Finals on Monday night to set up a rematch with the Cleveland Cavaliers, Randall made a guarantee on Twitter: "If the Cleveland Cavaliers win the 2018 NBA finals I’ll buy everyone who retweets this a jersey..."
Well, as of Wednesday afternoon, Randall's tweet has been retweeted over 800,000 times. That's a lot of jerseys -- more than Randall could likely afford to give away.

THE first acknowledgement of Brent Moloney's redemption for an after-match drinking binge came midway through the season when he was quietly reinstated to the club's leadership group. The second, much more public and significant than the first, came last night when he won Melbourne's best and fairest award. Moloney, 27, claimed the Keith ''Bluey'' Truscott Trophy ahead of key defenders Jared Rivers and James Frawley at a function at Crown Palladium. Two of Moloney's midfield teammates, Nathan Jones and Jack Trengove, were fourth and fifth respectively.

By detaining Haniyeh , Israel sent a message that Palestinian cash smuggling is coming to an end . It is unclear how much Haniyeh intended to bring into the Gaza Strip, but it highlights Israel's increasing efforts to crack down on this practice. Authorities will likely continue monitoring movements at crossing points and bolster security measures to curtail these illegal financial activities. While cash smuggling has previously been used to support various factions in the Palestinian territories, Israel's actions aim to eliminate this practice, demonstrating their commitment to fighting illicit money transfers and upholding regional stability.

TICKETS for Manchester United 's pre-season friendly against Barcelona are on sale for almost £1,000 each . And a season ticket at Old Trafford for a youth now costs more than an adult membership for the upcoming 2021-22 season. Prices for the August 8 match at the 100,034-capacity Camp Nou have left many fans enraged, questioning why rates remain inflated despite Covid-19 hardships. Barcelona are reportedly facing £1bn of debt; thus, this high-profile game presents an opportunity for them to alleviate their financial strain, though fan backlash is inevitably proving costly for the image of both clubs.

Vodafone Hutchison Australia ( VHA ) chief Iñaki Berroeta has sought to temper expectations about the imminent rise of 5G Vodafone Hutchison Australia CEO Iñaki Berroeta has attempted to lower expectations about the impending 5G revolution, emphasising there's a difference between launching the new technology and achieving mass market penetration. Speaking in Sydney, Berroeta praised the "initial experiences with 5G," but noted that as happened with previous advances like 2G, it would be five years before consumers can fully take advantage of what the technology has to offer, and maybe 10 years for significant network capability.

WASHINGTON (Alliance News) - Gold prices held steady on Thursday after the Fed's latest report on the economy said businesses across the US have become less optimistic in recent months. Spot gold edged up 0.2% to USD1,294.11 per ounce, while US gold futures were virtually unchanged at USD1,293.75 per ounce. As economic headwinds mount, the Federal Reserve is expected to hold interest rates steady at least until June. The dollar took a breather today after recent gains, while the British pound steadied after British Prime Minister Theresa May won a confidence vote in the parliament and urged lawmakers to break the impasse on a Brexit divorce agreement.

Zoho offers a whopping 43 different applications in its Zoho One cloud suite, but it has more in the works and is betting heavily on artificial intelligence and a new vertical partner strategy to spur further growth. PLEASANTON, Calif.—Despite operating in the shadows of larger enterprise software-as-a-service competitors such as Microsoft, Salesforce and Google, Zoho has managed impressive customer growth for its well-regarded Zoho One application suite. The jump from last year when it had 25 million users to more than 35 million a year later is notable as is the fact Zoho has signed up more than 250,000 companies or organizations as paid customers.

Authorizes Director of the Oregon Department of Aviation to request Department of Transportation to provide certain central business services for The Director of the Oregon Department of Aviation has been given authority to request support from the Department of Transportation (DOT) in providing central business services to ensure operational efficiency. The collaborative effort between the two departments aims to streamline administrative and financial procedures while enhancing the management of resources. With the DOT's support, the Department of Aviation hopes to better focus on achieving its primary goals in a more cost-effective manner. The request will encourage further partnership opportunities between the departments and optimize public services to the Oregon aviation industry.

Casey Brumbeloe , a senior at Stanhope Elmore High School , has been selected to serve on the Alabama State Department of Education Superintendent's Student Advisory Council. Brumbeloe will join 43 other students from across the state to participate in discussions and provide insight on various education-related topics, with a focus on increasing student success in schools. The Student Advisory Council also aims to develop young leaders and foster partnerships between schools, students, and the community. The students are nominated by educators and leaders in their communities, and will engage with state superintendent, Dr. Eric G. Mackey, and Alabama's education board on critical educational issues.

Really ? Was it this complex ? The Green Bay Press-Gazette reports that authorities say they are two to three months away from deciphering the hand-written codes created by Alex Pestic, a cryptanalyst charged with sex trafficking a minor. Local authorities requested the help of the FBI and world-renowned crypto experts to break the multi-layered codes found on hidden messages in his mobile phone, iCloud, computer and Google maps after seizing these assets following a separate raid at his home last year. They believe cracking the codes may unveil critical information about sex trafficking operations in Wisconsin and Michigan.

VIDEO : On March 30 , 2017 , Atlanta drivers on I-85 north found themselves in a stunning situation when a huge fire caused a bridge to collapse. Over 200,000 cars were being re-routed around the bridge repair work in a commute expected to last months. Two lanes of the collapsed interstate have been restored temporarily by Georgia officials who provided $3 million worth of incentives to construction workers. Much work is still needed, with this early success not marking the end of repairs; nevertheless, workers are speeding up repairs so the area returns to normal sooner.

US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha recently opened the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel in Jeddah. The event brought together more than 10 American businesses alongside 28 local participants, aiming to further US-Saudi business relationships in the food and beverages sectors. Saudi companies took the opportunity to discover a diverse selection of high-quality US products at the trade show. With the significant investments being made to grow Saudi Arabia's food sector, both countries expressed a shared interest in maintaining strong partnerships.

Manfred Weber (41) is the newly elected chairman of the European People’s Party (EPP), the largest political group represented in the European Parliament following the 2014 elections. He hails from Germany’s Bavarian conservative Christian Social Union (CSU). Weber spoke with EURACTIV Germany’s Dario Sarmadi. David Cameron wants the United Kingdom to leave the EU if Jean-Claude Juncker becomes president of the European Commission. What do you have to say to the British prime minister? The United Kingdom belongs in the EU – and is, itself, stronger within the community.

New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio isn ’ t visiting Israel until August . But that doesn ’ t mean he isn't showing support in the meantime. On June 2nd, he announced the release of his city's open source “COVID Alert” software on GitHub for countries worldwide to access, including Israel. The software is a real-time indicator system used to inform of high infection rates in businesses and other public settings, such as offices or universities. The NYC mayor expressed his solidarity with Israel amid its COVID-19 battle, providing technical support and assisting them in saving lives with their robust technological system.

Herts Baseball Club has been awarded a £10,000 grant from Sport England to launch the club ’ s branch in Herts Baseball Club has received a £10,000 grant from Sport England to establish a new branch in Harlow, Essex. The funds will support equipment purchase, coach and umpire training, facilities hire and events organisation to aid the club's expansion. It will also increase opportunities for Essex residents to play baseball at both beginner and advanced levels. President of Herts Baseball Club, Aspi Dimitrov, has stated that the grant's award shows baseball is continuing to develop in Britain and aims to transform Harlow into an East Anglian baseball hotspot.

They look a bit frightful , but vultures are nature 's greatest cleanup crew . They 're amazing creatures with incredible adaptations, feasting on carcasses to prevent the spread of diseases. Sadly, vulture populations are dwindling across the world due to human factors, like habitat destruction, poisoning, and persecution. Efforts to protect them are now more vital than ever, as scientists stress the ecological importance of these natural waste managers. Initiatives like International Vulture Awareness Day aim to promote conservation awareness and highlight the irreplaceable roles that vultures play in maintaining a balanced ecosystem for future generations to inherit.

Upbeat on their maiden housing project in Cavite , property developer Century Properties Group Inc. ( CPG ) and Mitsubishi Property developer Century Properties Group Inc. (CPG) and Mitsubishi Corporation are optimistic about their maiden housing project in Cavite. Construction will start later this year with pre-sales available from February 2022. CPG president and CEO, Marco Antonio, stated the launch reflects a booming domestic real estate industry, underscoring significant local demand amid enhanced business confidence and favourable investment conditions. The PhP10bn ($208m) investment signals the companies’ commitment to ongoing joint housing projects aimed at young middle and middle-income families in emerging Philippine urban centres.

Craig Watson ( top ) and Lee Stephenson have been jailed for 21 years combined after an armed robbery on Craig Watson and Lee Stephenson were sentenced to a combined 21 years in jail for committing an armed robbery on an LV12 gasoline tankers lorry delivery. The men attacked the driver, causing serious injury and damage during their heist at Warters and Pollington services, wherein they stole £17,240 of cash. Watson, responsible for the operation's coordination and recruiting Stephenson, was sentenced to 11 years in prison, while Stephenson received a 10-year sentence. This verdict followed a guilty plea from both men earlier this year.

We had a very colourful guest in our studio today. Meet "the Union Jack man" who's earned the title of the Royal family's biggest fan. Terry Hutt from Weston-super-Mare has spent a lifetime following the Royal's around the country, even spending 10 days camped outside St Mary's hospital in London for Princess Charlotte's birth, at the age of 79. Prince Philip will not make any further official appearances in the South West after announcing his retirement. The 95 year-old will step down from service in the autumn and there are no scheduled engagements in the West Country before then.

On Saturday, August 8th, Ukraine’s Interfax News Service announced that the Security Bureau of Ukraine had just issued, on Friday, a list of 14 ‘artists’ (mainly Russian actors) who ‘pose a threat to Ukraine’s national security.’ The Ukrainian State Film Agency is, under Ukrainian law, now prohibited from authorizing or allowing distribution of their films or other works. These artists are thus officially banned. The list also includes French actor Gerard Depardieu, and even Russian economist Mikhail Khazin. Khazin claims that the gold price has been manipulated downward, and that gold is therefore way undervalued.

Maureen Wildes argues it is time to find out the true impact of the Vietnam War on the veterans ' Researcher Maureen Wildes urges for a better understanding of the long-term consequences the Vietnam War has had on the lives of its veterans. Wildes believes there is a dire need for comprehensive analysis of medical records, mental health statuses, and other well-being indicators. In her opinion, existing research falls short and oftentimes portrays incomplete results of how the war impacted not only veterans but their families too. Therefore, this investigation will serve to finally reveal the truth behind the sacrifices made and advocate for more targeted resources for veterans moving forward.

Edgar Wright has never made a bad movie. He’s never even made less than a very good movie, and so it makes sense that thus far in his career, Wright has shied away from straight-up sequels. However, that could possibly change with Baby Driver. When Shaun of the Dead was a massive hit, instead of capitalizing on that with a zombie follow-up, Wright, Simon Pegg, and Nick Frost instead made a thematically connected trio of films—the Cornetto Trilogy—with the also excellent Hot Fuzz and The World’s End.

New research suggests mice with induced Alzheimer ’ s-like symptoms had improved cognitive function when given a synthetic estrogen-like hormone New research indicates that mice with induced Alzheimer's-like symptoms experienced improved cognitive function when treated with a synthetic estrogen-like hormone. Scientists injected the hormone, called indazole chloride (IndCl), into mice over eight weeks and noticed a significant improvement in their brain health and mental abilities. Additionally, the IndCl appeared to lower harmful brain inflammation without triggering uterine cancer, a known risk for traditional hormone replacement therapy. The research may pave the way for further studies and treatment options to combat cognitive decline related to Alzheimer's in humans.

Former Rep. Stephanie Herseth Sandlin ( D-S.D . ) is eager to start her K Street practice and has not ruled out a political return. She is building her federal government relations and lobbying business as a partner at Dentons law firm. The work covers agriculture and tax policy, as well as telecommunications, trade, intellectual property, and cybersecurity. Sandlin believes her focus on collaborative problem solving and reducing divisiveness will resonate well. While enjoying her career in K Street practice, Sandlin does not rule out returning to politics as public service was "very rewarding."

After the Chiefs ’ season came to an end in the AFC Championship Game , Dee Ford said he has not given much thought to his future, focusing instead on learning from the loss. As he prepares to become a free agent in March, Ford shared his gratitude towards the Chiefs' organization for their support throughout the season, as well as embracing his potential final year with them. A franchise tag remains a possibility to retain the 27-year-old Pro Bowler, who garnered 13 sacks, tied for the sixth-best record in the league during the 2018 NFL regular season.

Dublin: Lawmakers overwhelmingly voted on Friday to back Ireland's first bill on abortion, legalising the practice in exceptional cases where doctors deem the woman's life at risk from her pregnancy, as the predominantly Catholic country took its first legislative step away from an outright ban. Exhausted legislators applauded Friday's 127-31 vote, while outside the parliament gates abortion rights activists cheered as they watched the result on their smartphones. It capped a grueling debate that locked lawmakers in argument from Wednesday morning to 5am Thursday and, after a pause for sleep, through midnight Friday.

ARLINGTON, Texas (AP) - Mike Minor got to finish what he started, something the lefty never got a chance to do for the Texas Rangers last season in his return to a rotation. The Angels are 2-14 in their last 16 road games dating back to last September - a span in which they are 12-2 at home. ... The Rangers have homered in all 10 of their home games, the longest season-opening home HR streak in Texas history. ... It was the second shutout of the season for Texas, both at home after having only one shutout win at home last season.

Johnny Depp has broken his silence about his controversial casting in Fantastic Beasts : The Crimes of Grindelwald . Depp acknowledged the backlash against his casting as Gellert Grindelwald, claiming that the allegations of abuse from his ex-wife Amber Heard were untrue. The 55-year-old actor, along with writer J.K. Rowling and director David Yates, defended the decision for Depp to remain in the movie amidst controversy. Depp maintained his innocence and insisted that he would always uphold and respect the truth. Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald premiered in November 2018, generating more than $653m in box office worldwide.

About 300 villagers from Kandal province locked in land disputes with private companies delivered petitions to embassies in Phnom Penh Around 300 Cambodian villagers from Kandal province are embroiled in land disputes with private companies and have submitted petitions to the Japanese and German embassies in Phnom Penh, seeking their assistance in negotiating the land compensation settlement terms offered by major sugar manufacturing companies Phnom Penh Sugar and Kampong Speu Sugar. Most villagers had declined offers, claiming insufficient compensation from the sugar manufacturers leading to about 12 villages still holding land. Human rights violations due to land development projects have sparked nationwide unrest, even escalating into violence in recent months.

Israeli troops shoot a Palestinian teenager at a roadblock in the occupied West Bank. Egypt has been trying to broker a truce between Israel and Hamas, a Palestinian organisation which has de facto control of Gaza, to avoid an escalation in violence near the Gaza border. The air raids came shortly after Israeli forces shot and killed a 16-year-old boy near the occupied West Bank city of Nablus. Michal Ya'akov, an Israeli military spokesman, said he saw a man acting strangely at the Hawara checkpoint on Monday, which caused the soldiers to believe he was armed with explosives.

JERUSALEM ( JTA ) — Israel ’ s military used unnecessary force against protesters in Lebanon who tried to breach Israel's military has been accused of using unnecessary force against Lebanese protesters who attempted to breach the border fence during recent protests. At least two Lebanese nationals were killed, with over 120 injured, as Israeli soldiers fired warning shots to contain the escalating tensions. Israel asserts that they are trying to maintain law and order at the borders. The human rights group Adalah, which petitioned Israel's Supreme Court over the military’s shoot-to-kill policy, says Israel employs “a sweeping application” of this policy for unlawful reasons.

A communications professor at Texas A & M University wanted to find out about the effects of changes to the communications landscape on political events, so he utilized artificial intelligence (AI) tools to track 300,000 US political ads aired over six years. The AI analysed language, tone and other attributes of the adverts, categorising each one as positive or negative. Results indicated that social media has intensified polarisation and distrust between political parties, leading to increasingly negative content in ads. However, more positive messaging in candidates' advertisements translated into improved electoral results.

WASHINGTON - RFK Stadium , the once and future home of major league baseball in the nation 's capital , is preparing to host the inaugural Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in 2022. The groundbreaking T20 event, organized by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE), aims to introduce a high-profile cricket league and further promote the sport's growth in the US. As part of the renovation, the historic stadium's design and infrastructure will be adapted to support world-class cricketing events, adhering to the international standards set by the International Cricket Council.

The Korea Offshore and Shipbuilding Association has released numbers confirming the expectations of many analysts : the number of actively The Korea Offshore and Shipbuilding Association confirmed industry analysts' expectations of dwindling activity in the nation's shipyards. Actively employed workers plummeted to 31,181 as of the end of May this year, representing a 62% decrease in staff numbers compared to January 2020. As companies confront ongoing supply chain issues and surging construction costs amid the global pandemic, South Korean shipyards struggle to remain profitable, resulting in restructuring processes and cutting manpower as many ships on order were either cancelled or indefinitely deferred.

AURORA , Ill. – A suburban teen has died after a tragic accident in the parking lot of a high school in Aurora, Illinois. According to Aurora Police Department, the incident occurred when a 15-year-old boy slipped in front of a moving car in a school parking lot while walking with a group of friends. The car, driven by another teenager, struck the victim causing serious head injuries. Paramedics rushed the injured teen to a nearby hospital, but he succumbed to his injuries the following day. Authorities are conducting a thorough investigation, but currently believe it was an unfortunate accident with no criminal intent.

Sign on to RootsAction ’ s petition to the nation ’ s mayors and police chiefs affirming your support for A new RootsAction petition is urging the mayors and police chiefs in the US to express their commitment to defunding their local police forces in a strategic manner to move resources toward important public services such as education, healthcare, mental health, and addressing housing disparities. The initiative comes amidst nationwide protests in response to police brutality, particularly against Black individuals, as well as calls for increased police accountability and dismantling of systemic racism in the US.

FORT LAUDERDALE — The Dillard High School Jazz Band will hold a concert on Oct. 22 at the African-American Research Library and Cultural Center in Fort Lauderdale, FL. The event aims to provide a platform for the talented group of students to showcase their musical abilities while offering an entertaining performance for the community. As part of the rich musical history of the school, the Jazz Band contributes to both local arts initiatives and jazz education efforts in the region. Tickets to attend the concert are priced at $5 for students and $10 for general admission, with proceeds supporting the Dillard High School Jazz Band.

DARTMOUTH — On June 14, Flag Day, the students of the James M. Quinn Elementary School in Dartmouth gathered outside to celebrate Flag Day. This in itself is not unusual, but this year it took on a more personal meaning. The reason being is that Dr. Carol Karafotis' cousin, Ted Cote from New Bedford is serving in Iraq. Earlier in the year around Veteran's Day, Dr. Karafotis asked her students to send cards to Staff Sergeant Cote in order to cheer him up. The students responded and made cards that were then sent to Iraq.

Gaza is the world ’ s biggest prison . Nearly two million Palestinian people are locked up there by Israel , in a state of blockade and extreme deprivation. Recently, Qatar stepped up to help Gaza by distributing $10 million among impoverished families, yet only a few individuals have managed to obtain it. Unfortunately, the divide within Gaza between the civilian authorities and their rulers is partly responsible for prolonging their own citizens’ hardships, particularly between Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas and the Palestinian party, Hamas. The prospect for peace remains distant as hostilities between Palestinians and Israelis persist.

Why we love it: Few things are as stylish as a goodnight’s sleep. After all, a restful night can leave you looking fresh — and feeling refreshed — in the morning. Perhaps one of the biggest factors that contributes to catching quality Zs is a good mattress. The new mattress, which is available in sizes ranging from twin to California king, is crafted with five layers of “premium” foam, including a one-inch “flo” foam, 1.5-inch latex foam, 1.5-inch viscoelastic memory foam, 1.5-inch high resiliency foam with supportive gel pods and more.

HARRISBURG , Pa. -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General 's Office announced it is releasing more than $ 55 million in funds to assist fire departments with services and maintenance across Pennsylvania. These payments, stemming from a 2% state tax on fire insurance purchased by residents from out-of-state companies, will benefit 2,518 municipalities throughout the state. The distribution of funds is critical to ensuring that volunteer fire companies can continue protecting citizens from emergencies and natural disasters. Auditor General Timothy DeFoor emphasized the crucial role these fire companies play, stating they save Pennsylvania approximately $ 10 billion in would-be taxes every year.

find ... Ron Brown of AAG Archaeology with the netty door . Below , the Westoe Netty painting . A famous 19th-century door discovered during a dig led by archaeologist Ron Brown and his AAG Archaeology team has been found to be the entrance to the renowned "Westoe Netty" – a historic public toilet depicted in artist Robert Olley's iconic 1972 painting. Brown believes the archaeological find sheds light on a previously undocumented part of South Shields history and expects to attract attention from the local and art communities. The Westoe Netty has long held a special place in regional culture, symbolising local industry, humour, and resilience.

Micron Technology ( MU ) stock is climbing Tuesday after the company reported third-quarter earnings and revenue above analysts ' Micron Technology's stock is surging after posting strong Q3 results, with revenue and earnings surpassing analysts' expectations. The firm, known for its memory chip production, reportedly generated around $6.14bn in net sales, a significant YoY increase from the $5.56bn last year, beating market consensus by nearly $90m. Furthermore, adjusted EPS amounted to $1.88, easily passing by last year's value at $1.82 per share.

Google recently launched real estate features including home services advertising and will soon unveil a mortgage comparison tool . Google has recently introduced real estate features such as home services advertising, aiming to connect homeowners with various service professionals. Following this, Google is set to unveil a mortgage comparison tool that would help potential homebuyers compare mortgage rates and deals from multiple lenders, streamlining the process of obtaining a mortgage. These new real estate initiatives expand the tech giant's portfolio and cater to both buyers and homeowners, all within a user-friendly platform on Google Search.

Seabees from Naval Mobile Construction Battalion ( NMCB ) 7 and members of the U.S. Army Alpha Company , 427th Brigade Support Battalion have joined forces in a combined exercise to construct a critical non-standard logistics building for tactical use. The US Navy's Seabees and the US Army have shared resources and construction techniques in the collaborative mission. The state-of-the-art logistics facility will significantly enhance the strategic operational readiness and functionality of the two battalions, as well as improve joint expeditionary and force integration capabilities, enabling a higher level of interoperability during joint and coalition operations. This alliance highlights the essential bond and collaboration within US military branches.

Tom Petty – who was on stage alongside Prince when the late superstar played in tribute to George Harrison at the 2004 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame ceremony – has spoken about Prince’s performance that day. The performance of The Beatles‘ ‘While My Guitar Gently Weeps’ saw the pair play alongside Jeff Lynne and Steve Winwood at the 2004 induction, and has been getting a lot of attention since Prince passed away last week, on April 21. The cause of Prince’s death has not yet been confirmed, though earlier today it was revealed that an investigation into a possible overdose is underway.

It is easy to lose democratic mechanisms but difficult to get them back , says the incoming General Secretary of the International Trade Union Confederation (ITUC), Sharan Burrow. Amidst the global trend of authoritarian rule, Burrow warns that society must maintain democratic accountability or risk permanent loss of workers' rights. ITUC advocates for inclusive policies, strengthening both local unions and international labor organizations in upholding democratic standards. With economies navigating digital transition, unions demand access to lifelong learning for employees, and shared governance for decisions shaping digital policies.

UNITED NATIONS, August 26 -- Amid an increasing drumbeat of media coverage predicting US missile strikes on Syria, regardless of what the UN chemical weapons investigation team finds in the suburbs of Damascus, a question has arisen whether the strikes would take place with the UN team still in the country. Q: In regards to Syria, Britain and the US officials have suggested that an investigation at this point might be without result because Damascus has had time to cover up some of the evidence. What does the UN hope to find from this investigation? What actions would the UN be willing to take?

[ Written by Jonathan Starling ] It is not unusual to read and hear complaints about the amount of trash that piles up during Bermuda's biggest events, such as the Cup Match or the County Games. However, environmental charity Keep Bermuda Beautiful (KBB) and insurer Allied World are trying to resolve this issue by launching the All In on World Oceans Day initiative on 8 June. The partnership aims to boost volunteers to assist with cleaning up during such events, while promoting environmental awareness among island residents. Through various sports groups and schools, the programme also seeks to incorporate 90 littering projects by October.

A police officer has been struck from the force for his behaviour with his partner during their relationship. A Northamptonshire Police officer who strangled his girlfriend in her bedroom and told her he would 'kill her' has been dismissed from the force. It was a year before the former partner of PC Greg Mead went to the police to report her experiences at his hands during their relationship 2018 and early 2018. But at a misconduct hearing over the officer's behaviour, the 28-year-old told the panel how Mr Mead lost his temper in violent ways on several occasions during their time together.

Suzuki unearthed improper tests on 6,401 units out of 12,819 since 2012 . In a major blow to the Japanese automaker, Suzuki, they have admitted to using improper fuel economy tests for 6,401 of the total 12,819 units since 2012. The scandal erupted after Mitsubishi recently admitted to the falsification of test results for over 30 years in certain mini-car models. Suzuki is further expected to face heat as investors worry about the penalty or damages resulting from such misconduct in test procedures, which could in turn increase cash-outflow by greater marketing efforts to maintain business reputation.

Be glad you are n't Jim Furyk today . 1 . The American team entered Sunday with a massive four -point lead at the 2021 Ryder Cup, on their way to a resounding victory. But despite their triumph, Jim Furyk had a Sunday to forget, struggling on the course and carding a disappointing score. The 51-year-old, making his ninth Ryder Cup appearance, failed to live up to expectations, losing key matchups that could have further secured the win for Team USA. Nonetheless, Furyk's teammates were there to pick up the slack and ensure a victorious end to the tournament.

The sixth race of the Charlevoix Yacht Club 's summer series was sailed on Aug. 8 in light and variable wind conditions. The unpredictable weather led to a thrilling contest, with participants needing to display great tactical skill and adaptability. Various boats maneuvered closely for prime position, showcasing tight races across the different categories. Competitors and spectators alike were entertained by the impressive performances on display, highlighting the exciting sailing conditions and vibrant atmosphere within the Charlevoix Yacht Club's summer series. Further races in the series are highly anticipated as the excitement and competition continue to heat up on the waters of Lake Michigan.

NEW YORK — Just before noon on Wednesday, Australian ambassador and president of the United Nations Arms Trade Treaty conference, Peter Woolcott, released his final version of the global gun control agreement. Upon publication of the document, Woolcott informed delegates that they have 24 hours to confer with their respective governments and then report tomorrow for a final vote. For so many reasons, the United States delegation must choose the latter option. A few sections of the proposed agreement are provided below, each of which would require the federal government to unconstitutionally infringe upon the right of Americans to keep and bear arms as protected by the Second Amendment.

LOS ANGELES (AP) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will have surgery Wednesday to repair torn ligaments in his severely sprained right ankle. An MRI exam on Monday confirmed the Kings' leading scorer will need corrective surgery that will keep him out indefinitely. Kopitar injured his ankle when he fell awkwardly during the Kings' victory over Colorado last Saturday. Coach Terry Murray initially said the Slovenian All-Star broke his ankle and would be out for at least six weeks, but the Kings eventually determined the injury was a high ankle sprain. Kopitar leads the Kings with 25 goals and 43 assists.

After The Floods, Colorado Hospital Braces For Winter : Shots - Health News A hospital in Estes Park, Colo., escaped the flood damage that affected much of the area this month. But the small hospital in the mountains now relies on a single road to evacuate critical patients. A bad snowstorm could stop traffic and ground helicopters, leaving the hospital isolated. As snow begins falling in Colorado's Rocky Mountain National Park, the town at its doorstep, finds itself newly isolated. The only year-round road into or out of Estes Park, Colo., now is the Peak to Peak Highway.

Art Vs. Science took to the stage at Club NME at Camden 's KOKO on Friday ( May 7 ) Australian electronic trio, Art Vs. Science, electrified the audience with their thrilling performance at Club NME in Camden's iconic KOKO venue on Friday, May 7th. Leon Conaway , 56 , who was owner and operator of Twisted Roots , entered a plea agreement that recommending 56-year-old Leon Conaway, former owner and operator of Twisted Roots, has entered a plea agreement which could reduce his original sentence to just four years. Conaway faced up to 40 years in prison after confessing to various white-collar crimes, including conspiring to defraud over 500 people through his New Jersey-based restaurant scheme. Under this plea agreement, federal prosecutors now recommend a sentencing of between 37 to 46 months for the serial conman. The decision to accept or decline this recommendation remains with U.S. District Court Judge Anne E. Thompson.

Now the-90-year-old from Portsmouth has had last wish granted to see the Blues play one last time thanks to a A 90-year-old Portsmouth F.C. fan, whose dying wish was to see his beloved team play one last time, has had his wish granted. A virtual reality experience allowed him to watch the game from his home. The setup provided live footage through special goggles that enabled the man to be virtually present in the stadium, cheering for his favorite team, despite being miles away. The club's matchday programme and community radio announcer contributed towards completing the lifelike experience for the lifelong supporter.

Shares of AOL Inc. shot up 19 % in premarket trade Tuesday , after the Internet content company agreed to be acquired by telecommunications company Verizon Communications Inc. for approximately $4.4 billion. Verizon said the move is a bid to grow its video streaming and advertising revenue, expanding its advertising potential in mobile-video to a much larger content inventory. As for AOL, it remains a key force in modern marketing tech with approximately 190 million current users around the globe. AOL is also the owner of other media titles such as TechCrunch, Huffington Post and Engadget.

The company said improved realisation, better operating parameters and reduced finance cost contributed to increased profitability during the quarter. JK Paper on Tuesday reported a 72.26 percent jump in standalone net profit to Rs 120.26 crore for the third quarter ended December 2018 on account of improved realisation, better operating parameters and reduced finance cost. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 69.81 crore in the October-December quarter last year. Total income during the quarter under review rose 10.94 percent to Rs 883.11 crore. It stood at Rs 796.01 crore in the December quarter of 2017-18, JK Paper said in a BSE filing.

Man robs jewellery on crutches! A man with a bandaged leg and using crutches fled a British hospital after allegedly steeling three gold rings from a jewellery shop there, police said. Police said the theft occurred Wednesday when the man asked to see the rings before grabbing them and running onto the grounds of Cardiff's University of Wales Hospital. The man described as heavyset and in his 30s or 40s took a nine carat white gold diamond ring, an 18 carat white gold ring and a 19 carat white gold ring with diamond studs.

DELRAY BEACH — Overdoses are on the decline in Delray Beach , continuing a trend that started last year . However, the city remains committed to strengthening strategies and vigilance in order to sustain and amplify the downward trend in drug overdose rates.

The location of the potential Maroon Creek Reservoir, which would be located just below the confluence of East and West Maroon creeks, in view of the Maroon Bells, and partially in the Maroon Bells-Snowmass Wilderness. Manatees are large, gray aquatic mammals. They have fat bodies — I believe that “husky” is how clothing companies would attempt to get manatees to buy big jeans — that taper to a flat, paddle-shaped tail. Average adult manatees are about 10 feet long and weigh 800 to 1,200 pounds. Manatees are among God’s ugliest creatures in the ocean, and there are a lot of strange-looking seagoing creatures. Those are facts — well, the ugly observation is an opinion, but it’s obvious enough to be fact — that I learned from the Save the Manatee Club website.

FAU defeated Louisiana Tech in convincing fashion, 69-61, behind a big game from Xavian Stapleton. The Owls (13-9, 4-5 Conference USA) took their first lead of the game with 13:33 to go in the first half and didn’t look back, holding on to the advantage over the Bulldogs (15-7, 5-4 C-USA) for the rest of the night. A Catholic church in Port Aransas is left without a priest after he was removed Wednesday by the bishop of the Diocese of Corpus Christi. Rev. Krzysztof Bauta, known as Father Kris by his parishioners, said he was called into the bishop's office Wednesday and was told he was being removed from St. Joseph Parish. "I was very distraught and shocked," Bauta said. "I asked him why and I was not given a reason." He received a letter from the Bishop Michael Mulvey that states the removal "is for the just cause of the pastoral good of the people of St. Joseph Parish."

A report is expected to be released Tuesday detailing how an unknown cyber hacker broke into South Carolina 's computers A cyberattack on South Carolina's computer system is set to be examined in an upcoming report scheduled for release on Tuesday. The incident involved an unidentified hacker gaining access to the state's computers, with further details surrounding the event and the subsequent consequences of the breach still under investigation. Authorities have been made aware of the situation and have worked towards taking appropriate action. In recent years, cyberattacks on public institutions have increased, underlining the significance of ongoing improvements to online security to defend against cyber threats.

In order to cause “ a diversion , ” foreign actors hit the nation ’ s key power stations which resulted in widespread blackouts across the country. Authorities believe this attack, likely perpetrated by hackers sponsored by an unidentified hostile government, aimed to divert attention from another major operation occurring simultaneously. Critical infrastructure, including healthcare facilities, experienced massive disruptions as security forces and power station operators scrambled to restore power. As of now, some areas still face outages and investigations are underway to determine the extent of the damage caused. Experts call for immediate steps to enhance the resilience of vital services against such sophisticated cyberattacks.

At the wake for United States Army Air Corps Lt. William Flynn , Jack Flynn saw a short man pin ing something on the casket of his brother William, who passed away recently. To Jack's surprise, the mysterious guest was Uncle Richie – Richard Morgan. A year later, 98-year-old World War II veteran Richard reveals how he earned three Distinguished Flying Crosses for "an act of gallantry and intrepidity". Sharing previously untold memories, Richard brings comfort and closure to the Flynn family, emphasizing the bond they shared in the United States Army Air Corps.

There are plenty of products out there that make it possible to create narrated walk-throughs of content , but most of them require installation or downloads. Shuffle, a new web app, simplifies the process by providing users with a straightforward online platform for crafting video narrations without any installation needed. With its drag-and-drop interface, users can incorporate various forms of media such as images, audio files, GIFs, and videos while simultaneously narrating the content. Offering numerous templates, timeline editing options, and browser-based screen recording capabilities, Shuffle aims to enhance presentations and training materials, thus making video narration creation an accessible and efficient task for everyone.

A woman was threatened when she was approached by a stranger in a street in Lindfield yesterday afternoon. Police say that the woman was walking along Barncroft Drive, Lindfield, between 4.45pm and 5.30pm yesterday when she was grabbed by a white bearded man in his late 40s or early 50s. The man made verbal threats to her but ran off after a group of about 15 teenagers walked into Barncroft Drive. Police say the woman was not physically injured. A spokesman said: “The investigation into this incident is at an early stage and the exact motive has not been established.

A popular chippy which closed in the summer is set to re-open under new management - with a trendy twist. The former Nash's on Harrogate Road in Chapel Allerton shut in August after the family decided to sell the business, leaving the suburb without a fish and chip shop for the first time since the 1960s. Now it has been taken over by new owners who intend to re-open it as a fish restaurant and beer hall. The building was purchased by local estate agents Stoneacre, who were keen to retain its heritage as a fish and chip shop.
