Ray Trew has stepped down as chairman of Notts County and has announced that the League Two club is for sale. Trew became owner and chairman in 2010 but said he made the decision after his family were subjected to "foul and mindless abuse" in recent days. Notts, who appointed Jamie Fullarton as manager in January, are 16th in League Two having been relegated last season. BBC Radio Nottingham reports local businessman Alan Hardy is in talks to buy the club. "It is with very mixed emotions that I announce the end of my tenure," Trew wrote in an open letter to fans.

Patrick Warburton , the actor who portrayed David Puddy on `` Seinfeld , '' was in attendance at Wednesday night Patrick Warburton, famously known as David Puddy on "Seinfeld", made an appearance at the NHL playoff game between New Jersey Devils and Tampa Bay Lightning on Wednesday night. Embracing his famous character's love for the Devils, Warburton sported a red shirt and face paint while leading a boisterous cheering section, just like he did on "Seinfeld" back in 1995. The excitement created a frenzy among "Seinfeld" fans, though the Devils ultimately lost the match 3-1.

The new head of the national children’s hospital board has said it would be “bad business” for the State to allow the main builder of the hospital to step down from its role. The chair designate of the board Fred Barry, who is appearing before the Oireachtas Committee on Health this morning, also said that there was an “underestimation” from a very early stage in relation to what the project would cost, leading to an increased bill of € 1.73 billion up from the estimated € 800 million cost in 2014.

Part two of Naomi Klein's report on the events that triggered a momentous new kind of politics in Argentina. Up until quite recently, Argentina pursued a policy of official amnesia when it came to the crimes of the Dirty War. Sure, the human rights non-governmental organisations still issued numerous scathing reports, the Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo still marched and the children of disappeared parents still showed up, from time to time, outside the homes of ex-military figures to throw red paint. But before the Argentinazo, most middle-class Argentinians regarded such actions as macabre rituals from a bygone era.

The annual meeting of the Kelly Gang is normally a festive affair . The get-together , the brainchild of New York businessman Denis Leary, attracts well-heeled, wealthy clients who fork out tens of thousands of dollars for charity. However, this year, tensions flared during the auction at Kelly Gang's 17th annual St. Patrick’s Day dinner event. Proceeds from the high-profile auction support families who are victims of unforeseen medical crises, while celebrities rub shoulders in the name of charity. Nonetheless, bidding wars spiraled out of control, raising tensions amid festivities, proving this year's meeting was unlike any other in its history.

A police officer has been struck from the force for his behaviour with his partner during their relationship . A disciplinary hearing found that the unnamed officer had exhibited "bullying" and "coercive" behaviour, leading to his dismissal from the police department. The panel determined that the officer's actions constituted gross misconduct, thus warranting immediate dismissal without any benefits. Authorities emphasized that such behavior will not be tolerated in the force, reaffirming their commitment to ensuring the highest professional standards and ethical conduct among all personnel. It remains unclear if the ex-officer will face any criminal charges for his conduct in the now-ended relationship.

[prMac.com] San Rafael, California - Audio technology company, Soundness is pleased to announce availability of SoundSoap+, based on the award-winning SoundSoap audio noise reduction software for Mac and Windows. SoundSoap is consumer-friendly software that solves audio noise problems like unwanted hiss and background noises, clicks, pops, crackles, electrical hum, rumble, clipping, and low volume in media files. SoundSoap+ includes all the features of SoundSoap, and provides several powerful additional controls for pinpoint accuracy in audio restoration work. SoundSoap is so easy to use that even average consumers can use it to fix audio noise problems, without requiring any audio expertise.

First , we looked at which major brands cost the most to maintain over the first 10 years of a car's life. Luxury brands BMW and Mercedes-Benz were the most expensive, averaging nearly $1,800 in maintenance costs per year, according to data collected. More budget-friendly brands, such as Toyota, Honda, and Ford, averaged about half of that at around $900 per year. Long-term maintenance costs should be a consideration for consumers when purchasing a vehicle, as higher costs may not only strain their budget but could also impact resale value, particularly for luxury models.

Why we love it : Few things are as stylish as a goodnight ’ s sleep . After all , a well-rested individual exudes confidence and charm throughout the day. According to recent research, sleep plays a critical role in both physical and mental wellbeing. In response to our ever-busy lifestyles, luxury brands and startups alike have taken note and begun investing in innovations for better sleep. From sleep-friendly wearables to stylish yet comfy sleepwear, technology now allows individuals to embrace a quality bedtime routine. A combination of elegant aesthetics, sleep-enhancing materials, and cutting-edge sleep technologies is revolutionizing the way we rest, one night at a time.

There has been a wealth of recent research that has demonstrated that dementia patients greatly benefit from participating in art therapy programs. Experts have found that engaging in artistic activities, such as painting or drawing, can help stimulate cognitive function, reduce agitation, and improve overall well-being in individuals with dementia. This form of therapy not only helps maintain memory and language skills but also enables them to express their thoughts and emotions in a more interactive manner. Furthermore, these positive outcomes extend to caregivers as well, allowing for improved communication and more meaningful relationships with their dementia-stricken loved ones.

Forget announcing your latest album with a gigantic, budget-crippling open-air concert - Oasis have been hiring street musicians to do the heavy promo work for them. A gaggle of buskers and street performers were collected on Friday to perform new Oasis songs at various sites around Manhattan. The ragtag group included violinists, guitarists, and – we can only hope – some of those human statues covered in gold spray paint. From subway platforms to park clearings, they played across the five boroughs – even in the pouring rain. Thoth and Dominic Del Principe were some of those who got rained on.

The Supreme Court on Friday asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI), Nagpur, and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to look into a proposal by Agra Nagar Nigam to set up a waste-to-energy plant. Agra falls under the Taj Trapezium Zone, an area of about 10,400 sq km spread over the districts of Firozabad, Mathura, Hathras and Etah in Uttar Pradesh and the Bharatpur district of Rajasthan. Agra Nagar Nigam, an urban local body, sought permission of the top court to set up a waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur landfill site.

If you 've come to this page , you 've probably decided that it 's time to make physical activity a priority in your life. Well, you're not alone, as a growing number of people are recognizing the importance of exercise in maintaining their overall well-being. Numerous studies have highlighted the benefits of regular exercise, including better weight management, improved mental health, and reduced risk of chronic diseases. Gyms and fitness clubs are also implementing innovative approaches to accommodate busy schedules, while tech advancements offer convenient tools for tracking fitness goals.

The first time I heard these verses was in a small storefront church in Kiev , Ukraine . I remember the emotions that washed over me as the congregation passionately recited these verses, each member clinging to their faith in these challenging times. Despite facing economic and political uncertainties, the community seemed undeterred and drew strength from their unwavering belief in a higher power. Their resilience inspired those present, leading many to forge deep connections with others who shared their convictions. This experience not only gave hope to the worshippers but also showcased the universal impact that spiritual unity can have amidst difficult circumstances.

A family dog has been shot dead after police chased down two teens accused of stealing a car on the Gold Coast in Australia. The German Shepherd, named Pipi, was shot after allegedly confronting officers who were attempting to apprehend the two teenage suspects. Pipi was reportedly hit by a ricocheting bullet meant to scare the dog away, but ultimately caused the fatal injury. Both teenagers, aged 16 and 17, have been arrested in connection with the alleged car theft. The Queensland Police Department is facing heavy criticism over their handling of the situation, while expressing their sympathies and extending apologies to the affected family.

The incline bench press is a strength-training move to build your chest and fronts of the shoulders . The move involves an adjustable bench set at an angle, targeting the upper chest muscles and anterior deltoids more effectively than a flat bench press. Fitness experts suggest incorporating the incline bench press into your workout routine to enhance upper body strength, improve muscle balance, and create a well-rounded physique. However, proper form and execution are crucial for maximizing gains and reducing the risk of injuries. Beginners are advised to start with lighter weights and gradually increase resistance for steady progress and overall chest development.

Will Chelsea switch gears vs. Arsenal? Judging by his body language, you would never think Chelsea is only two points off the top of the Premier League table. After an extra-time defeat to Sunderland in Tuesday’s Capital One Cup quarterfinal, Jose Mourinho cut a bedraggled figure, a strange mixture of irritability, weariness and defiance. "We may have to take a step back in order to be more consistent at the back,” he said. “It’s something I don’t want to do, to play more counterattacking, but I’m giving it serious thought.

LL Cool J has become the first rapper to receive the prestigious Kennedy Centre Honour at the weekend, in a ceremony which also recognised Gloria Estefan and Lionel Richie. LL Cool J has become the first rapper to receive the prestigious Kennedy Centre Honour. The 'Mama Said Knock You Out' hitmaker was recognised with the US' highest achievement for a performer in a ceremony on Saturday (02.12.17) evening, with Lionel Richie, Gloria Estefan, 'All in the Family' producer Norman Lear and dancer-and-actress Carmen de Lavallade also picking up the accolade at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington D.C..

A bride and groom in Canada spent their first night of marital bliss behind bars after their wedding party turns into a bar brawl. The wild husband and wife fisticuffs erupted at Denizen Hall in downtown Edmonton only 15 minutes after the party arrived at the drinking establishment, according to eyewitnesses. 'I've seen bar fights, but it was pretty different to see this lady in a wedding gown right in the thick of it,' said eyewitness Ryan Bychowski, 34, of Edmonton, Canada about the Saturday night melee to Inside Edition.

( Newser ) – After a car fatally hit a 70-year-old pedestrian , the driver 's insurance company sought payment from her bereaved family. In an unfortunate turn of events, a 70-year-old pedestrian was fatally struck by a car. Instead of offering support or condolences, the driver's insurance company pursued compensation from the victim's grieving relatives, sparking outrage and raising ethical questions within the community. It remains unclear what prompted the insurance company to seek restitution and what further actions, if any, will be taken by the family and their representatives in this troubling and emotional situation.

Craig Watson (top) and Lee Stephenson have been jailed for 21 years combined after an armed robbery on a North Shields store. Two men have been jailed for an armed robbery at a North Shields store. Lee James Stephenson and Craig Robert William Watson were sentenced at Newcastle Crown Court for a string of offences. Stephenson, 39, of Loxley Close, New York, was sentenced to 12 years after a trial for the robbery, possession of heroin, common assault, joint offences of theft from a vehicle, joint attempted robbery, and joint burglary.

Montana , Exxon-Mobil At Odds Over Oil Spill Montana and oil giant Exxon-Mobil are at odds over an oil spill that occurred in 2011. Montana officials are pursuing legal action against the oil company to secure additional financial support for monitoring, mitigation, and environmental response, which Exxon-Mobil argues exceeds its settlement obligations. Exxon-Mobil is now legally bound to pay over $2 million, under the Oil Pollution Act, for previous water decontamination in Montana. Montana aims to obtain additional long-term, state-funded assistance due to a history of similarly damaging environmental spills that have posed risks to wildlife and natural resources.

Arsene Wenger believes the return to fitness of England forward Theo Walcott and imminent recovery of Germany international Lukas Podolski will greatly boost his Arsenal squad's scoring potential. Walcott's recent recovery from an injury-plagued spell, scoring a brace against Norwich City on Friday, added new life to the team's attack, according to Wenger. The impending return of Podolski, coupled with their recent league results, makes Wenger hopeful of adding the firepower Arsenal has lacked upfront. Wenger has long been frustrated by the inability of high-priced signings Alexander Lacazette and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang to fire at full throttle.

Mickey Boodaei has been a leading entrepreneur in the security space for years. He co-founded Imperva, which went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2011, and he co-founded Trusteer, which was sold to IBM for $1 billion in 2013. Soon after the latter acquisition, he founded Transmit Security. Interestingly, Boodaei did so without seeking venture capital. He indicated that by putting his own money (and that of co-founder Rakesh Loonkar) into the start-up, it felt more like when he founded his first firms, but in this case, there was no one else to answer to.

Will Chelsea switch gears vs. Arsenal ? Judging by his body language , you would never think Chelsea is only one win away from claiming their sixth Premier League title. But Antonio Conte isn't letting complacency set in ahead of their match against Arsenal this weekend. Despite Chelsea's recent impressive run, Arsenal poses a formidable challenge as they fight for their place in the top four. The big question will be whether the Blues switch gears to thwart the attacking prowess of Wenger's team, as Chelsea fans eagerly await a chance to lift the Premier League trophy at the end of a season that has surpassed all expectations.

In Lean Times, Creative Bakers Turn To Desperation Pies : The Salt Vinegar pie and green tomato pie don't usually top the list of America's favorite sweets. But in Depression-era America, these and other desperation pies that survive today showed off home cooks' ingenuity. Some desperation pies, like green tomato pie, still enjoy niche popularity today. Imagine yourself as a resourceful farmer during the Great Depression. You'd like to make a dessert for your family, but traditional pie ingredients, like cherries or pecans, are too expensive or not available.

Mr. Hidetoshi Sakuma has been serving as President and Representative Director in The Chiba Bank , Ltd. since March 1 The Chiba Bank Ltd. continues to thrive under the leadership of its current President and Representative Director, Mr. Hidetoshi Sakuma, who took office on March 1. With various initiatives focused on increasing revenue, digital transformation, and improving customer satisfaction, Mr. Sakuma aims to uphold Chiba Bank's status as a major Japanese regional bank. Through strong financial management and implementation of strategic measures, Mr. Sakuma plans to propel The Chiba Bank into a successful and sustainable future.

FAU defeated Louisiana Tech in convincing fashion , 69-61 , behind a big game from Xavian Stapleton . The Owls continued their strong performance this season with a solid victory over Louisiana Tech, as Xavian Stapleton led the way with an impressive display. The 69-61 win further establishes the FAU Owls' dominance and showcases their talented roster. With consistent offensive efforts and tight defensive plays, the team continues to maintain their upward trajectory. Fans and rivals alike will surely keep an eye on the Owls, as they make a compelling case for themselves as serious contenders moving forward.

A new logo to help identify how the community feels about the Seminole County school system soon will be developed, using at least one of the top four winning entries in the county's Logo Competition. School board members said they wanted a new logo because the system's current emblem -- that of a school crossing sign -- doesn't reflect the district's academic achievements. The competition was divided into four age groups, 10 and under as the elementary group, 11 to 14 in the juniors group, 15 to 18 in the seniors group and 19 and over in the adult group.

Cemetery Road is cleared of the June 27th lava flow and has been repaved . PĀHOA , December 16 , Pāhoa celebrates the clearance and repaving of Cemetery Road, which was severely affected by the June 27th lava flow. Thanks to the tireless work of the County of Hawaii Department of Public Works and volunteers, the road is now operational again, allowing easier access for local residents and businesses. While damage caused by volcanic eruptions still remains in parts of the town, Pāhoa remains optimistic for its continued recovery, resilience, and sustainable growth moving forward.

January 29, 2015: Follow the money. One reason the new peace talks are making progress is because factions with responsibilities for large chunks of the population are willing to compromise if that will help stem the accelerating decline in living standards nationwide. Economic activity is shrinking and shortages increasing because of the factional fighting and especially because two governments claim to rule the entire country. Then there is all the Islamic terrorist violence. While most Libyans appreciate the help from Islamic terrorist groups in overthrowing Kaddafi in 2011, since then these groups have become more of a menace than the Kaddafi era secret police ever were.

Bhubaneswar : Shashi Bhushan Behera , Minister Finance & Excise has hoped , IOCL to participate in the Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) Odisha Plastic Park for promoting plastic downstream manufacturing facilities in the state. Finance Minister Behera has recently met IOCL officials for discussion of the same. The collaboration between Odisha state and Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) aims to facilitate investment and support the local petrochemical industry, helping with production processes such as injection molding and weaving products. Participation in the Special Purpose Vehicle is expected to enhance and diversify Odisha's industrial growth by contributing to economic development and creating new employment opportunities.

President Jacob Zuma believes that the public protector’s report on state capture was a political tool meant to be used to deal with certain individuals. In an exclusive interview with ANN7 on Monday evening, Zuma spoke out about the state of capture report by former public protector Thuli Madonsela, in which she recommended that Zuma establish a commission of inquiry into state capture and that Chief Justice Mogoeng Mogoeng choose the judge to preside over it. The report looked into whether Zuma’s friends, the controversial Gupta family, had undue influence on the executive.

Every year the Howick Village Business Association, in conjunction with Bernard and Diana Harding, host the Howick Village Lighting Display. The entire Fencible Walk Park is covered in a wonderland of lights, blow up figures and even a snow machine. Inside the Snow Cave is a vast array of Christmas toys and displays, many of which are "hands on". Santa will be in his grotto for one hour at 8.00pm from Monday the 17th of December through to and including Monday the 24th. In the meantime, you can leave a letter for him in his special mail box outside the Snow Cave.

TRUSTEES of Settle's Victoria Hall were celebrating this week after hearing they would receive a grant of more than £200,000 to help with its restoration. It was revealed on Wednesday that the Settle Victoria Hall Company would receive a grant of £201,500 for the restoration of the old music hall. Without the grant, many people feared the building would have fallen out of use and closed. The starting date for the restoration work is now planned for July 31. The plans include an extension to give the building a new lease of life as a community centre and theatre.

Did Donald Trump Release Donald Trump’s Tax Return? For a moment, it seemed that Rachel Maddow was in possession of a genuine scoop. And then, all of a sudden, it didn’t….Thanks to MSNBC, the suggestion that Trump has “paid no taxes in 18 years” has now been definitively proven to be false. Moreover, Trump seems to have paid a higher tax rate in 2005 than did most political figures, and to have enjoyed a sizeable income to boot. Whether the report was cherry-picked we cannot possibly know.

Fiji Council of Social Services(FCOSS) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by January 2019 at a meeting in Lautoka yesterday.Fiji Council of Social Services(FCOSS) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by January 2019 at a meeting in Lautoka yesterday. FCOSS executive director, Vani Catanasiga says close to 50 representatives from Lami, Suva, Nadi, Nadroga, Lautoka, Savusavu, Labasa, Rakiraki district councils of social services (DCOSS) endorsed the Code of Accountability after a two day meeting in Lautoka.

Casey Brumbeloe, a senior at Stanhope Elmore High School, has been selected to serve on the Alabama State Department of Education Superintendent Student Advisory Council. Casey is one of 16 secondary school students selected from 80 applications. Judges of the student applications included representatives from the ALSDE, CLAS, AASB, A+ Education Partnership and the 2015-2016 Alabama Teacher of the Year. Students were selected based on their level of leadership in their schools and letters of recommendation. Council members will meet two times throughout the school year with State Superintendent Dr. Tommy Bice.

LORD Of The Rings star Liv Tyler headed out with just her husband for the day . The Hollywood star Lord of the Rings star Liv Tyler was spotted enjoying a day out with her husband, showcasing the couple's love and companionship. The Hollywood star is known for balancing her busy career and family life, and this outing seemed to be no exception, providing a perfect opportunity for the couple to relax and connect. Both Liv and her partner were dressed casually for their outing, sharing precious moments with one another during their stroll, showing their continuous affection even after being together for years.

With the economy beginning to stall , Ben Bernanke 's war on the nation 's savers rolls on . A fter much speculation, the economy's growth has begun to slow down, leading to concerns for the nation's savers amidst Bernanke's low-interest-rate policy. As inflation takes a backseat in the overall recovery, unemployment levels and stagnating wages are impacting Americans across various socio-economic strata, urging the government to potentially intervene with new policies to stem the ongoing consequences. Prolonged low-interest-rate policy by the Fed exacerbates existing problems faced by long-term savers, ultimately compelling economists and policymakers to examine alternative methods of addressing a slow-moving economy.

Brazil is currently implementing the Brasil Sem Miséria programme — a continuation of the successful Fome Zero— which aims to lift millions of Brazilians out of extreme poverty. The initiative focuses on ensuring access to education, health care, social assistance, and productive opportunities. So far, the Brasil Sem Miséria program has made significant progress by providing over 13.8 million low-income families with financial support, reaching 50 million individuals. The program's next steps include intensifying efforts in rural areas, expanding investments in water infrastructure and rural education, and working closely with the private sector to ensure sustainable job creation for the long term.

A family dog has been shot dead after police chased down two teens accused of stealing a car on the Gold Coast on Thursday. Police said the dog was acting aggressively toward a police dog but his owner said he was "just a big playful boy", who "didn't deserve to be shot". Desmond, a 15-month-old Golden Retriever-Staffy cross, was shot dead by police on the Gold Coast on Thursday. About 5.20pm on Thursday, officers spotted and pursued a car that had allegedly been stolen from the Gold Coast suburb of Jacobs Well the same morning.

U.S. trade policy has become the top concern among chief financial officers, according to a CNBC quarterly survey. Roughly two-thirds of North American and Asia-Pacific CFOs say U.S. trade policy will have a negative impact on their company over the next six months. Seven of the 16 biggest declines in the Dow Jones Industrial Average this year have been sparked by trade concerns. U.S. Secretary of the Treasury Steve Mnuchin hit Capitol Hill on Thursday to face a grilling on trade, tariffs and NAFTA from the House Financial Services Committee. Mnuchin attempted to quell growing uncertainty within Congress as President Trump ratchets up a trade war with China.

When crews arrived, they saw heavy fire on all floors all the way up, including in the garage, according to the Florence Fire Department. A one-alarm garage fire spread to a Florence home overnight, forcing out four people and causing heavy damage, fire officials said. No one was hurt when flames broke out in the 7300 block of Maybury Court just before 3 a.m. Friday, Boone County dispatchers said. Florence Fire and EMS said all residents escaped before crews arrived. One resident was taken to a local hospital for evaluation, officials said. No firefighter injuries were reported.

A search for ‘toxic mold’ will result in hundreds of scary warnings and ‘studies,’ but few are based in science—and many are motivated by profit. Recently a patient of mine was hospitalized for liver failure due to alcohol. His history of liver disease was well documented, but he adamantly denied that anyone had warned him to avoid alcohol. An initial confession of “a few drinks” turned into much more with a little probing by different medical providers. Despite his liver being in a significant amount of shock, he was stable and lucky enough to still have most liver function intact.

Donald Trump 's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter 's rules prohibiting abusive behavior on the platform. As he faces impeachment proceedings, Twitter will allow Trump to keep tweeting, despite the concern over incendiary comments. According to a spokesperson from Twitter, tweets from elected officials are regarded as "newsworthy," and are within public interest, despite potential violation of Twitter policies. Trump has previously made headlines with tweets aimed at the North Korean leader, encouraging alarm over potential international conflict. However, critics argue Twitter must apply the rules equally and censor the president as it would with other users.

It 's hard to underestimate the success and increasing power of Amazon . Their market cap hovers just under $ 400 billion, and the company continues to expand its footprint across various sectors. Recently, Amazon has moved into logistics and has partnered with SpaceX on its Kuiper project, potentially dominating global internet service provision. Furthermore, it acquired Whole Foods and Rivian Automotive, stepping into both grocery and EV spaces, signaling its growing impact on consumer habits worldwide. Despite ongoing regulatory scrutiny, Amazon's steady diversification in industries hints at an even more influential role in our global economy, securing its place as a corporate giant.

Herts Baseball Club has been awarded a £10,000 grant from Sport England to launch the club’s branch in North West London and give the local community an opportunity to play baseball. Herts Baseball Club has been based at Grovehill Ballpark in Hemel Hempstead since it was founded in 1996. It has grown into one of the biggest baseball clubs in the UK, with eight teams playing in the various adult and youth leagues of the British Baseball Federation. In 2013 the club recognised that in order to accommodate the growing number of new players who want to play baseball, the club needed to expand.

The location of the potential Maroon Creek Reservoir , which would be located just below the confluence of East and West Maroon Creek in Colorado, has sparked controversy among local residents and environmentalists who claim that it could potentially harm the fragile ecosystems and infringe on recreational activities in the area. In response, Aspen city council is moving to temporarily postpone building the reservoir. While city officials emphasize that no decision has been made yet regarding its construction, residents are hoping for a more long-term solution that safeguards both ecological and economic well-being of the surrounding region.

Singer-turned-actor Kim Hyun-joong is considering a return to the small screen, his agency said Tuesday. According to KeyEast Entertainment, Kim has recently been offered a leading role in upcoming drama series “When Time Stopped,” a 12-part fantasy-romance. He would play a time traveler living a lonely life. Kim has not yet decided whether to take the offer, KeyEast said. His latest screen work was drama series “Inspiring Generation” in 2014. A former member of idol group SS501, Kim released a single in November and held fan events and concerts. He also recently renewed his contract with the agency.

A Delhi court today granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's relative Vinay Bansal in a case related to an alleged scam in the Public Works Department (PWD). A Delhi court today granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal’s relative Vinay Bansal in a case related to an alleged scam in the Public Works Department (PWD). Additional Sessions Judge Kamini Lau granted relief to Bansal, a nephew of Kejriwal, on a personal bond of Rs two lakh with one surety of like amount, advocate B S Joon, appearing for the accused, said.

VOLGOGRAD/GELENDZHIK, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try not to melt in the fierce heat of Volgograd when they take on Nigeria in only their second ever World Cup match on Friday after impressively holding twice champions Argentina to a draw at the weekend. World Cup debutantes Iceland are dreaming of the knockout stage and writing a new chapter in one of the most outstanding stories of international football in recent years. In their way stand not only Nigeria, who are desperate for a win after losing their opening game 2-0 to Croatia, but also the challenge of searing temperatures in the southern Russian city.

The spat between the Intelligence agencies of the US and its democratically elected President Donald Trump is not only bizarre The ongoing feud between US intelligence agencies and President Donald Trump continues to baffle the public. With increased accusations and concerns regarding national security leaks and Russian election interference, this dispute not only disrupts established norms of US democratic politics but has broader international consequences. In addition, Trump's recurring verbal attacks against intelligence organizations create internal strife and have the potential to threaten information flow, both nationally and globally. Critics say this could potentially lead to loss of vital information or obfuscate foreign relationships.

Ray Trew has stepped down as chairman of Notts County and has announced that the League Two club is for sale. Former owner Ray Trew bought Notts County in 2010 and saved the club from a winding up order, however he and his board faced strong backlash last year after selling The Magpies to Munto Finance in 2009, leaving the club close to administration. Chief Executive Julian Winter has become Executive Chairman. In 2014, sports insurance mogul Neil Woodward came close to acquiring Notts County but did not make a deal; a spokesperson has suggested Mr Woodward has expressed interest again.

Dr. Pierre Girgis , a board certified Neurosurgeon , is a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Emory University , where he earned both his undergraduate and medical degrees. Dr. Girgis recently announced his newest achievement in treating complex neurological conditions, pioneering the innovative Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) technique for patients suffering from Parkinson's disease, tremors, and various movement disorders. By implanting electrodes to targeted regions in the brain, this cutting-edge approach holds promising outcomes for improved patient mobility and quality of life. The skilled surgeon remains dedicated to implementing and refining state-of-the-art treatments for individuals battling challenging neurological illnesses.

WasteCo Services provides roll off commercial dumpster rentals throughout metro New Orleans for homes , businesses and industrial sites . WasteCo Services continues to offer efficient waste management solutions with its commercial dumpster rentals for homes, businesses, and industrial sites in the New Orleans metropolitan area. Clients can choose from various container sizes to effectively cater to their waste disposal needs. With top-notch customer service and prompt deliveries, WasteCo Services remains the preferred waste removal option in New Orleans for both construction and demolition projects, event management clean-up, and regular recycling services.

May 20 ( UPI ) -- One man was killed and another was hospitalized after they were attacked by a A man was killed and another hospitalized following an alligator attack at a canal near Houston, Texas, in the United States. It was suspected that the victims were homeless men who lived near the site, frequented by people who search for cans and try to catch fish from the alligator-infested canal. Experts believed a bigger-than-usual alligator population caused the accident. Game wardens worked on securing and extracting the aggressive alligators after they captured the eight-foot reptile, thought to have committed the attacks.

Twitter used to be a cool place to share your succinct thoughts . Now al-Shabab , the vicious Somali allies of Al-Qaeda, is using the social media platform to terrorize an African town by tweeting death threats targeting non-Muslim foreigners. The extremist group has released a series of disturbing messages on Twitter, inciting followers to kill tourists in Lamu County in Kenya, leading to widespread panic and a subsequent negative impact on the area's tourism industry. Local police are struggling to calm nerves while security agencies are reportedly taking appropriate actions against these cyber threats.

LOS ANGELES – A bid to grant subpoena power to the watchdog commission that oversees the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department will go to voters in March 2020, after failing to gain adoption by the Board of Supervisors today. Backers of the “Reform L.A. Jails Initiative” gathered nearly a quarter-million signatures in support of the measure, which would also give the Civilian Oversight Commission a mandate to study reducing the county jail population and reallocating jail construction dollars into alternatives to incarceration. Supervisor Sheila Kuehl said more of the county’s 10 million-plus residents should be allowed to weigh in.

BOSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Boston-based private equity real estate firm, Muirfield Investment Partners, is pleased to announce that blockchain specialist and CTO of IBM Blockchain, Gari Singh, has joined the firm as an advisor. Muirfield is leading the effort to reinvent and improve private equity investing through the use of blockchain technology and Mr. Singh’s technical expertise will help guide Muirfield’s efforts in both the near and long-term. As a Distinguished Engineer and the CTO of IBM Blockchain, Gari Singh has provided the guidance and leadership that has made IBM a leader in the blockchain space.

November 17, 2015 12:55 a.m.
Michael Hoeppner had to shed his Manhattan street manners. We realized we were paying an arm and a leg in Manhattan. We looked all over. We got into this area, and the homes are stunning, and it just seemed nicer. The people who sold us this house live next door, Rodney and Desmond. They already had a couple of offers. I think partly what happened is that they wanted us as neighbors: a pregnant couple trying to get a first-time home buy. I’m sure probably that was more appealing than .1 percent more on the down payment or whatever.

L.A. cats are cooler . Nite Jewel + Dâm-Funk = Nite Funk in the citay . There 's been movement Nite Jewel and Dâm-Funk have teamed up to bring a whole new sound to Los Angeles with their exciting collaboration, Nite Funk. This innovative blend of artists has brought a fresh vibe to the city as their unique mix of funky grooves and mesmerizing beats is captivating audiences everywhere. This groundbreaking partnership promises an array of creative, soulful sounds that will surely continue to enthrall and redefine the L.A. music scene for years to come.

Stark County’s unemployment rate in August fell to 6.8 percent, the lowest it’s been since September 2008. For the first time since 2008, Stark County’s jobless rate slipped below 7 percent, and a variety of factors likely contributed to the decline. A leading suspect is the influx of businesses coming to the area because of oil and natural gas drilling in the Utica shale. Oil exploration companies have moved in, followed by engineering and construction firms that provide different services. Manufacturing also has seen growth because of increased demand locally and nationwide for steel and drilling equipment.

The response to the bombs by the crowd at the finish line was, I think, exemplary. Sure, many people fled from the explosions, and reasonably so. But a remarkable number ran, as they say, to the sound of the guns, even though when two bombs go off, one might well expect more. Many of these were professionals. The finish line of a marathon is a fortuitous spot to bomb, in that doctors, policemen, ambulances and so on are stationed there. Some soldiers happened to be on hand. But others were not professionals.

[ prMac.com ] San Rafael , California - Audio technology company , Soundness is pleased to announce availability of SoundSoap+ 5. Soundness, a leading audio technology company in San Rafael, California, recently launched SoundSoap+ 5, a groundbreaking new audio cleaning software. This upgraded version offers additional tools that give its users an increased level of control for removing background noises such as unwanted clicks, buzz, hiss, and much more, from videos and podcasts without compromising the sound quality. The software, available for Mac and Windows users, offers easy and quick fixes while keeping an uncompromised quality output.

Amitabh Bachchan is not just a legend for his contribution in Hindi cinema but also his inclination towards social welfare. This time around, there are reports of him saving a considerable amount for the welfare of Indian army widows as well as the upliftment of farmers. A source revealed to a daily that the ‘102 Not Out’ actor has set aside a sum of Rs 1 crore each for the families of the army martyrs and for the farmers to repay their loans. He has also set up a team to list and locate authentic organisations, which will ensure that the money goes to the right people.

How the internet has caught up with the ways of the world. The early web: UNIX command was beautiful if you knew what to do. This month, the World Wide Web turned 20, and its birthday was celebrated the world over. It was a pleasant change since the medium, once a new frontier of hope, has been regarded with suspicion ever since the Cambridge Analytica scandal broke. We had spent years outraging over the possibility that our choice of washing machines and underwear was being conditioned by smart web advertising, and, in 2018, we learned that even voter choice was open to manipulation.

Elvira Alonzo sees recycling as essential to the future . The McAllen public works director oversees the recycling program in McAllen, Texas, and is determined to make a lasting impact. Under Alonzo's guidance, the city has developed partnerships with schools and other institutions, promoting the importance of recycling for a sustainable future. Recently, McAllen recycled around 47.86 million pounds of materials. With numerous events such as electronics recycling days and sustainability conferences in place, McAllen serves as an inspiration to other cities. Alonzo's continued passion for promoting awareness and educating future generations is a testament to the critical role recycling plays in preserving our environment.

It looked like the scene after an earthquake. A sea of orange boxes littered the floors, shoes stuffed in every crevice, while confused people stood in shock. But this was no natural disaster. This was Black Friday at a Nike factory store in Seattle. Horrified shoppers at the Seattle Premium Outlets in Tulalip, Washington, shared pictures and video of the store's dismal condition after the holiday weekend. They show people carelessly crushing the boxes that protect Nike shoes while walking through the outlet, mindlessly grabbing and discarding sneakers as they go.

BASEL , Switzerland – Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche Holding AG said Monday that it has had reports of 13 cases Swiss pharmaceutical company Roche has received reports of 13 cases in which children developed Stevens-Johnson Syndrome or another allergic condition, Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis (TEN), while taking their flu medicine Tamiflu, also known as Oseltamivir. While SJS and TEN can lead to fatal skin conditions and lifelong impairments, most patients recovered without lasting impact after discontinuing Tamiflu. Roche stated there are no new risks for Tamiflu and maintains the current prescription practices in Asia, stressing that no medicine is completely safe.

Narendra Modi ’ s Election Challenge : Create Jobs . Lots of Them . The Indian government ’ s failure The Indian government’s failure to deliver on election promises of rapid industrial growth could haunt the 2019 polls for Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Although GDP growth looks healthy at over 7%, agriculture remains dominant and a mixed infrastructure sees key industry heavily focused in certain regions, exacerbating the need for jobs in other areas. Modi’s 'Make in India' initiative is struggling to hit the 10-million-jobs-by-2020 goal, potentially hampering the electoral aspirations of a party which pledged support and hope for young, semi-urban citizens during its campaign.

( WXIA ) -- New Year 's Eve is one of the deadliest drinking holidays of the year . This New Year's Eve, known as one of the deadliest drinking holidays, witnesses a significant rise in alcohol-related accidents, injuries, and fatalities. Authorities urge citizens to be responsible during their celebrations and prioritize safety measures, such as choosing designated drivers, utilizing ride-share apps like Uber and Lyft, or employing other alternative modes of transport. Additionally, event hosts should closely monitor alcohol consumption and provide non-alcoholic beverage options for sober drivers.

The New York Knicks approach the quarter-mark of the schedule with a middling 9-9 record as they aim to end a seven-year playoff drought. Offseason additions, such as point guard Elfrid Payton and forwards Julius Randle and Marcus Morris Sr., have contributed to a more cohesive on-court performance. Despite recent struggles against quality opposition, the Knicks' young talents like R.J. Barrett and Mitchell Robinson give the fans a reason to hope. In the tight Eastern Conference, the team still has an opportunity to make significant improvements as the season unfolds and perhaps even clinch a playoff berth.

LONDON -- An IT worker threw out a computer hard drive without realizing it contained $7.5 million worth of the digital currency Bitcoin. The device is now buried somewhere in a vast landfill site near the home of owner James Howells -- who only realized his mistake when it was too late. "It is soul destroying to be honest,” Howells told NBC News on Thursday. "I haven’t had much sleep over the past few days. Every second of the day I am thinking about what could have been."

Jan. 5, 2017, 11 a.m. Box V2 scans for weak passwords and prevents you from accidentally submitting personal data on fake sites. LAS VEGAS—Bitdefender has updated its network security gadget, now known as New Bitdefender Box or Box Version 2, which is designed to protect home networks and Internet of Things devices from outside attack. The original Bitdefender Box extended security protection to devices that could not run antivirus software themselves, specifically IoT devices. By moving security protection to the network level, Box products protect all the devices on the network, including fridges, game consoles, and security cameras.

On Thursday, LightSquared submitted final arguments for its $7 billion dollar proposal to launch an LTE network. The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has plenty of July 4th reading to do: a thousand-page recommendation from LightSquared and members of the GPS industry, on whether or not America will be getting a new wholesale 4G LTE provider as early as next year. On Thursday, LightSquared and the FCC-mandated Technical Working Group (TWG), which is made up of representatives from both GPS-dependant industries and LightSquared, submitted final arguments for and against LightSquared's $7 billion dollar proposal.

The main task of North Korea 's junior minister for re-information is to refute everything ever said by French intellectuals North Korea's junior minister for re-information has reportedly taken on the significant responsibility of countering and disputing any claims, arguments, or theories proposed by French intellectuals. This unconventional strategy adopted by North Korean officials demonstrates the nation's dedication to defending its ideologies and dismissing foreign thought, especially from leading Western figures. It remains to be seen how the junior minister will practically approach the enormous task, but it serves as a striking illustration of the stringent control exerted by North Korea on intellectual discourse within the country.

Ryan Seacrest is back in the dating game ! The 40-year-old American Idol host is currently romancing 26-year-old former Miss Teen USA, Hilary Cruz, multiple sources confirmed. This new couple was last seen at George Clooney's famous Casamigos annual Halloween party that took place in Beverly Hills. This romantic revelation occurs months after Ryan broke up with model, Shayna Taylor, earlier this year after dating on and off since 2013. The American radio and TV show host also congratulated his former fling, actress Julianne Hough, upon her recent engagement to Canadian Ice-hockey star Brooks Laich, the NHL’s Washington Capitals’ player.

Brands are just starting to play with Facebook 's full-screen mobile ads , but Wendy 's social marketers already seem Brands are starting to engage with Facebook's full-screen mobile ads and Wendy's has wasted no time making an impact with this tool. Their innovative "Can You Baconator?" quiz and extensive burger comparisons significantly boost the brand's customer engagement with tailored interaction for each individual consumer. Considering 90% of Facebook users now access the platform on a mobile device, advertisers that can provide personalised entertainment in Facebook's unique environment are best positioned for high conversion rates and customer engagement growth.

Google has long had a testy relationship with China , with the search giant largely pulling out of the Chinese market in 2010 due to strict censorship policies. However, it appears that Google is attempting to strengthen ties and revitalize business in China, as the tech giant recently joined the China-ASEAN e-commerce platform in Jiangsu province, signing an MoU to assist local businesses with cross-border online transactions. The initiative aims to empower SMEs by offering diverse trading support, market analysis tools and advanced logistics, fostering collaboration and driving forward digital economic cooperation within the China-ASEAN e-commerce sphere.

A budget crisis facing the Palestinian government is deepening in the wake of last week's election victory by the Islamic resistance group, Hamas. On Thursday the Palestinian Authority (PA) announced it was delaying payment of January salaries to 137,000 government staff by at least two weeks because of post-election budget problems. The PA needs $116 million to cover the monthly payroll. But after Hamas' election victory last week, Israel said it was suspending its monthly tax transfers to the PA, worth about $45 million, pending further review.

Health authorities have issued another measles warning after a person travelled on public transport and visited two universities and a A new measles alert has been issued by health authorities as an infected individual has reportedly used public transportation and visited two universities in Melbourne, Australia, while infectious. Affected passengers who may have traveled on similar train routes are urged to seek advice on identifying symptoms and should report cases immediately. Public transport facilities, the University of Melbourne and RMIT, among other places visited, are cautioned to spread awareness to curtail the infection, given the high contagiousness of measles.

Austria, Spain and South Korea have been approved as founding members of the Asia Infrastructure and Investment Bank (AIIB), the Chinese Finance Ministry announced Saturday. A founding member of the bank has the right to help write its rules and Saturday’s additions bring the number of prospective founders to 41. The exact number of founding members will be finalized on April 15. Any country that joined the AIIB after March 31 will only be allowed to be an ordinary member, which means they have voting rights but less say in making the rules.

Brands should resist the temptation to take on a hot-button issue in the Super Bowl as a way to stand Out among Super Bowl commercials. Despite potential short-term gains, companies should remain cautious when addressing controversial subjects, as the benefits may be outweighed by the risks of losing audience members or becoming embroiled in social or political disputes. Instead, brands can look for authentic and relatable ways to convey their message or product, maximizing ad investment and appeal without resorting to controversy. An ideal approach can involve combining creativity with positive engagement to create advertisements that audiences will remember and enjoy.

In the lead up to the Super Bowl last week , NFL Hall of Famer Ladainian Tomlinson gave his projection NFL Hall of Famer Ladainian Tomlinson recently projected the outcome of Super Bowl LV in the days before the event. Though specific projections weren't detailed, his insights were much-anticipated due to his expertise as an American football running back who has played in the past with the San Diego Chargers and the New York Jets. Last week, as part of pre-event discussion, Tomlinson shared his thoughts on team strategies and key players. The game took place on February 7th and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers emerged victorious over the Kansas City Chiefs.

Dundee United are to begin talks in the next few days in an attempt to prevent Scotland striker Steven Thompson Dundee United are set to commence negotiations with Scotland striker Steven Thompson in the coming days in a bid to fend off interest from rival clubs. The experienced forward has caught the eye of various teams thanks to his consistent performances, and United is keen on securing his services for the future. Dundee United hope that Thompson will choose to remain loyal to the club where he began his career and sign an extended deal before his contract ends, shunning potential moves to larger clubs or tempting offers elsewhere.

According to analysts, the market is entering a consolidation phase after the recent run-up. NEW DELHI: A below-normal monsoon forecast by private weather agency Skymet proved to be a big dampener for stock benchmarks on Wednesday, which surrendered the day's gains after scaling all-time highs. According to Skymet, monsoon in 2019 is likely to be ‘below normal’ to the tune of 93 per cent of the long period average (LPA) of 887 mm for four months starting from June to September. This sent the bulls hurtling downwards, wiping off the earlier gains, as the market ended in negative territory.

The traditionally conservative Michelin guide , celebrating its 100th year and a new , leaner look for its mascot , Bibendum, celebrates its centenary this year while debuting a redesigned, slimmer mascot. Known for its strict rating system and high prestige, the Michelin Guide has solidified its presence in the global culinary scene since its launch in 1920. In an effort to modernize and adapt, the once-stout mascot has been streamlined and sports a slicker appearance, reflecting a more progressive outlook, both visually and metaphorically. This revamp aligns with Michelin's increased support for up-and-coming sustainable and socially aware dining trends.

RICH KARLGAARD: You should look at 4 areas. One is financial regulations, which still makes it hard for small business to get loans. You have the health care regulations that you mentioned, Obamacare is adding cost burdens everywhere you look, behind every nook and cranny. You have environmental regulations, and that's a whole area killing small businesses, particularly where I live in California. California farmers are getting rooned at the expense of the protection of certain insects. Then you have labor regulations. Last year we saw the national labor relations board war against Boeing.

It ’ s a long walk from Billings , Mont. , to Lincoln , Neb . – anywhere between 850 and 1,100 miles depending on the route taken. However, that didn't stop Andy Guenzel, a man battling blood cancer, from embarking on this journey on foot. Guenzel aims to raise funds and awareness for his cause along his way. Sharing updates through his 'Save The Goatasaurus' Facebook page, he receives cheers and donations for his 'Beat Blood Cancer in my Lifetime!' campaign. This tough expedition emphasizes Guenzel's determination to help fight against blood cancer and shows the powerful support behind his every step.

At her weekly therapy sessions , Julie revealed her most uncomfortable secrets : depression , debt , childhood sexual abuse Julie, who attends weekly therapy sessions, has courageously shared her most intimate and challenging struggles. By openly discussing her experiences with depression, crippling debt, and the deeply scarring effects of childhood sexual abuse, Julie aims to encourage open communication and create a supportive environment for those who may be silently suffering from similar hardships. Her bravery in sharing her story underscores the importance of addressing mental health issues and demonstrates the power of vulnerability to spark conversation, understanding, and healing for both the individuals involved and the broader community.

CARILLON BEACH � Organic living comes naturally to Leia and Andy Mayer , and their Sunrise Market & Caf� is Leia and Andy Mayer's Sunrise Market & Café in Carillon Beach brings a unique organic twist to the Floridian coast, offering customers an array of organic produce, essential oils and health-focused educational classes. Emphasising sustainable living and environmentally friendly practices, the market supports local farmers and entrepreneurs by prioritising regional products. With recent market and café expansions, including an organic smoothie bar, and participating in initiatives to reduce ocean waste, Sunrise Market & Café embodies a wholesome, ecological haven for local residents and tourists alike.

The US is pursuing a plan to push Palestinians into northern Sinai and transfer part of the West Bank to Israel. As President Donald Trump continues to bluster and tweet his way through a chaotic presidency, the Middle East is simmering dangerously close to a boiling point. Wars in Yemen and Syria are still burning hard, the feud between Qatar and the so-called Quartet of Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates (UAE), Egypt and Bahrain trundles on with no apparent end in sight, Iran continues to flex its military muscles, and both Iraq and Egypt struggle to contain terrorist attacks.

Pharmaceutical giant Pfizer wiped the floor with Wall Street's third-quarter estimates, but one comment made by CEO Ian Read during the earnings call suggests weakness on the horizon. Pharmaceutical juggernaut Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) dazzled Wall Street once again by reporting better-than-expected third-quarter earnings results before the opening bell on Wednesday. For the quarter, Pfizer delivered $12.09 billion in revenue, a 2% year-over-year decline, while its reported net income dropped 20% to $2.13 billion from $2.67 billion. Pfizer's EPS dropped a similar 19% to $0.34 from $0.42.

Suriname Special Forces. Photo by Sanoesie101, Wikipedia Commons. Location of Suriname. Source: CIA World Factbook. In 1980, a group of non-commissioned officers (NCOs) overthrew the elected government despite intense resistance from a badly outgunned police force, which was only subdued when the navy shelled them into submission. This led to the establishment of a de facto military dictatorship (though there was a nominal civilian president) in the country for the next seven years, headed by Sergeant-Major (self-promoted to Lt. Colonel) Desi Delano Bouterse.

April 24, 2014, 10:30 a.m.
At a few smart legacy news companies, there’s digital advertising growth and smart strategy. But most newspaper companies are finding the important numbers are still headed in the wrong direction. By Ken Doctor @kdoctor April 24, 2014, 10:30 a.m.
As we approach the middle of the 2010s, where do newspapers fit in the battle for America’s largest ad sector — digital? And how well are all those paywalls doing? Two reports tumbled into the public sphere within a week of each other recently, and together, they help us answer both questions.

KENTON , Del . - A Kenton cheese plant shut down by the Food and Drug Administration due to a The Food and Drug Administration has shut down a cheese plant in Kenton, Delaware, following a major outbreak of the Listeria bacterium. The decision to close the plant came after nearly 300 customers reported symptoms such as severe muscle cramps and paralysis, indicating listeria infections. Health authorities are urging anyone experiencing these symptoms, especially pregnant women and people with weakened immune systems, to seek immediate medical assistance. The source of the bacteria is yet to be determined as officials continue investigations to limit further contaminations.

Can you put a price on faith ? That is the question churchgoers are asking as the tradition of tithing , or donating a tenth of one's income, is declining amid modern economic challenges. Churches, which rely on donations to maintain their ministries and charities, are feeling the financial strain. Some believers, already facing multiple pressures from housing costs to tuition fees, feel overwhelmed and scrutinize how churches spend their funds. For churches that do continue the practice, conversations are being opened about financial transparency, trust and helping congregants see the direct impact of their contributions.

A pair of Metro Vancouver thieves have been arrested and charged after they allegedly conducted an extended period of mail theft across Canada. Two Canadian suspects, 28-year-old Dan Archibald from New West Minister and 33-year-old Victoria Lamond of Burnaby, have been arrested and charged for stealing a significant amount of mail. Authorities report that the pair broke into community mailbox sites and stole unopened packages as well as uncounted cheques, IDs, credit card, and several mail items from surrounding mailboxes. Officers said Archibald was caught during an attempt to use a stolen identity to collect fraudulent payments, which subsequently led to Lamond's arrest.

Long flights can be rough on the body , so it ’ s not uncommon to see people walking around the cabin to stretch their legs and get some exercise. However, airlines are constantly looking for ways to improve the in-flight experience for passengers, particularly for those long-haul journeys. To address this issue, some carriers are exploring options such as wellness zones with space for light exercise and guided stretching routines, improving sleep-inducing technologies like mood lighting and soundproofing, offering healthier meals and hydration kits, as well as providing better seat ergonomics.

The Hashemite Library remained a beacon of knowledge and a destination for readers and intellectuals until 2000, when the number of readers started to dwindle, given the tough economic situation in the Strip. In the 1950s, the Hashemite Library was commissioned to sell newspapers and books from prominent Egyptian publishing and distribution houses. It was also a space for writers and intellectuals to meet. However, the Internet’s invasion and the poverty of Gaza Strip’s inhabitants have inhibited these activities. “Due to the rise of the Internet and the economic stagnation, we no longer got books for distribution or sale.

It 's customary to leave a tip when eating out , but one particular gratuity added to an order for pizza has gone viral. Mike Vegas, a delivery driver for a local Domino's pizza chain in California, was astonished when he received a hefty $1800 tip on an order. The generous customers, roommates Brandon Lesky and Chloe Springer, had placed a food order while packing up their home during a move, accidentally including wads of cash meant to cover expenses. They did not realize the error until receiving the massive food order but decided to let Vegas keep the life-changing gratuity as a stroke of good luck.

SANTA MARIA, Brazil – Penny-pinching by a band known for its onstage pyrotechnic displays may have cost more than 230 people their lives at a nightclub in southern Brazil, according to a state police inspector leading the investigation into this weekend's deadly blaze. Inspector Marcelo Arigony told reporters at a news conference Tuesday that members of the band knowingly purchased flares meant for outdoor use because they cost a mere $1.25 a piece, compared with the $35 price tag for an indoor flare. "The flare lit was for outdoor use only, and the people who lit them know that," said Arigony.

Warning : There are graphic images in the video above . SODUS , N.Y. ( WHEC ) -- A new video has surfaced online showing multiple live rats stuffed inside a closed bag, igniting animal cruelty concerns in the town of Sodus, New York. Authorities have launched an investigation into the origin of the video, which first appeared on the local Facebook group 'Wayne County neighbors watch.' In addition, numerous rats were recently found drowned in bags at Crescent Beach; it remains unknown if the cases are connected. Locals are appalled, expressing disgust, sadness and offering assistance in capturing whoever may be responsible for these disturbing incidents.

Man robs jewellery on crutches ! A man with a bandaged leg and using crutches fled a British hospital after A man with a bandaged leg, using crutches, escaped from a British hospital after stealing jewellery. The suspect was filmed on CCTV robbing a woman visiting her ill mother at Hillingdon Hospital in London. The video shows the suspect entering the patient's room, grabbing the woman’s purse, and then escaping, leaving his crutches behind. Authorities are appealing to the public to assist in the search for the alleged thief who has been accused of both theft and fleeing custody at the hospital.

If you have flexible working arrangements and do not work at a fixed location every day, and are looking for a standing desk that would travel with you, the LEVIT8 is exactly what you need. Using the age-old box-twist folding technique, this innovative standing desk pops up quickly without having to be assembled, and flattens down when not in use with a simple twist and fold action. Not only is it lightweight and portable, but it is also strong enough to hold up to 20 times its own weight—in addition to that, it is also made of a water-repellent and stain-resistant material.

U.S. government debt yields rose on Friday after the U.S. government said that job creation was stronger than expected in US government debt yields increased on Friday, following the announcement of better-than-anticipated job creation statistics for October. Last month, US companies added 128,000 new jobs, beating the estimated 89,510 additional jobs expected by economists. The recent report prompted a selloff of government bonds. Benchmark 10-year notes declined in price and pushed yields up to 1.733% on Friday. Additionally, the overall employment rate fell to 3.6%, lower than September's record low of 3.5%, mainly attributed to General Motors' employee strike.

Haidilao went public in September , and it 's been a lucrative time for China 's largest hotpot chain . Since going public in September, China's largest hotpot chain, Haidilao, has experienced tremendous growth and profitability. As consumers' tastes evolve and spending habits improve, the company has expanded both domestically and internationally. Their hotpot model allows diners to customise and indulge in a unique interactive experience that proves popular among Chinese patrons. The company is strategically investing in modernization, hygiene, and smart kitchen technologies to maintain their competitiveness in the fast-growing Chinese food service industry.

Multiple bills at the New Jersey statehouse are of interest to truckers and others using roadways throughout the state. Repeat drunk driving offenders could soon face harsher penalties for their actions. New Jersey law now limits punishment for affected offenders to a traffic offense. Bail typically is set at $2,500. The traffic offense designation allows drivers charged with drunken driving to continue to drive while awaiting their court date. Awaiting consideration on the Assembly floor is a bill to end that practice. Instead, A3057 would boost punishment for a person convicted of driving under the influence two times or more within 60 days to a fourth-degree crime.

Girls Like Biology , Boys Like Physics ? We all have our stereotypes about which subjects appeal more to girls and boys. A new study by British researchers supports these stereotypes to an extent, revealing that girls in UK high schools seem to prefer studying biology, while boys lean towards physics. Examining a large dataset, the researchers found a consistently significant gender difference in the subject choices made by secondary school students. Furthermore, students of both sexes appear more interested in science and technology subjects than social science, as both groups avoid studying geography and politics.

A few students have had what might be politely described as a �disagreement� at Graham Middle School . Kim Davis , principal of Graham Middle School, reports that a few students were involved in a disagreement during recess. In response, the administration promptly stepped in to deescalate the situation and ensured the safety of all students. A school investigation will take place to examine the cause and potential consequences for those involved. In the meantime, the school has emphasized its dedication to fostering a supportive and respectful learning environment and plans to take proactive measures, such as implementing programs to teach effective communication and conflict resolution strategies to students.

ANSWER : I will lower property taxes . We pay the highest property taxes in the U.S . I have proposed a comprehensive plan to reduce the burden on homeowners and create a fairer taxation system. By addressing inefficiencies and implementing strategic tax breaks, our state will be able to thrive and attract more residents. This plan, which aims to improve the overall economic climate, also includes supporting small businesses and encouraging growth in key industries. In addition, our local education system and essential public services will be sufficiently funded to guarantee the continued progress of our community.

It's enough to give you a headache. Mastering the ins and outs of Obamacare open enrollment can be painful. Fortunately, the Daily News has your critical questions answered by Seth Diamond, chief operating officer at MetroPlus Health Plan, which is offering plans on New York State of Health. Q. Why should I enroll? A. Health insurance is extraordinarily important to your family's health and overall well-being, and will keep you healthier. Also, there is great peace of mind in knowing that you and your family are covered not just for routine preventive care but also against catastrophic injury or illness.

Drones come in a wide variety of different shapes and sizes these days , but generally speaking , most of them share the same basic design features. However, British start-up Callen-Lenz has created a unique fixed-wing drone called Prion Mk 3, designed for urban environments and with potential use cases ranging from surveillance, search and rescue missions, and disaster monitoring. Boasting a fully electric power system, autonomous vertical take-off and landing capabilities, as well as resistance to extreme weather, Prion Mk 3 aims to make unmanned aerial vehicle services more accessible for civilian applications in the near future.

In the third quarter of 2018, luxury home prices increased 3.2% year over year to an average of $1.7 million, according to the latest data from Redfin. Redfin classifies luxury homes as those that sold among the top 5% most expensive in the quarter. According to the company, sales of homes priced at or above $2 million increased for the ninth consecutive quarter. However, this is the smallest rate of growth since early 2016. Furthermore, the number of homes for sale priced at or above $2 million fell 6% year over year compared with one year prior.

There are a range of useful commands which can be accessed through the game console , or entered into the configuration file for various titles within the gaming world. Players are using these commands to customize their experience, enhance performance, or to execute multiple functions with a single click. Developers encourage exploring these built-in features, emphasizing on potential advantages like better graphical fidelity or improved response times. Experts in the gaming community regularly share updates and insights on these console commands to help enthusiasts modify and refine their overall gaming sessions, elevating their in-game engagement to an entirely new level.

A new poll reveals that more Americans would choose the Internet as their only news source than TV , radio , or newspapers. The Emerson College survey showed that 46.8% of Americans selected the Internet, compared to 29% for TV, 9.5% for radio and 5.5% for print. Overall trust in mainstream media remains low, as over 60% of those surveyed expressed strong distrust. Emerson's faculty advisor suggests a diverse consumption of news from different sources might improve people's understanding of current events and perception of news accuracy.

"Of all the German surface warships, the British feared Bismarck the most. Her size, speed, and firepower made her a definite threat to Allied shipping in the Atlantic, and it was imperative that she be neutralized." In July 2001, the wreck of the Hood was found 9,334 feet below the surface of the Denmark Straight. She lies in three sections with the bow on its side, the mid section upside down, and the stern speared into the seabed. In 2013, the wreck was more fully explored with a remote-control vehicle.

QUETTA - At least eleven people including two women and two children died and 18 others sustained injuries in a At least eleven people, including two women and two children, have died and 18 others have been injured in a road accident in the Pakistani city of Quetta. A passenger coach collided with a trailer carrying a container near Dhadar area. Injured passengers were taken to hospitals, with some reported to be in critical condition. Poor road conditions and negligence often contribute to accidents like these, which claim the lives of hundreds in the country every year.

NFL player Keenan Allen had a few things to say about Bell's song. According to TMZ, during the middle of March, Le’Veon Bell, the star running back for the New York Jets, signed a $52.2 million contract with his team. However, instead of celebrating his new football contract, the pro football player was busy hosting his album release party at a nightclub in Miami. Bell’s new rap album called Life’s a Gamble had its release party on March 16 at Miami Beach’s Rockwell Nightclub.

You have to admire Lego Cuusoo: The website does a great job at bringing a community of Lego fans together to create interesting designs for future sets. Who wouldn't encourage people of all ages to get creative? Lego and the geek community go hand-in-hand though, so when Ladyada's workshop is pitched as a set, you can't help but get a little excited. Adafruit Industries makes and sells hardware that is easy to use (like specific Arduino kits) in order to inspire people of all ages and experience levels to work with electronics Naturally, this makes Ladyada and her company worthy contestants to be a Lego set.

BLAKELY , Pa. -- More than 170,000 pounds of food was handed out to those in need in Lackawanna County in Pennsylvania, where families lined up for hours at Valley View High School Stadium to receive boxes of groceries on June 18. The food distribution event, held by Friends of the Poor, served about 4,000 people facing food insecurities amid the COVID-19 crisis. Each family received a box with a variety of fresh and canned foods to feed an estimated four people per week. The grocery boxes also included protein options like frozen chicken, rice, canned soups, vegetables, and baby diapers.

(Left to right) Sam and Teska Frisby, Marsha Thompson and Boheme Opera NJ Maestro Joseph Pucciatti.
