On Friday, April 5 at 8 p.m. and Sunday, April 7 at 3 p.m. Boheme Opera NJ celebrates a 30th Anniversary with a production of Giuseppe Verdi’s Aida.

You have to admire Lego Cuusoo : The website does a great job at bringing a community of Lego fans together to propose new and innovative ideas for future Lego sets. One such project that gained support is a Titanic set concept. Lego officially released an intricate 9090-piece set modeled after the iconic vessel, satisfying both fans of the historic ship and advanced Lego builders. As community-driven creations continue to flow, one can't help but be excited about the possibilities ahead, whether it's on their table, to grace display shelves or the build camaraderie amongst a devoted global community.

As Conservative Party leader William Hague made his way through the flock of the faithful at a lunchtime rally Tuesday and an emcee introduced "the next prime minister of Britain," even many of his supporters let out an involuntary guffaw. The conservative Times of London newspaper had just thrown its support to the Labor Party for the first time ever, endorsing Prime Minister Tony Blair for a second term. The nation's leading betting house, Ladbrokes, had already closed its book on Thursday's election and said it had begun paying out on a Labor victory.

At the wake for United States Army Air Corps Lt. William Flynn, Jack Flynn saw a short man pin silver wings to his brother's uniform. Jack Flynn learned that this man, retired United States Army Air Corps Sgt. Alvin E. Kotler, was a friend of his brother who served with him in World War II. In addition to being close to William, the two men had another thing in common: They wanted to clear his name. At the wake for United States Army Air Corps Lt. William Flynn, Jack Flynn saw a short man pin silver wings to his brother's uniform.

I strongly encourage the Mayor and Council to move forward to preserve South Central Corridor . It is the only remaining green corridor in our rapidly growing city and holds tremendous potential for environmental conservation, public recreation, and fostering a strong sense of community. Investing in the preservation of this precious space is not only critical for protecting our natural resources, but also for promoting sustainability and enhancing residents' quality of life. With smart planning and careful consideration, South Central Corridor could become a beacon of pride for our city and serve as an inspiring model for other urban green spaces nationwide.

Albion striker Simon Cox has emerged as a a transfer target for Championship club Derby County. Rams boss Nigel Clough is keeping close tabs on the 23-year-old and will consider a loan swoop if there is any encouragement from the Hawthorns. Sources in the East Midlands confirmed today that the former Reading and Swindon man is on a list of forwards being watched by Clough, who is looking to strengthen his strikeforce. The Pride Park chief is also keen on Scunthorpe's highly-rated Gary Hooper, Sheffield United's Billy Sharp and Everton's James Vaughan, who he signed on loan last season.

Multiple bills at the New Jersey statehouse are of interest to truckers and others using roadways throughout the state . Various bills in the New Jersey statehouse are aimed at addressing the concerns of truckers and improving safety on the roads. The proposals include fines for violations such as trucker brakes failing to work after performing safety inspections and slow reaction times for ramp metering signals. Other legislation focuses on preventing environmental issues by urging President Biden to prioritize fixing the Gateway rail tunnel between New Jersey and New York and providing appropriate funds to ensure projects aimed at improving transportation do not harm air and water resources in the area.

UNITED NATIONS, July 6, updated -- With the mandate of the UN Mission in Sudan set to expire on July 8, the day before South Sudan declares independence, as of June 6 at the UN in New York the Security Council resolution to create a new force in South Sudan has not yet been passed. At a meeting of Deputy Permanent Representatives on July 5, one member voiced opposition to forming the new Mission until after South Sudan formally declares independence, and found some suppporters. They pointed at a paragraph in the draft resolution which welcomes the creation of South Sudan.

VIDEO: On March 30, 2017, Atlanta drivers on I-85 north found themselves in a stunning situation when materials stored beneath the interstate overpass spanning Piedmont Road and Monroe Drive caught fire. The overpass then collapsed. Despite the 2017 I-85 bridge collapse that threw Atlanta into a two-month traffic nightmare — or the massive sinkholes that have erupted around town — Georgia infrastructure is actually among the very best in the nation. That’s according to researchers over at 24/7 Wall Street, who created an index using the share of potentially hazardous bridges, roads or dams to identify which states fare worst of all when it comes to infrastructure.

Members of the Boone Area Chamber of Commerce community participated in the inaugural Committed to the Cause volunteer day , which was organized to support local nonprofits in Boone, North Carolina. Over 120 individuals from local businesses and organizations joined together to tackle various service projects throughout the day. Volunteers dedicated their time and efforts towards various projects, including renovation and maintenance of historic buildings, parks and gardens, and administrative support for nonprofits. The Boone Area Chamber of Commerce aimed to promote camaraderie among community members while collectively working towards the betterment of Boone's community infrastructure. The successful initiative plans to become an annual event.

Avid has ‘redesigned and reimagined’ Media Composer, relaunching it to appeal to future generations of editors. At the company’s Avid Connect event, held in Las Vegas just before NAB 2019, Avid unveiled Media Composer 2019, which has been designed to try to keep both current and future users happy. Avid describes Media Composer 2019 as providing “a new user experience”, with a customisable role-based user interface. The Avid bins have been redesigned and the software now features task-based workspaces, showing only the things the user might need for that task.

If you've come to this page, you've probably decided that it's time to make physical activity a regular part of your life  or you want to get more ideas to boost your regular physical activity program. The Heart and Stroke Foundation recommends that adults get 30 to 60 minutes of physical activity, most days of the week. Children should be active 60 to 90 minutes a day, most days of the week. Try to fit physical activity throughout your day  walking to work, taking a physical activity break at lunch time, going for an after-dinner stroll.

Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif called on Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday at the PM House with both sides discussing ways to strengthen bilateral relations between Iran and Pakistan. Topics of discussion included improving security along the border, trade collaborations, and issues concerning regional security, such as Indian occupied Jammu and Kashmir. Both nations stressed the importance of unity and resolution through peaceful dialogue. Iranian President Hassan Rouhani's anticipated visit to Pakistan later in October is expected to further deepen ties between the two nations as they work towards cooperation on shared goals and aspirations.

Members of the Boone Area Chamber of Commerce community participated in the inaugural Committed to the Cause volunteer day, Wednesday, December 7th. The day of service took the place of a December business after-hours event. Chamber members and staff volunteered at three local non-profits: Hunger and Health Coalition, Watauga County Habitat for Humanity, and Hospitality House. The High Country Association of Realtors, Johnson, Price, Sprinkle CPA, and Go Postal were among the leading contributors to a canned food drive that coincided with volunteer events. Just over 375 pounds of food were delivered to Hunger and Health Coalition from the community-wide collection.

Elvira Alonzo sees recycling as essential to the future. The McAllen public works director oversees the recycling program in the city and ensures its operations go smoothly. Plastic, cardboard, glass and other common materials are moved, pulverized or shifted for reuse in a compound on North Bentsen Road. The operation presents a profitable and a facilitation of services toward the public good. Clean streets, quality drainage systems and maintaining the mission of Keep McAllen Beautiful are among the services of working this sector, Alonzo said. Poor products harm the community, and her work turns the negatives into positives.

The sad demise of late veteran actor Kader Khan has left a void in the Hindi film industry that can never be filled. Khan, aged 81, passed away on 1st January 2019 in Canada after battling prolonged illness. Fondly remembered for his superb comic timing and impactful character roles, he had appeared in over 300 films throughout his illustrious career. His legacy continues to live on, inspiring the current generation of artists to strive for greatness. With many actors and film fraternity members expressing grief over his loss, the Indian film industry salutes a legend who changed the way audiences perceived comic characters.

Californians , of all people , should recognize what it means to drive people off their land . In the early 20th century, many Mexicans lost their land due to policies by both the US and Mexican governments, eventually resulting in forced migration. As Californians have built new solar projects in the West Antelope Valley, those circumstances are coming full circle for another population, Native American tribes. Tribal leaders say that massive utility-scale solar projects built on their ancestral lands not only drive them away but are also causing cultural and environmental harm.

It 's been more than a decade since Eminem 's one and only starring role in 8 Mile , and it seems the rapper is ready to return to acting. According to recent reports, Eminem is in talks to star in a new television series based on his 2002 film 8 Mile's theme, centered on Detroit's battle rap scene. The upcoming show, currently titled 'Detroit Street,' is being developed by Joseph Kahn, who will be partnering with renowned battle rap league KOTD. However, no details on Eminem's potential character or the plot of the series have been revealed yet.

Guernsey voters are set to elect politicians from an entire island constituency, rather than by the current district system. More than half of voters backed the change in the island's first ever referendum, which saw a 45% turnout. Option A - one island-wide district - won with 6,017 votes, representing 52% of the final count. It means all 38 Guernsey deputies will be elected in a single vote on the same day, every four years, from June 2020. More stories from Guernsey and the referendum latest. Option A campaigner Deputy Carl Meerveld said he was "ecstatic and relieved."

Two people have been injured in a crash on State Highway 2 near Whakamaramara. What was initially reported as a three-car crash yesterday, police now believe were two separate crashes in almost the same spot near Apata Station Rd. A St John Ambulance spokeswoman said two people were taken from the scene to Tauranga Hospital - one in a serious condition and one in a moderate condition. Police were first called to the area about 1.10pm. "Two crashes took place within a short space of time at the same location. It appears a ute went off the road, and after that a crash occurred between a car and a truck.

The images we have published out of Yemen may be as unsettling as anything we have used before. Here’s why we made the decision to publish them. Amal Hussain is a 7-year-old Yemeni girl with a haunting gaze whose image sits atop our latest report from Yemen, a country plunged into war and on the brink of a catastrophic famine. Amal is skin and bones, and her head is turned away, as if she cannot bear to meet the eyes of those looking at her. Some readers may feel they want to look away, too.

It was a situation which baffled many around the world, let alone the passengers on board the British Airways plane. Yesterday a British Airways passenger jet due to fly from London to Dusseldorf landed in Edinburgh by mistake after the incorrect flight plan was given to its pilots. The BA3271 flight was operated by German firm WDL Aviation - which was responsible for the aircraft and cabin crew - on behalf of BA as part of a leasing deal. It is understood one possibility is that on its final flight on Sunday, the plane had flown to Edinburgh and back and so the same flight plan was repeated again on Monday morning.

The best element of M. Night Shyamalan 's 2017 horror film , Split - and one of the few things everyone could agree on - was James McAvoy's riveting performance as Kevin Wendell Crumb, a man suffering from multiple personality disorder with 24 distinct personalities. Fans of the thriller will be delighted to know that McAvoy is officially on board for a sequel, which Shyamalan has titled "Glass". It is set to premiere in 2019 and will also feature returning stars Bruce Willis as David Dunn and Samuel L. Jackson as Elijah Price. The film will expand on the story, further exploring Kevin's mental illness and powers.

Britain 's double Olympic triathlon champion Alistair Brownlee claimed a dominant win at the Ironman 70.3 in Dubai in his first race of the year. Brownlee finished the course, consisting of a 1.9km swim, a 90km bike ride, and a 21.1km run, with a time of 3 hours 35 minutes and 30 seconds, outperforming his nearest rival by more than 6 minutes. A highlight of his performance was an exceptional 66km/h cycle section of the competition. Fellow Brit, Lucy Charles, took the women's event with a time of 4 hours and 15 seconds.

New research suggests mice with induced Alzheimer’s-like symptoms had improved cognitive function when given a synthetic estrogen-like hormone. “This synthetic hormone improved behavior much the way that estrogen does,” said study leader Dr. Christian Pike, associate professor at the University of Southern California’s School of Gerontology. But unlike estrogen, which enlarges the uterus and is a known risk factor for endometrial and breast cancer, PPT caused no obvious changes to the animals’ reproductive tract. “This may be a promising strategy to maximize hormone therapy benefits and minimize its risk,” said Pike.

German business sentiment dropped sharply in October to its lowest in more than 2-1/2 years, the sixth consecutive fall dispelling any lingering doubt that Europe's largest economy is now mired in the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo think tank said on Wednesday its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of some 7,000 firms, fell to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The clouds over the German economy are darkening," said Ifo President Hans-Werner Sinn. The euro hit a one-week low against the dollar and European shares turned negative following Ifo's release.

Don Draper : Who 's crying now ? When Jon Hamm last hosted “ Saturday Night Live ” in January 2015, he broke into tears at a stage-door good-bye after not taking home any Emmys for “Mad Men.” Recently, Hamm snagged the Best Actor statuette for his portrayal of the deeply disturbed Don Draper at last year's event. Fans hoped the acclaimed series would finally garner a farewell batch of SAG nominations — possibly boosting its leading man back onto “SNL.” Jon Hamm showed us that getting knocked down several times could always end with getting up with the coveted SAG trophy.

WASHINGTON (CN) – Republicans heaped ridicule on Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood at a Wednesday hearing after LaHood suggested that bicycling and walking are just as good ways to get around as cars. To laughter, Republican House members suggested LaHood was taking drugs, dismissed the very idea of bike lanes and derided any change to a car-dependent society. “What job is going to be created by having a bike lane?” asked Ohio Republican Steven LaTourette. He suggested that environmental sustainability projects have “stolen” $300 million from other programs and to attacked LaHood’s encouragement of bicycling, on a personal level.

New Zealand’s Abortion Supervisory Committee is appealing a High Court judge’s decision that said there is reason to doubt the legality of many abortions in the country. A registered practitioner may legally perform an abortion in New Zealand only if acting under a certificate approved by two consultants, who are appointed by the Abortion Supervisory Committee. The appeal also argues that the Court made a legal error in concluding that the committee can form its own opinion about the lawfulness of consultants’ decisions to grant or to refuse approval for an abortion.

The government support, combined with Le Wafel Café’s brand appeal and top-quality waffle creations, aim to propel the venture's success and solidify its reputation as a favoured spot among locals and tourists alike.

Long flights can be rough on the body, so it’s not uncommon to see people walking around the plane to stretch their legs. However one woman took it even farther by performing a yoga flow in the middle of the aisle. Kate Kay, a yoga teacher who was traveling for training, was captured on a now viral video by another passenger, showing her performing leg stretches, camel pose and a forward fold. Dressed for the occasion in patterned yoga pants and wearing headphones, Kay seems unaffected by those around her as she goes through the moves.

to go on for years? According to analyses by Net experts, the mass-mailing MyDoom worm, which began propagating yesterday, is the fastest-spreading software virus to date with an effect that could linger for years. MyDoom, which is also know as Novarg and Mimail.R, began spreading over the Internet yesterday. It now accounts for one of every 12 e-mails traveling through cyberspace worldwide, CNet News reported. The virus travels as an e-mail attachment that infects PCs whose users open the malicious file. Once open, the virus installs a stealth program that opens up a “back door” hackers then can use to take over infected computers.

South Bend (IN) -- Thursday morning, the Irish took the practice field for the final time before Saturday's Blue-Gold game. One of the biggest questions the team faced entering spring ball still has yet to be answered: who will step up at linebacker? Defensive coordinator Clark Lea said fifth-year linebacker Asmar Bilal is the closest thing the unit has to an 'absolute' at this point, but he seems ok with the uncertainty. He believes the position has made big strides over the last month and a half, but is in no rush to have everything in place with Week 1 still months away.

LL Cool J has become the first rapper to receive the prestigious Kennedy Centre Honour at the weekend , in LL Cool J made history as the first rapper to receive the prestigious Kennedy Centre Honour during a ceremony over the weekend. This year's list of honourees included iconic figures in American arts and entertainment, such as singer Gloria Estefan, dancer Carmen de Lavallade, television producer Norman Lear, and musician Lionel Richie. The awards celebration will be televised in the US on CBS on 26 December, showcasing the tremendous contributions these artists have made to the country's culture and history.

It's customary to leave a tip when eating out, but one particular gratuity added to an order for a milkshake and fries at a New Jersey diner is angering parents. "My daughter was coming to me, telling me that every time she and her friends went to the diner, they're being charged the gratuity," said Melissa Desch. "And when I asked her why, she said, 'Because they're children.'" Desch said her daughter Isabella and other students at the Colfax Schuyler Middle School frequently go to the Wayne Hills Diner, just across the Hamburg Turnpike from the school.

Shall we pause for just a moment to define impact investing ? Great ! Now that they ’ re gone , let's explore the increasing popularity of impact investing. With a focus on social and environmental concerns, impact investing attracts a range of investors keen to make a positive change alongside receiving financial returns. Despite being perceived as niche or risky, this sector is gaining mainstream traction, as demonstrated by high profile individuals and major institutions stepping into the impact investment arena. Experts predict an accelerating market expansion with rapid innovation, catering to a new generation of conscientious investors driving social and environmental improvements.

Moving into modern times , mobile game tool developer Corona Labs has acquired mobile cloud services startup Game Minion . Mobile game development company Corona Labs has acquired Game Minion, a mobile cloud services startup. The deal is expected to expand Corona Labs' gaming offerings while allowing developers more integrated development experience through a cross-platform software development kit. It will allow creators to continue to build and share various experiences to all the major mobile operating systems through the provision of accessible game networks and improved cloud features, such as game data syncing and enhanced mobile analytic tracking tools.

Sanford already has private attorneys. Garber said he was hired to protect the institution of the governor's office and to help lawmakers realize the gravity of their deliberations. "The eyes of the world are on South Carolina," Garber said Tuesday, adding lawmakers' decision on whether to impeach Sanford will have ramifications for future S.C. governors and the state. Garber said Sanford's disappearance for five days in June to secretly visit his lover in Argentina does not meet the high standard required for impeachment. The state Constitution says serious crimes or other serious misconduct are the only reasons for impeachment.

The carrier operates 744 mainline planes that vary in size , carrying 50 to 366 passengers each . For a brief period, the airline had faced several operational challenges, including logistical and maintenance issues, which resulted in numerous flight cancellations and delays. However, through efficient planning and restructuring, the carrier has significantly improved its on-time performance and overall customer satisfaction. It now continues to modernize its fleet, acquiring fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly aircraft to better cater to passenger demands. The company is actively seeking ways to expand its operations to further enhance travel experience and connectivity for customers in various destinations around the world.

If the U.S. presidential election were resolved on social media , Barack Obama would be the clear winner this year If the U.S. presidential election were decided based on social media interactions, Barack Obama would secure another term as president. Former President Obama still garners a tremendous online following and maintains a massive engagement on various social platforms, further establishing his wide reach and influence on virtual communities. The active role he plays on Twitter and other platforms potentially overshadows those currently vying for the presidency in 2021. However, his constitutionally restricted term limits prevent any chance of an extended political future as the nation's chief.

A rumored-to-be pregnant Kylie Jenner was finally caught in public. The 20-year-old was spotted at a construction site in Hidden Hills on Wednesday in a baggy black sweatshirt and sweatpants, accompanied by her best pal Jordyn Woods and Kris Jenner, TMZ reported. The Kardashian-Jenner family has yet to confirm Kylie's pregnancy, but multiple outlets, including TMZ, said she was about five months pregnant and expecting a girl with boyfriend Travis Scott back in September. Jenner did appear in a Calvin Klein ad along with her sisters last week, but her stomach was covered as to not show off a possible baby bump.

WATCH ABOVE: The National Lacrosse League and the Professional Lacrosse Players' Association have yet to reach a new collective bargaining agreement, threatening the start of the 2019 season. Ryan Flaherty reports. The National Lacrosse League (NLL) announced Thursday it reluctantly has no choice but to cancel the first two weekends of the 2018-19 season due to a labour dispute with its players. NLL has been negotiating with the Professional Lacrosse Players’ Association (PLPA) — the exclusive bargaining agent for players — and a collective bargaining agreement has not been reached.

Montana, Exxon-Mobil At Odds Over Oil Spill Montana and oil giant Exxon-Mobil are at odds over an oil spill in the state's Yellowstone River. Exxon-Mobil says it's doing all it can to clean up the spill and has promised to see the cleanup through. That's not enough for Montana's state officials — particularly its governor. They say that the company hasn't been forthright on the extent of the spill and that they're not doing enough. Michele Norris speaks with Montana Gov. Brian Schweitzer about those accusations — and the steps the state is taking to rectify them.

GENEVA – The Head of the UN Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict , Justice Richard Goldstone , today released a report accusing both Israel and Palestinian armed groups of committing war crimes during the 2008-2009 conflict in the Gaza Strip. The report called on both parties to launch credible internal investigations into their actions and establish accountability for alleged atrocities. The UN Fact Finding Mission further warned that failing to address the violations could lead to broader repercussions for future peace processes and regional stability. Both Israeli and Palestinian officials have been swift to denounce the findings, further highlighting tensions between the two sides.

Let 's stop trying to put a label on them and just be happy ! OK , I 'm just going to say it - nonbinary couples are challenging societal norms and paving the way for more inclusivity and acceptance. These inspiring couples demonstrate that love transcends traditional gender identities and roles. By shedding restrictive labels, nonbinary couples allow space for open conversations about gender diversity and help society to grow more tolerant and compassionate. So let's stop focusing on labels and start embracing love in all its unique and boundless forms, fostering respect and unity for everyone.

What exactly separates people from machines? Two things, actually: creativity and empathy. No matter what gets developed in AI, these are the two elements that can keep the agency services business alive, and keep marketers busy for years to come. AI is a complement to what you do. It is intended to augment your abilities. AI can create a layer of efficiency that companies are otherwise lacking and free them up to be doing the kind of work with incremental impact. Agencies have succeeded in the past because they are creative.

Georgetown University is a respected , private university located in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington , D.C . This area is known for its historic charm and picturesque streets. Recently, Georgetown University announced that it is divesting its endowment from fossil fuel companies, making a commitment towards sustainability and climate action. This decision comes as part of the university's growing focus on environmental concerns and global responsibility. As part of this plan, the university will not make new investments in these industries and will slowly phase out any existing investments, reinforcing its commitment to combating climate change and encouraging the use of renewable energy sources within the next 10 years.

It might not be the household name that devices like the Roku, Chromecast, or Fire TV are, but Nvidia’s Shield TV is still a capable streaming media player, so much so that it made its way on to our list of the best streamers you can buy. PARIS ( Reuters ) - Longchamp , one of France ’ s leading handbag makers , plans to increase its production capacity in France by 50% as it tries to cope with higher sales driven by an increasingly export - led business. Longchamp aims to increase French manufacturing with the opening of two more factories, demonstrating its commitment to the "Made in France" ethos, unlike many rival brands that have been offshoring production. Sales for the 68-year old French company totalled $630m in 2015 and could achieve mid-single digit growth in 2016.

TORONTO — Businesses are asking for major changes to the King St. pilot project or they ’ ll be considering Major changes have been demanded by businesses for the King Street Pilot Project in Toronto, threatening consideration of potential legal action. Businesses along the pilot route claim that they've faced up to a 50% decrease in revenue, whereas pilot studies suggest transit commute times improved with the project's implementation. Accurate ridership figures are contested. Criticisms centre on the repurposing of lanes previously available for car access into unused on-street dining extensions for restaurateurs which has reduced customers.

A woman was threatened when she was approached by a stranger in a street in Lindfield yesterday afternoon . Police A woman in Lindfield faced a threatening encounter with an unknown individual yesterday afternoon, prompting police intervention. Law enforcement has started conducting local enquiries and reviewing CCTV footage in efforts to identify the culprit. Authorities are also urging members of the public to come forward with any potential leads or additional information on the case. Furthermore, locals are being encouraged to remain vigilant, report any suspicious activity, and opt for safety precautions such as staying in well-lit areas and avoiding walking alone.

Study suggests complex behaviors were handed down for tens of thousands of years. Despite intense scientific inquiry, there are still major gaps in our knowledge about early human life. One major question that remains unanswered: when humans were first capable of complex cognition? In other words, when did early humans develop sophisticated cognitive abilities, such as prioritization and cultural transmission, that we would recognize today? A new study in Nature addresses this; after six years of excavation, archaeologists have unearthed technologically-advanced stone tools that were created about 71,000 years ago.

Progressive Networks' RealAudio and RealVideo streaming products got a shot in the arm today with the news that Microsoft plans to take a minority investment in the firm and license its key products, RealAudio and RealVideo 4.0. As part of the deal, Microsoft will incorporate Progressive technologies into Internet Explorer clients and the NetShow streaming server, and the firms will collaborate on making respective server and client products work together. In turn, Progressive will support Microsoft's Active Streaming Format (ASF) as well as its own file formats, and use Microsoft's DirectShow and DirectDraw APIs and other technologies in the next versions of its Windows clients.

Ely, in northeastern Minnesota, is the gateway to the sprawling Superior National Forest and its 1 million-acre Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, a popular recreation area. Ely is also the home of the North American Bear Center and the International Wolf Center. Whether campers are looking for a true wilderness experience or a somewhat less primitive encounter with nature, the Ely area has campgrounds to suit just about every taste. Just south of the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Bear Head Lake State Park (dnr.state.mn.us/state_parks/bear_head_lake/camping.html) is home to a wide array of wildlife, including bald eagles, black bear, moose and wolves.

UNITED NATIONS , August 26 -- Amid an increasing drumbeat of media coverage predicting US missile strikes on Syria , the United Nations Security Council held an emergency meeting on August 26th to address the rapidly escalating crisis in the country. As pressure grows for military intervention in response to alleged chemical attacks by the Syrian government, diplomats gathered to evaluate evidence and determine a plan of action. Meanwhile, Iran warned of the risk of spillover in the event of an attack on its regional ally Syria, increasing the tensions among key Middle East players. The outcome of these talks could significantly impact regional stability.

FORT LAUDERDALE — The Dillard High School Jazz Band will hold a concert on Oct. 22 at the African-American Research Library and Cultural Center in Fort Lauderdale. The theme of the concert is the “Discovery of Jazz,” tracing its roots from the beginning of the 20th Century to the present. The jazz ensemble, led by director Christopher Dorsey, earned First Place in this year’s Essentially Ellington High School Jazz Competition and Festival in New York City, the nation’s most prestigious high school jazz competition. The band also earned First Place in Savannah, Georgia’s Swing Central competition.

Trisha Pollard believes the Texas social services system relies too much on the courts to police Medicaid fraud and not enough on a tool placed in its hands nearly nine years ago: criminal background checks. "It just seems like something so simple," Pollard said Tuesday. "People in other walks of life are routinely put through background checks." The 52-year-old retired attorney stumbled across the issue last fall when she served as a Harris County grand jury forewoman. During her term, Pollard and fellow grand jurors returned indictments against two Medicaid providers, each of whom had a criminal past that included involvement in Medicaid fraud.

The entry below is by Katrine Øgaard Jensen, who is one of the founding editors of EuropeNow, a journal of political research, literature, and art at Columbia University. She previously served as editor in chief of the Columbia Journal and blog editor at Asymptote and Words Without Borders. Had Poe lived to read Alejandra Pizarnik, she would have given him nightmares. Revered by writers such as Octavio Paz, Roberto Bolaño, and César Aira—the latter calling her “the greatest, and the last” poet—Pizarnik is one of the most important contributors to twentieth-century Argentine poetry.

Box V2 scans for weak passwords and prevents you from accidentally submitting Password security app, Box V2, uses simple prompts and automatic cloud encryption technology to guard against submission of weak passwords. In Lean Times , Creative Bakers Turn To Desperation Pies : The Salt Vinegar pie and green tomato pie do not exactly sound delectable, but creative bakers have resorted to desperation pies amidst scarce ingredients in economically challenging times. Recipes containing cost-efficient, often unconventional, and seasonally available ingredients gain popularity due to a surge in grocery prices and various supply-chain issues. Utilizing readily-available, native ingredients in these delicious desperation pies offers a fascinating insight into how everyday foods can play a starring role in producing culinary delights while reducing wastage and staying within the budget during difficult times.

Stark County ’ s unemployment rate in August fell to 6.8 percent , the lowest it ’ s been since Stark County's unemployment rate in August decreased to 6.8%, reaching its lowest point since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Ohio Department of Job and Family Services stated that around 7,400 individuals were unemployed within the county during August. Stark County's unemployment rate is now on par with the statewide unemployment figure, however, it is higher than the national 5.2% average. Several factors, including more schools and businesses reopening and an uptick in hiring, have contributed to the improvement of local employment conditions.

UPDATED: The ShoreTel Sky for Salesforce application in particular will enable users to be able to automatically log all calls, voicemails and SMS messages. ShoreTel and Salesforce.com have announced a new partnership that will match up two resources for hopefully the greater good -- as far as big data is concerned. There are two applications at work under the plan: ShoreTel for Salesforce and ShoreTel Sky for Salesforce.

DALLAS - Like many Americans , Martin Jacobson was overjoyed that Navy SEALs had captured and killed Osama bin Laden Martin Jacobson of Dallas joined fellow Americans in expressing immense satisfaction over the news that the US Navy SEALs had successfully captured and killed Osama bin Laden. This military operation marks a significant turning point in America's fight against terrorism and brought a measure of justice to those impacted by the heinous September 11 attacks. Amidst relief and pride in the skill and bravery displayed by the Navy SEALs, Jacobson and the nation hope that this key victory would impede the growth and influence of extremist organizations around the globe.

Dundee United are to begin talks in the next few days in an attempt to prevent Scotland striker Steven Thompson leaving the club for nothing in the summer. New Tannadice owner Eddie Thompson is angry that recently sacked manager Alex Smith and the previous board had not already moved to secure the 23-year-old on a new deal. Striker Thompson is out of contract next summer. By then, he will have turned 24 and be able to leave for another club without United being due any compensation. He can begin talking to potential new clubs in January.

A communications professor at Texas A&M University wanted to find out about the effects of changes to the newspaper industry on our nation’s politics, so she did some research, which has been published in the Journal of Communication. If you have noticed what seems like a sharp increase in political polarization in the past few years, you are not imagining things. And, as Johanna Dunaway, and some colleagues at Colorado State and Louisiana State universities, found out, that polarization happened during a period of steady decrease in the number of local newspapers and journalists across the country.

Two members of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians have pleaded guilty to a murder committed early on November 2 Two individuals from the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians have admitted to their involvement in a homicide that occurred on November 2. They pleaded guilty to the crime during a hearing in the Choctaw Tribal Court. Further details about the victim, cause of death, or motive have not been disclosed. The incident adds to a string of violent episodes and tragedies on the Choctaw reservation in recent months. This highlights concerns regarding safety and the level of security provided to those residing within the community.

ALBANY — Gov . Andrew Cuomo — who has two Twitter accounts with more than 863,000 followers — called the Gov. Andrew Cuomo of New York warned that new technology enabling people to follow his comments via social media has facilitated a free, angry and potentially divisive dialogue. As individuals will respond more thoughtlessly and spitefully due to lack of personal engagement, these modern methods will generally spur hostility amongst social media groups, according to Cuomo. Highlighting the immediate sharing possibilities within Facebook, Instagram and Twitter, he advised social media participants to accept responsibility for increased uncivil online communications, noting a difficulty with effectual message restrictions.

The annual meeting of the Kelly Gang is normally a festive affair. The get-together, the brainchild of New York Post media columnist Keith J. Kelly, has been held on St. Patrick’s Day for the past three years at Langan’s pub, on 47th Street. The guests: media types and others celebrating their shared surname Kelly and their innate Irishness—over corned beef and cabbage and a pint or three of Guinness. But the mood changed when police commissioner Raymond Kelly arrived. Wearing a green tie, he tried to keep things light: “Kellys are fun people,” he declared.

KENTON, Del. - A Kenton cheese plant shut down by the Food and Drug Administration due to a Listeria outbreak has been inspected 10 times since the year 2000. An FDA spokeswoman says during that time, the presence of Listeria was never found at Roos Food's Inc. The agency also never received complaints. The recent outbreak left eight people sick. Seven were in Maryland. One died in California. FDA inspectors found a multitude of violations inside and outside the plant during the inspection that took place between February 18 - March 4, 2014.

Hearst Magazines will be busy in 2018, finalizing the acquisition of Rodale, snapping up some magazines in the Netherlands and upping the frequency of two of its newest titles. The Pioneer Woman Magazine, a joint venture with blogger and Food Network star Ree Drummond, published two sellout issues in 2017 and will double the frequency to four issues in 2018, Hearst Magazines president David Carey told staffers in his annual year-in-review letter. That’s a nice change for Airbnb, which tried on its own in 2014 to launch a magazine called Pineapple, which lasted only one issue.

In a rare instance, Dhoni, who was not even meant to be on the field of play, lost his cool and rushed out of the dug-out to challenge umpire Ulhas Gandhe after he flip-flopped on a no ball during the IPL match against Rajasthan Royals on Thursday night. "He was certainly fired up the way the decision was handled and why it was overturned. About 300 villagers from Kandal province locked in land disputes with private companies delivered petitions to embassies in Phnom Penh yesterday, before protesting in front of the provincial hall and calling for Prime Minister Hun Sen to help them. Villagers told the Post they wanted an end to land disputes caused by companies that had “seized their land”, adding that they would “rather die” than go home without a result. They said authorities had ignored their pleas for help while the companies had used the court system to have villagers who complained about the acquisitions arrested.

Up and down the East Coast voters braved very cold weather in the pre-dawn darkness as they queued up to vote in the historic 2020 US Presidential election. With over 98 million early and mail-in votes already recorded, Americans defied extreme temperatures to head to the polling stations, reiterating their determination to have their voices heard in this high-stakes election between incumbent President Donald Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden. In addition to selecting a president, US citizens will vote in a series of high-profile congressional races and state referendums across the nation.

Butler hit the headlines last week after posting a signed letter from Barack Obama on her website . The letter Butler, a popular writer and educator, recently made headlines by sharing a signed letter from former US President Barack Obama on her website. The letter expressed gratitude to Butler for the educational content she shares with her audience, noting that it greatly contributes to making information and resources more accessible to people. Obama also thanked Butler for inspiring young people through her content, emphasizing the importance of believing in themselves and shaping a more inclusive and diverse future.

Part two of Naomi Klein 's report on the events that triggered a momentous new kind of politics in Argentina Following the social unrest and financial collapse in Argentina in the early 2000s, a new form of grassroots activism has emerged that seeks to reconstruct the nation's economy from the bottom up. Facing debt defaults and extreme austerity measures, the population increasingly turned to localized activism in attempts to promote progressive social change, rebuking the injustices faced under international capitalism. However, over the past decade, attempts to apply this bottom-up movement in the mainstream national agenda proved a challenge, largely due to poor public services and corruption.

CNET's reporters are covering the launch of the much-hyped iPhone 4. Stay tuned for updates from New York City and San Francisco. It's finally here. The much-anticipated iPhone 4 is hitting store shelves on Thursday at 7 a.m. local time in each time zone where it's available. CNET has teams of reporters covering the launch in New York City and San Francisco. Marguerite Reardon and Caroline McCarthy will be heading up coverage in New York, while Erica Ogg, Josh Lowensohn, and James Martin will be keeping tabs on what's happening out west.

US President Donald Trump said his homeland security officials will make a plea to congressional leaders for a border wall and indicated he would not drop his demand for US$5 billion in wall funding that triggered a partial government shutdown. WASHINGTON (REUTERS) - Congressional leaders arrived at the White House on Wednesday (Jan 2) for a briefing in which President Donald Trump and homeland security officials will press their case for a border wall as he held fast to his demand for US$5 billion (S$6.8 billion) in wall funding that triggered a partial government shutdown now in its 12th day.

Sign on to RootsAction’s petition to the nation’s mayors and police chiefs affirming your support for the right to unfettered peaceful protest. Occupy Wall Street demonstrators won a major victory on Friday when Mayor Bloomberg and Brookfield Properties, the owners of New York City’s Zuccotti Park, backed down on their demand that the activists temporarily vacate the park for a cleaning and subsequently abide by new rules banning sleeping bags, much gear and even lying down on the premises. Demonstrators in numerous other cities weren’t nearly as fortunate.

An American Civil Liberties Union lawyer asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco today to block a California law requiring police to collect a DNA sample from anyone arrested on suspicion of a felony. The law is part of a 2004 voter initiative that gradually expanded the categories of people in the criminal justice system from whom DNA is collected with cheek swabs. The four plaintiffs are challenging a provision that went into effect in 2009 and requires the DNA sampling from all felony arrestees, regardless of whether they are ever charged or convicted of a crime.

WASHINGTON -- An Iowa egg producer at the center of a nationwide outbreak of salmonella apologized to a Congressional panel An Iowa egg producer linked to a nationwide salmonella outbreak issued an apology to a Congressional panel in Washington. The CEO faced questioning over the 2010 crisis that led to the recall of 550 million eggs and sickened around 2,000 people across the US. While the CEO took full responsibility and made substantial operational changes, concerns still remain among members of the public regarding food safety as lapses in food facility inspections continue to impact consumer trust in domestic agriculture production.

It 's Tax Day : Remember the Krewe of Procrastinators on Loyola Avenue ? Every once in a while , it's good to pay homage to the Krewe of Procrastinators on Loyola Avenue, as today is Tax Day. Taxpayers across the country are hustling to submit their returns in time. Remember that with online platforms and easier e-filing, it has become significantly easier to join the last-minute filing crowd, although filing your taxes in a rush can result in unnecessary stress and potential errors. It's essential for taxpayers to double-check their submissions and have necessary supporting documents.

Thr best place to start the mortgage process is to get preapproved by a lender . An important step to getting preapproved for a mortgage is to first assess your financial situation, including credit score, outstanding debts, and monthly expenses. By being preapproved, you'll have a clearer understanding of the loan amount, interest rate, and loan term options available. Additionally, a mortgage preapproval showcases your credibility as a buyer to potential sellers, improving your chances of securing your dream home in a competitive market. It is essential to approach multiple lenders to compare rates and find the best mortgage deals tailored to your individual financial situation.

The likeliest of sources stepped up for the Boston Red Sox on Sunday . David Ortiz , never one to shy away from the spotlight, delivered the crucial blow in their 5-4 win against the New York Yankees. Ortiz hit a dramatic two-run home run in the bottom of the eighth inning, securing Boston's first home sweep of New York since June 2018. The 41-year-old veteran slugger demonstrated that he still possesses the power to decide big games, reenergizing both the team and fans alike. With this impressive performance, the Red Sox improved their record to 24-20, giving their postseason hopes a major boost.

Jeremy Tucker is leaving the top marketing position at Nissan North American to “pursue other opportunities,” according to the automaker. A well-placed source says Tucker, who was vice president, Nissan marketing communications and media, was fired. However, Tucker describes it as a "mutually agreeable parting." Sales at the automaker have been lackluster and there has been some discontent among dealers about the brand’s lack of national advertising, according to another source. The automaker’s total calendar year 2018 U.S. sales were down 6.2% compared to the prior year.

Jeremy Tucker is leaving the top marketing position at Nissan North American to “ pursue other opportunities , ” according Jeremy Tucker has decided to leave his position as top marketing executive at Nissan North America, effective September 13. While a specific reason for his departure has not been mentioned, Tucker said he is leaving to pursue other opportunities outside the company. This follows a number of other leadership changes within the auto company as new management, including incoming president Ashwani Gupta and vice-president of regional operations Chris Reed, takes charge amid struggles with slumping U.S. sales and attempts to restore eroded dealer ties.

Google is updating its Google Drive Android app with a new Material Design look , as well as a few Google is revamping its Google Drive Android app with a fresh Material Design look, incorporating several new user-friendly features. These enhancements include improved navigation through folders, switch account functionality to gain instant access to additional files, support for visual change log, fast-access capabilities through files preview cards, a colorful theming of the Drive homescreen depending on the connected team and file rearranging tool. The Google Drive upgrade is expected to gradually roll out to all Android devices over the coming weeks.

DELRAY BEACH — Overdoses are on the decline in Delray Beach, continuing a trend that started last year. The latest data collected by the Delray Beach Police Department shows there were fewer citywide drug overdoses in March than that time frame last year and in 2016, when there was a record-breaking number of reported overdoses. As the country grapples with the widespread opioid epidemic, Delray Beach, often regarded as the rehab capital of the nation, is seeing fewer sober homes and fewer overdoses, data shows. There were 21 overdoses in March, roughly a third of the 59 reported overdoses in March 2017.

Demetrius Pitts, also known as Abdur Raheem Rahfeeq, was arrested by the joint terrorism task force in a plot to use a van filled with explosives on the Fourth of July. A man who pledged allegiance to Al Qaeda sought to kill members of the military and conducted reconnaissance in downtown Cleveland for a planned attack on July 4 -- but the Independence Day plot was foiled after a months-long investigation, federal officials said Monday. FBI Special Agent in Charge Stephen Anthony said Demetrius Pitts, also known as Abdur Raheem Rahfeeq, was arrested at 10 a.m. Sunday by the joint terrorism task force.

A toilet door recovered from a historic South Tyneside building now takes pride of place at one of the North East’s most popular visitor attractions. During a survey of a Regency townhouse in Beach Road, South Shields, staff at North-East company AAG Archaeology found what is possibbly the only lavatory door to make it into a museum collection. It was eagle-eyed archaeologist Ron Brown who spotted what is thought to be the best-surviving example of a classic North-East netty door sticking out of the rubble of a demolished toilet.

The Weeknd will team up with Daft Punk for a performance at the Grammy Awards . LOS ANGELES ( AP Canadian singer and songwriter, The Weeknd, is set to join forces with the electronic dance music duo, Daft Punk, to perform at this year's Grammy Awards. Daft Punk has not appeared live since they performed at the Grammys three years ago in a memorable performance featuring Pharrell Williams, Stevie Wonder, and Nile Rodgers. Rawalpindi : The secondary students of Sadeeqa’s Learning System (SLS) Montessori & High School celebrated Autism Awareness Day, says a press release. They look a bit frightful, but vultures are nature's greatest cleanup crew. They're amazing creatures with an incredible sense of smell, the ability to soar for hours without flapping and guts of steel. Learn about them Sept. 1 at Hawk Mountain in Kempton during Vulture Awareness Day. See a presentation by Red Creek Environmental Center at noon. Kids can do an "Eating Like a Vulture" activity and track vultures from the lookouts. The event runs 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. The activities are free; but trail fees are $6; $5, seniors; $3, ages 6-12.

The TTP is appare­ntly not able to fund its operat­ions for the want of money . ISLAMABAD : The Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) appears to be struggling financially, with a reported lack of funds impacting its operations. Recent talks between Pakistan and the United States focused on targeting terrorist groups in the region, including clamping down on funding and terrorism financing. Analysts claim that infighting and breakaway factions are affecting funding from the terrorist organisation's international sources. In light of these difficulties, TTP leaders are allegedly increasing its financial demands from its members and demanding provincial chapter chiefs undertake personal measures to generate resources.

LONDON -- An IT worker threw out a computer hard drive without realizing it contained $ 7.5 million worth of Bitcoin. The hard drive, accidentally discarded in 2013, ended up in a landfill in Newport, Wales. After the value of Bitcoin skyrocketed this month, the worker, James Howells, was urged to retrieve the discarded hardware. Despite offering the council 10% of the cryptocurrency's worth for funding waste excavation, officials said excavation posed a high environmental risk with slim chances of locating the hard drive. Without access to a unique private key on the device, the 7,500 stored Bitcoins are impossible to claim.

Shiv Sena executive president Uddhav Thackeray has urged Union agriculture minister and Nationalist Congress Party supremo Sharad Pawar to resign Shiv Sena executive president Uddhav Thackeray has called for the resignation of Union agriculture minister and Nationalist Congress Party leader Sharad Pawar amidst increasing fuel prices and concerns regarding inflation. Thackeray's comment was met with protests and stalling in the Indian Parliament as opposition lawmakers vehemently demanded government responses. Though there is strong opposition to increased fuel pricing, some government representatives argue that higher taxes have brought considerable relief, ultimately making the economy healthier overall.

As part of the LifeMedGreenRoof Project , the Standardisation Directorate in the Malta Competition and Consumer Affairs Authority ( MCCAA ) has constructed a 52 square metre green roof as an energy-saving measure on a healthcare building in Paola, Malta. By adding plants, sensors, thermal and moisture insulation and irrigation, energy consumption in the building was reduced by up to 7.42%. If the LifeMedGreenRoof Project was implemented on all government buildings, total savings could be €431,322.27 per annum. This initiative could benefit educational buildings too, with projected annual savings of around €201,293.69.

A local state representative is calling for fundamental reform of the state ’ s standardized testing system after the “ massive blunder" during the recent administration of tests led to confusion, disruptions, and misleading results. The representative stressed the need for reevaluating and overhauling the current testing system, taking into account potential alternatives, especially as exams contribute to high stress levels and influence teacher evaluations. Parents, teachers, and administrators have joined the call for change, pointing to excessive testing time, poor preparation, and miscommunication from officials as evidence that a reform is needed to better serve students and the community.

Is our efficient Tax Office killing this country ? I ’ ve never seen a story where the Reserve Bank The Reserve Bank is concerned that the efficiency of the Tax Office might be hindering economic growth in the country. High tax collection rates, while initially seen as a positive indicator, could discourage potential investors and stifle innovation. To ensure sustainable economic growth, the Reserve Bank calls for a balance between tax collection and business growth incentives, such as easing regulation and offering financial support programs. Without finding the right balance, economic stagnation may lead to unforeseen consequences, such as loss of job opportunities, hindering potential progress.

The Momtract by agency Mother New York gives bossing privileges Instead of flowers or cards. Ad agency Mother New York has a suggestion for a present for your mother, just in time for Mother’s Day. Why not give your mother control over an aspect of your life? The Momtract, which they’re calling ‘America’s premier legally binding gift,’ gives your mother authority over one thing in your life. The Momtract is based on the idea that what mothers really want is control, not candy or flowers.

Good afternoon and welcome to our live coverage of an `` incident '' in Bourke Street in Melbourne 's CBD An incident has unfolded on Bourke Street in Melbourne's CBD, resulting in major disruptions and response from emergency services. Details are yet to emerge on the nature of the situation, but citizens have been urged to avoid the area as police, firefighters, and paramedics attend to the scene. Public transport routes have also been affected by the incident, leading to traffic delays and further inconveniences for local commuters. As events unfold, we will continue to monitor the situation and update the story with the latest information.

ZAMBOANGA CITY—Terror is stalking residents of the island town of Pata in Sulu and it’s not coming from extremists, but politicians. Residents appealed for government help to prevent another attack on their island community which one of them said was triggered by the residents’ refusal to commit support to the incumbent mayor, Anton Burahan. “We are powerless,” said 60-year-old Bidin Jubail, a resident of Saimbangon, one of the villages on Pata island. Jubail recalled an attack on the island town allegedly by followers of Burahan on Jan. 2 who were armed with M203 grenade launcher, and M-14 and M-16 rifles.

Mr. Hidetoshi Sakuma has been serving as President and Representative Director in The Chiba Bank, Ltd. since March 1, 2009. He joined the Bank in April 1976. His previous titles include Director of Market Sales, Director of Business Planning, Director of Main Branch Sales and Managing Executive Officer in the Bank. He obtained his Bachelor's degree in Political Economy from Waseda University in March 1976. Mr. Osamu Kimura has been serving as Vice President and Representative Director in The Chiba Bank, Ltd. since June 2016. He joined the Bank in April 1981.

The Duchess of Sussex 's maternity wardrobe may cost a royal sum , but yours does n't have to . The Duchess of Sussex's maternity wardrobe showcases stunning designer pieces which come with a hefty price tag. However, replicating Meghan Markle's style does not require breaking the bank. Affordable high street brands offer budget-friendly alternatives and fashion-forward options for moms-to-be. Also, look out for discounted luxury designer pieces during seasonal sales or consider second-hand stores and platforms like Depop or Poshmark to add timeless pieces without splurging. Combining affordable choices with long-lasting essentials will give a royal feel without compromising on your finances.

DALLAS - Like many Americans, Martin Jacobson was overjoyed that Navy SEALs had captured and killed Osama bin Laden. But the Dallas resident felt a deeper connection to the men who hunted down the mastermind of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks. Decades ago, he was one of them. During World War II, Jacobson was part of elite groups that were predecessors to the SEALs. The secretive force is used to staying out of the spotlight, but it's back in the headlines following the bin Laden killing. "I'm just proud of the SEALs," said Jacobson, 89.

At NSE , shares of Nestle climbed 5.35 per cent to Rs 6,185.05 . At BSE the stocks surged by Shares of Nestlé India surged 5.35% to Rs 6,185.05 ($87.47) at the National Stock Exchange and increased by 5.27% to Rs 6,181.35 at the Bombay Stock Exchange after an analyst recommended the stock due to a variety of factors. A research analyst suggested that accelerated growth rates, expanding margins, scale-up of product categories and robust financial management contribute to a positive outlook for the company in the upcoming quarters, attracting investors and propelling shares higher.

New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio isn’t visiting Israel until August. But that doesn’t mean he can’t hold hands and dance with Hasidic Jews before then. Dublin : Lawmakers overwhelmingly voted on Friday to back Ireland 's first bill on abortion , legalising the practice in extreme circumstances where the woman's life is at risk. After two late-night sittings and passionate debate from both sides, the lower house of the Irish parliament passed the Regulation of Termination of Pregnancy Bill by 90 votes in favour and 15 against. It comes six months after 66% of the population voted in a referendum to overturn a constitutional ban on abortion in the predominantly Roman Catholic country. The bill will now be passed on to President Michael D. Higgins for final approval.

ABC TV political discussion program Insiders is coming to Byron Bay. Host Barrie Cassidy will guide a visiting panel that will include journalists David Marr, Alice Workman and Peter van Onselen, to discuss the big political developments of 2018. David Marr is regarded as one of Australia's most influential commentators, writing on subjects ranging from politics and censorship to the media and the arts. He has been a journalist since 1973 and is the recipient of four Walkley awards for journalism. Alice Workman is the political reporter for BuzzFeed News, based in the press gallery at Parliament House.

THE Lifetime TV channel says it will air a movie about Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown ’ s relationship . Lifetime TV is set to broadcast a movie focusing on Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown's relationship. The channel, known for its biopics and stories revolving around real-life events and personalities, plans to delve into the complex dynamics between the iconic singer and her controversial ex-husband, exploring their rise to fame, whirlwind romance, and struggles that eventually led to their heartbreaking separation. No release date has been announced yet for this Whitney and Bobby film.

Butler hit the headlines last week after posting a signed letter from Barack Obama on her website. The letter described Butler as 'bright, intelligent and determined'. She later admitted her staff came up with the words and Obama just signed it. Before entering the Commons, Butler worked as an officer for the GMB union. She replaced Paul Boateng as MP for Brent South in 2005, becoming the third black female MP. She was promoted to her present job in September 2008. Butler is the daughter of immigrants from Jamaica. She was brought up in London where her parents own a small West Indian and European bakery.

Not only did former BP chief executive Tony Hayward go sailing on his yacht at the height of the oil-spill crisis, but he’s also not sorry about it. In his first interview since stepping down as CEO of BP, Tony Hayward told the BBC that seeing his son for the first time in three months was just as important. "I have to confess, at the time was pretty angry actually,” he said of the fierce backlash from the White House and people in the Gulf of Mexico. “I hadn't seen my son for three months.

It was a Saturday morning. August. I remember it vividly. I was online, sat up in bed, browsing, not looking for anything in particular. An article caught my eye: it was about the refugee crisis. Men, women and children were risking their lives to get to western Europe, and many were dying in the process. It was a story of endurance and terrible trauma. In response I expected compassion, a swell of fellow feeling. But my heart sank as I read the comments. There was so much cruelty.

Relatives of the deceased bravely listened as the circumstances of the deaths were heard in detail. Harrowing details of how the Clutha helicopter victims died were read out at the Fatal Accident Inquiry today. It came in a joint minute of agreement - a legal mechanism which means the Crown and 14 other legal parties at the probe will not challenge the details. Gary Arthur, 48, a sales advisor was found in the pub trapped by rubble. He had no pulse when found by mercy crews. A post mortem found he had died from head injuries.

Bob Cannard shovels compost which orignally came from San Francisco food scraps at Green String Farms outside Petaluma, Calif., on Friday, Mar. 6, 2009. As a parent and someone who has worked with parents for many years, I was struck by the focus of the front-page report on the heartbreaking death of a baby in El Cerrito ("Baby's death in car tragic lesson for all parents," June 10). The premise that parents can "easily forget that their children are in the backseat" is, sadly, all too true.

WASHINGTON -- A Marine who was declared a deserter nearly 10 years ago after disappearing in Iraq and then returning to the US claiming he had been kidnapped, only to disappear again, is back in US custody, officials said. Marine Corps spokesman Lt. Col. Corey Schultz said, "He turned himself in to U.S. Border Patrol agents at the U.S. Mexico border last night" following this he has since been turned over to the US military, although Schultz added no information regarding what prompted him to desert could be provided at this stage.

While giant and spectacular circus shows now roam the Earth, it’s good to be reminded how they evolved from what was essentially street theatre. This Colombian acrobatic troupe, a dozen or so young performers delivering the world premiere of their latest show, are one of the main attractions of Blackpool’s now firmly-established February half-term Showzam Festival, featuring acts from around the world. Circolombia head to London after five days of performance here but nothing is ever going to quite match seeing them in the roccoco surroundings of the circus ring that nestles between the legs of Blackpool Tower.

Paytm Money recently added a few features into its iOS app to make it easy for consumers to invest their Paytm Money has introduced several new features in its iOS app aimed at simplifying investing for consumers. Notably, users can now buy digital gold within the app through investment plans and wealth portfolios, monitor gold prices in real-time, and manage subscription orders via the Dashboard. Additionally, users can download account statements, reports, and upload files related to portfolio trackers with an iCloud drive. With these enhancements, Paytm Money seeks to provide a seamless and secure investing experience for its iOS app users.

(Host) Two groups involved with mental health care want to know which Vermont doctors got thousands of dollars last year in gifts from drug companies. The companies can withhold some of the names under a law that protects trade secrets. The groups say that loophole should be closed. (Dillon) Last year, physicians and other health care providers in Vermont got about $3.1 million dollars in gifts from pharmaceutical companies. Vermont is one of a few states that require the drug companies to disclose these kinds of marketing expenses. The payments include consulting fees, travel, gifts and money for lectures.

PREBLE COUNTY — With two serious crashes involving young people occurring in Preble County over the past week, Preble County Sheriff Mike Simpson discussed summer driving practices as younger, less experienced drivers become more active during the summer. According to Simpson, during the summer roadways often become more active and younger drivers tend to be on the road more because they are no longer in school. “With kids out of school or kids back from college, there a lot more of younger drivers on the roadways going back and forth from events or work now that they aren’t in schools for 6-7 hours a day,” Simpson said.

JAIPRAKASH HOSPITAL is undergoing a face-lift these days with the wards being whitewashed, painting of walls, etc. Some new facilities are also being added in the hospital. The hospital’s OPD, paediatric ward, female ward and other areas have been revamped and bear a new look. Next on the agenda for a face-lift is the hospital’s upper floor. The amount sanctioned by the State Government for augmentation of facilities at the hospital is being utilised for refurbishment. An additional Rs 18 lakh has been sanctioned for carrying out further improvements at the hospital.

Dundee has long been a city of rich character, great wealth and extreme poverty. If the new V&A can give it a transformational boost, it will be worth every penny. I declare an interest. I went to the embryonic Dundee University in the last year it was a college of St Andrews and, like many whose lives were touched by the city, I have retained a strong affection for place and people. Not everyone grew to love it. In these days, “clearing” sent hordes of last-minute placements to what they fondly anticipated as the cloistered life of Queen’s College, St Andrews.

John Tory has his first real competition in the mayor’s race. Jennifer Keesmaat, the city’s former chief planner, registered Friday before the 2 p.m. deadline to run for mayor. Keesmat said that she made the decision so recently that she didn’t have time to alert her parents that she was running. “It was a very impromptu decision but one that comes deeply from my heart and passion for this city,” she said, when asked if she was joining the race because of Premier Doug Ford’s announcement that he was cutting the size of council to 25 members.

UPDATED : The ShoreTel Sky for Salesforce application in particular will enable users to be able to automatically log all The ShoreTel Sky for Salesforce application will enable users to automatically log all inbound and outbound customer interaction, reducing manual call documentation, thus increasing productivity. Businesses using this app will have an immediate access to the customer details when they call in, with employee-customer communication seamlessly integrated across cloud applications. Such cloud functionality enhancement will allow IT providers, like Datapipe and Pro2Plan, to maximize customer success, unify contact channels, provide customisable call tracking for audit control, ensuring no delay between implementation and application.

Study suggests complex behaviors were handed down for tens of thousands of years . Despite intense scientific inquiry , there is still much to uncover about early human behavior. A recent study has revealed that complex behaviors such as advanced stone tool making may have been passed down through generations for tens of thousands of years. This finding offers vital insight into how prehistoric societies shared information, structured their social groups, and ultimately transformed human history. Further research will aid in uncovering how cultural and technological evolution played a part in shaping the development and adaptability of human populations through time.

Relatives of the deceased bravely listened as the circumstances of the deaths were heard in detail . Harrowing details of the tragic incident were revealed in court, leaving the families of the victims visibly emotional. The testimony shared graphic accounts of the incident, detailing how their loved ones met their untimely end. As the proceedings continued, support from the legal and medical teams aided the bereaved families in grappling with the heavy loss. A mix of determination and sorrow loomed as they seek answers, closure, and justice for their departed family members, a necessary step in healing and honoring their memory.

It happens : You hit the snooze button once , twice , then three times , so when you 're finally awake, there's no time left for a full workout. Now, fitness enthusiasts have a solution with a newly released mobile app called 3Vibrant Health. This app is specifically designed to help you make the most of the few minutes you have for exercising. With the 3Vibrant Health app, missing a morning alarm no longer means skipping daily fitness.

Former Chicago police officer Jason Van Dyke was sentenced Friday to six years and nine months in the killing of 17-year-old Laquan McDonald, more than four years after the shooting. Jason Van Dyke, the former Chicago cop whose fatal 2014 shooting of black teenager Laquan McDonald reignited the fervent nationwide conversation about police shootings, was sentenced Friday to six years and nine months in prison. The veteran police officer was convicted in October of second-degree murder and 16 counts of aggravated battery with a firearm for the shooting in October 2014. The shooting and video of it prompted protests throughout Chicago and calls for Van Dyke to face serious prison time.

The drama started when Jenelle Evans and her mother Barbara were hanging out . While the two have had a The drama between Jenelle Evans and her mother Barbara intensified recently as they were spending time together. Known for their tumultuous relationship, the two have had numerous ups and downs throughout the years. This time, the argument took a turn for the worse when hurtful words were exchanged, bringing out unresolved tensions between them. With the argument leaving a visible strain on their bond, fans are wondering how long it might take before mother and daughter make amends and whether this disagreement could truly fracture their relationship permanently.

NEW YORK — A lawyer whose rant against workers speaking Spanish at a New York City restaurant issued an apology A New York lawyer who berated staff for speaking Spanish at a city restaurant has apologised. Aaron Schlossberg was filmed accusing staff of "speaking Spanish to customers", adding: "My guess is they're not documented." The video sparked outrage, resulting in thousands being raised to send a Mariachi band to perform outside Schlossberg's office. In a statement, Schlossberg acknowledged he did not handle the situation properly and apologised, saying: "What the video did not convey is the real me."

Seton Catholic’s Jenna Barker set a sectional record by winning the 1,600-meter run in 5 minutes, 13.04 seconds, and also won the 800, as several area athletes qualified for the regional during Tuesday’s IHSAA girls track and field sectional at Connersville High School. Other individual sectional champions included Riley Austin of Richmond in both the 200 and the long jump, Nakala Bennett of Richmond in the 100, Hanna Stamm of Seton Catholic in the 3,200, and Austin, Lindsey Griffin, Payton Vanmiddlesworth and Riley Wetzel of Richmond in the 400 relay.

The Board of Intermediate Education Karachi (BIEK) on Thursday reported 20 cases of cheating to the board’s committee looking over the matter. According to the board, 16 students were in possession of cheating materials, whereas three candidates were found using mobile phones and another tore an examination copy. The BIEK had on Wednesday reported at least one case of impersonation, while another student was said to have made away with his answer script from the examination centre among eight other cases. In another incident a student was caught using a smartwatch to solve his paper.

Each year, the palike and state authorities ensure that Bangaloreans are forewarned before Diwali about being safe. However, just like the past years, over 60 firecracker-related casualties have already been reported in the city this year as well. Shockingly, this year kids aged between 4 and 14 have sustained eye injuries as a result of ignoring fire safety precautions. The city has been aglow since Tuesday with the festive spirit, but hospitals in city received a total of 60 casualties related to firecrackers. To add to this number however, since yesterday local clinics in several residential areas have been seeing patients coming in on an hourly basis.
