TOKYO (AFP) - Nearly half of Tokyo's residents could not name a single Paralympian and international sporting officials are worried about the city's readiness to accommodate athletes. As the 2020 Games approaches, the Japanese capital has work to do. "If the Paralympics is not a success, the Tokyo Games are not a success," Tokyo Governor Yuriko Koike told Agence France-Presse in a recent interview. So with an eye to filling stadiums, Tokyo has embarked on an overhaul of its infrastructure, making its subway system disabled-friendly and reaching out to hotels to check on their ease of access for wheelchair users.

Tech execs discuss the impact automation technologies are having on their organisations. For many organisations and their workers, technology automation is an opportunity and a threat. On one hand, using robotic process automation and other tools creates efficiencies by automating manual and repetitive tasks. On the other, it has the potential to make jobs redundant. Tech execs gathered at roundtable events in Sydney and Melbourne recently to discuss the impact automation technologies are having on their organisations. A key issue raised during the discussion was the challenge of ensuring governance policies and procedures are followed as ‘bots’ replace tasks carried out by humans across the business.

( Left to right ) Sam and Teska Frisby , Marsha Thompson and Boheme Opera NJ Maestro Joseph Pucciatti . Boheme Opera NJ recently held an open-air, socially-distanced fundraising gala featuring music and opera performed live by popular soprano Marsha Thompson, musicians Sam and Teska Frisby, and under the direction of Maestro Joseph Pucciatti. The event not only delighted its audience with captivating performances but also successfully supported the continuation of the Opera House in its dedication to the arts, paving the way for the forthcoming anniversary celebrations and upcoming shows planned as they adapt to the ongoing COVID-19 restrictions.

The infamous Kiran Dhawan murder case is all set to take centre stage once again with the police trying to ascertain if the man accused of murder has been arrested rightly or not. The police is set to reopen the case as it has been claimed that fresh evidence is pointing finger at someone else. The police is seeking production warrant of the accused Parkash, who is lodged in Central Jail, and would demand his brain mapping and narco-analysis test. A senior official said the police had doubts if he was the actual killer or not as there was no corroborating evidence to support the theory.

Sen. Martha McSally urged secretaries of the Army, Navy, and Air Force and universities to look at the environments that can lead to sexual assault. Sen. Martha McSally continued to speak about her experiences with sexual assault Thursday during a keynote address to service secretaries and university leaders about combating sexual assault during a conference at the U.S. Naval Academy in Annapolis, Maryland. During her 30-minute address, McSally, R-Ariz., urged service secretaries of the Army, Navy, and Air Force and universities to take a fresh look at the environments that can lead to sexual assault — such as putting 21-year-old service members in charge of 18-year-olds.

In the third quarter of 2018 , luxury home prices increased 3.2 % year over year to an average of $1.71 million, continuing a trend of moderate growth, according to Redfin's recent analysis. This figure marks a softening in the rate of increase compared to earlier periods, such as the second quarter's growth rate of 5.2%. Luxury market demand remains strong, as indicated by the relatively rapid median home sale pace of 65 days during Q3. High inventory coupled with softer growth signifies a slight cooling in luxury home pricing as the real estate market continues to stabilize.

As part of this partnership, the two countries have announced plans to work together to enhance economic ties and global cybersecurity standards. Furthermore, Suriname is one of the few countries to remain aligned with Taiwan despite pressure from the mainland Chinese government to isolate the nation diplomatically.

PARIS (Reuters) - Longchamp, one of France’s leading handbag makers, plans to increase its presence in China, its chief executive said, in sharp contrast to retrenchment by rivals and despite the economic slowdown and changing consumer culture there. Many leading luxury brands such as Kering’s (PRTP.PA) Gucci and LVMH’s (LVMH.PA) Louis Vuitton have put the brakes on further store openings in China as part of campaigns to preserve their exclusive image. “We are far from having fully tapped China,” Jean Cassegrain, chief executive of the privately-owned group, told Reuters in an interview.

A five-day event to promote cultural tourism using creative media will be held in August in the Gobi Desert , Mongolia, bringing together local communities, artists, and visitors. The event, dubbed the "Gobi Galaxy," aims to support sustainable tourism, economic opportunities, and artistic initiatives in the region. From August 20 to 25, attendees will experience a variety of events, including live music, visual and performing arts, and panel discussions focusing on Mongolian traditions and their modern interpretations. The Gobi Galaxy provides a platform to celebrate Mongolian culture and promote the potential of creative tourism in lesser-explored territories.

Two people have been injured in a crash on State Highway 2 near Whakamaramara . What was initially reported as a serious incident, later revealed that both individuals sustained moderate injuries in the accident. The crash, which occurred on State Highway 2 near Whakamaramara, caused disruptions to traffic, with authorities directing motorists to alternative routes while they investigated the scene. Emergency services, including police, attended to the injured and worked on clearing the road for traffic. It remains unclear what caused the crash; however, an investigation is currently underway to determine the circumstances leading up to the incident.

Central American referee Carlos Batres has fallen for the worst dive of the World Cup by the most theatrical Italian Central American referee Carlos Batres became the latest victim of a dramatic dive by an Italian football player during the World Cup match. Despite initially making the correct decision and ignoring the outrageous attempt at trickery, Batres succumbed to the player's theatrics and reversed his call, much to the dismay of fans and commentators. This decision will inevitably prompt more discussions around the adoption of technology like Video Assistant Referee (VAR) in football and the need to curb playacting to maintain fair gameplay.

Gaza is the world’s biggest prison. Nearly two million Palestinian people are locked up there by Israel’s military blockade. Last year, racist Israel killed over 2,000 Palestinians in Gaza, including 547 children. The Pentagon rushed in more bombs when the Zionist state ran low on ­ammunition. Baltimore, similar to Palestine, is under a racist military occupation. The Baltimore police force — the sixth largest in the 26th largest U.S. city — treats Black people like prisoners. According to the 2010 U.S. census, while 72 percent of the Baltimore population are people of color, 46 percent of the police are white.

Where were you when you received your 40 Under 40 award? It was 2009 and I was in my ninth year at Grubb & Ellis. In retrospect, I was a young professional, still honing my craft of brokerage in the commercial real estate business, building my expertise and perfecting my client service delivery. What has been your biggest accomplishment since you were awarded? While I appreciate being named a top producer within the company or local market, and have achieved high placement on the volume of deals completed annually, I am most proud of my successes on behalf of my clients.

The extraordinary mummified remains of a 50-year-old woman discovered in a fetal position is set to go on display at the National Museum of Mongolia. Found within the ancient Turkik burial site in the Altai Mountains, the 1,500-year-old remains were initially unveiled in 2015 but kept away from the public eye for extensive research. The body, hair, lashes, and brows remain impeccably preserved, likely due to the intense cold climate, allowing archaeologists a unique insight into the life and cultural identity of the early medieval Turks, including potentially tattoo art on her body.

When George Orwell wrote â€œ1984â€ he included a vision of the future in which people would converse in a language called. Orwell described Newspeak as “the only language in the world whose vocabulary gets smaller every year”. Orwellâ€™s idea with Newspeak was to have a world where all shades of meaning were removed from language, which reinforced the total dominance of the State. Calling something one thing when itâ€™s the exact opposite also might be an example of Orwellian Newspeak, like calling a bill full of spending on liberal social programs an economic stimulus plan.

The sad demise of late veteran actor Kader Khan has left a void in the Hindi film industry that cannot be filled. Condolences have been pouring in for the late actor and his bereaved family ever since the news came out. The actor, who passed away at a hospital in Canada, was remembered on his funeral held recently in Canada. On Wednesdays, family members and fans of the actor gathered in Toronto to pay their last respects. At Kader Khan’s funeral in Toronto, Canada, actor’s son Sarfaraz thanked everyone for coming and being through this tough journey.

May 20 (UPI) -- One man was killed and another was hospitalized after they were attacked by a mountain lion while biking in Washington on Saturday, authorities said. The 31-year-old man who was injured was upgraded from serious to satisfactory condition and was awake and alert, Harborview Medical Center spokeswoman Susan Gregg told KOMO News. The other man, 32, was found dead at the scene. King County Sheriff's Office said the two men were riding mountain bikes in the Cascades near North Bend, east of Seattle, when they encountered the mountain lion.

The plan focuses on mechanisms to reduce the energy requirements of existing buildings - public buildings in particular - and the role of dissemination projects in introducing energy-efficient measures.

Could drain tubes solve Compact conflict? How do we get more water into the Republican River? Could it be as simple as redesigning existing pasture dams to have drain down tubes installed? The 8 inch to 12 inch tubes would allow water from rainfall events to slowly drain out of the pasture dams and make its way to the Republican River. Wallarm has raised $ 8 million in a Series A round of funding that will be used to help the AI-powered cybersecurity firm Wallarm has secured $8m in a Series A round led by Toba Capital, with participation from Runa Capital, RRE Ventures and Starformer Capital. Wallarm's technology uses artificial intelligence and deep learning algorithms to identify cyber threats and adapts to help defend systems in near real-time. The San Francisco-based firm will use the funds to scale up its solutions globally and streamline customer support capabilities in key European markets, strengthening their commitment to help businesses find an adequate security defence against emerging cyberattacks.

DENVER -- During the summer of 2002 , Colorado state officials were dealing with the 138,000-acre Hayman Fire while trying to combat drought and tinderbox conditions. Almost two decades later, firefighters are once again tackling a historic blaze – the Pine Gulch Fire, now over 217 square miles in size. A result of frequent and extensive fires is an increase in real estate properties switching to "Firewise" materials and landscaped buffer zones for protection. These zones act as natural firebreaks and absorb excess heat during fires, reducing the spread of the blaze. More Colorado residents are now urging developers to integrate these buffer zones into communities.

When I went to meet Bono at the bar of his hotel , I saw Richard Gere seated at a table nearby. The U2 frontman, Bono, was in high spirits, discussing his recent charity work, as well as new U2 music on the horizon. In a surprising twist, Richard Gere joined our conversation, revealing his admiration for both U2's activism and musical prowess. Gere also shared updates on his upcoming film projects and humanitarian efforts, including working with refugees. The meeting concluded with both icons stressing the importance of compassion and working together to create a positive global impact.

Members of Lubbock's Muslim community reacted with surprise and dismay at the news of the Feb. 23 arrest of Saudi-born Lubbock resident Khalid Ali-M Aldawsari on charges of attempted use of a weapon of mass destruction. Imam Samer Altabaa of the Islamic Center of the South Plains had just begun to contact people in the Saudi community when contacted for comment Feb. 24. He said he did not know Aldawsari and had not heard of him before the arrest. He also said that no one in the Saudi community seemed to know Aldawsari, who identified as Muslim on his Facebook page.

Ryan Seacrest is back in the dating game! The 40-year-old American Idol host is currently romancing 26-year-old former Miss Teen USA Hilary Cruz, who he met through mutual friends, People reports. "It's new," a source close to Seacrest tells the magazine about their "low-key dinner dates." "They're having fun." The two reportedly met at Seacrest's February bash in Napa, Calif. celebrating his 40th birthday, Us Weekly also reports. The brunette beauty, who's appeared in TV movies like Beautiful & Twisted, is best known for winning Miss Teen USA in 2007.

My daughter, a resident advisor at her college, recently groaned while mentioning that she’d likely get additional foreign exchange students to supervise this fall. When I asked why that’s a bad thing, she said the foreign exchange kids tend to presume Americans are stupid unless proven otherwise. They assume Americans aren’t as well-traveled, or as fluent in foreign languages or as knowledgeable about world cultures. I said what any Good American would: Why don’t they stay home, then? Oh, she replied, they don’t think our colleges are stupid.

Richard Randolph Lamb , a resident of Dunsmuir , passed away on September 17 , 2009 at Mercy Medical Center Richard Randolph Lamb, a beloved resident of Dunsmuir, passed away at the age of 79 on September 17, 2009, at Mercy Medical Center. He leaves behind his devoted family and a host of friends and loved ones. Richard's warm heart and friendly demeanor made him an important part of the Dunsmuir community. A funeral service will be held to celebrate and remember his life, the details of which will be announced soon. Richard's memory will undoubtedly live on in the hearts of everyone he touched.

Israeli PM says he will deliver major policy speech for achieving peace with Palestinians . The prime minister has so far resisted committing to the international consensus for a two-state solution, where a future Palestine state would share boundaries that existed with Israel in 1967. Netanyahu said his vision was one where a demilitarised Palestinian state recognises a Jewish state but sources said the Trump administration were yet to support Netanyahu's parameters. Earlier this week, Abbas called on Israelis to listen to his message for achieving historic peace while reserving the right to attack Israel in international forums to curb building in the settlements.

In two weeks , two people have been bit by rattlesnakes . The first was on April 23 on Mount Lowe in Los Angeles County, while the second occurred on May 1 at Carbon Canyon Regional Park in Orange County. Authorities have warned residents to exercise caution while venturing into rattlesnake territory, as their population and sightings continue to increase during the spring and summer seasons. Officials recommend giving the snakes a wide berth and avoiding touching or provoking them, which may result in life-threatening bites. Both victims in the recent incidents are recovering, though such attacks can require extensive hospital stays and treatments.

When crews arrived , they saw heavy fire on all floors all the way up , including in the garage Upon arriving at the scene, crews were met with heavy fire engulfing all floors of the building, including the garage. Swift action by the firefighters was instrumental in tackling the rapidly spreading blaze. The extent of damage and the cause of the fire is still under investigation. Fortunately, there were no reported casualties. Local authorities urge citizens to practice fire safety and remind them that following simple guidelines can help avoid incidents of similar magnitude in the future.

Scout Gil Brandt of the Dallas Cowboys , the last member of the original group that built the Cowboys from the ground up, is finally heading to the Pro Football Hall of Fame after 60 years in the league. Known as "the Godfather of the NFL Draft", the 86-year-old former VP of Player Personnel will be inducted in Canton in August alongside the 2019 class, joining the ranks of Cowboys owner Jerry Jones, coach Tom Landry and quarterbacks Roger Staubach and Troy Aikman. Brandt has made a significant impact in NFL scouting history, utilizing technological innovations and pushing the boundaries to discover untapped talent in other sports.

OMAHA , Neb . – Nebraska men & apos ; s basketball player Deverell Biggs has been cited on suspicion Nebraska men's basketball player Deverell Biggs is under investigation for suspected driving under the influence and leaving the scene of an accident, according to Omaha Police. Biggs is not the first Nebraska player to be under the limelight for driving offences this year - Jervay Green and assistant coach Armon Gates were also arrested under similar allegations in recent months. Coach Fred Hoiberg states they will let the process play out and the parties concerned will then deal with any disciplinary actions accordingly.

NFL player Keenan Allen had a few things to say about Bell 's song . According to TMZ , during a recent live streaming session, Los Angeles Chargers wide receiver Keenan Allen openly shared his negative opinions on Le'Veon Bell's new rap song "Life's a Gamble." Bell, New York Jets running back and aspiring rapper, did not take Allen's criticism well and a brief online argument erupted between the two athletes. Though neither player dwelled too long on the disagreement, it added some additional fuel to the rivalry between the Chargers and the Jets heading into the 2019 season.

THE Australian men's water polo team have come agonisingly close to upsetting three-time defending champions Hungary in their classification stage semi-final, going down 10-9, and will now playoff for seventh position on Sunday. As they have shown many times throughout this Olympic campaign, Australia is just a goal or two away from beating the very best teams in the world on a regular basis. They seriously challenged pre-tournament favourites Serbia in their semi-final before giving up a three goal lead late in the game and today led with just under five minutes left on the clock.

Parts of Prince William Forrest Park in Virginia will re-open Monday after a March windstorm closed the park to visitors Portions of the Prince William Forrest Park in Virginia are set to re-open on Monday after being closed to the public following a devastating windstorm in March. While parts of the park will once again be accessible, ongoing efforts to clear debris and ensure visitor safety means that several areas remain closed, with officials cautioning against entry. The National Park Service has made the park’s visitor center and some trails available while clean-up continues.

To involve private sector in healthcare, what is really required is a heavy increase in public sector investment to reach out to more people. The nation has a new health policy after 14 years. The long gap itself indicates the priority, or the lack thereof, accorded to a sector that is in need of some urgent attention and has deep linkages with the nation’s aspiration to grow faster and emerge as a strong economy in the global order. The new policy has proposed seven key shifts in organising healthcare services, among them a welcome change in primary care from selective to assured comprehensive care with linkages to referral hospitals.

New York bachelor Bobby (Matthew Scott) takes stock of his romantic life in “Company,” at Signature Theatre through June 30. Arlington  For Bobby, the word marriage is actually a sentence — a jail sentence. A perpetual bachelor, he is turning 35 and surrounded by five married couples who all have an opinion about his lifestyle in the Stephen Sondheim musical “Company,” now playing at Signature Theatre. Whether with envy or mild disapproval, “Company” features Bobby’s friends battling him and one another in a series of comic scenarios as he struggles to commit to commitment.

Sarah Haire heard rumblings about a storm approaching the coastline , but she expected it all to blow over . Sarah Haire had heard rumblings of a storm approaching the coastline, but she expected it to blow over without causing any major issues. However, the storm escalated unexpectedly, growing in intensity and catching locals off guard. Authorities have now issued severe weather warnings and are urging residents to take necessary precautions as they brace themselves for heavy rainfall, strong winds, and possible flooding. Emergency services are on high alert and preparing for potential rescue and relief operations.

For small businesses that sell on credit , accounts receivable can make up a substantial portion of the balance sheet Small businesses relying on accounts receivable might find it significantly contributing to their balance sheet, often leading to working capital management issues. Timely invoicing, offering incentives for prompt payments and implementing strong credit policies can help small businesses maintain a positive cash flow. Proper management and regular reviewing of accounts receivables become vital for businesses seeking consistent growth and reducing bad debt. It is important that small businesses efficiently manage their cash inflows and collections while offering credit sales to attract and retain clients.

Dundee has long been a city of rich character , great wealth and extreme poverty . If the new V &A Dundee initiative proves successful, it may become a hub for emerging arts, design and creativity. Launched to showcase the talents and stories of the local people, the project includes the redevelopment of the waterfront area and the new V&A Museum of Design. Aimed at overcoming socio-economic issues faced by many of its residents, the project seeks to establish Dundee as a cultural centre and major player on Scotland's economic stage.

LOS ANGELES ( AP ) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will have surgery Wednesday to repair torn ligaments in his Los Angeles Kings forward Anze Kopitar is set to undergo surgery to repair torn ligaments in his right wrist, following an on-ice injury on February 12. The recovery and rehabilitation period is expected to take about 3 months, ruling him out for the remainder of the 2021-2022 season. The veteran center will be a major loss for the Kings, as he currently has 17 goals, 42 points, and is their top goal-scorer this season.

It looked like the scene after an earthquake . A sea of orange boxes littered the floors , shoes stuffed in them. In Tokyo's Sunshine City shopping complex, customers eagerly searched through piles of newly launched limited edition Pokémon sneakers in collaboration with Japanese designer Hiroshi Fujiwara's Fragment label. Amidst the frenzy, workers attempted to maintain some order. Launched earlier in the week, the sneaker mania reflects the unstoppable appetite for unique pop-culture merchandise in Japan. Fans anticipate that these sneakers, priced at 13,200 yen ($120), will not only elevate their style but potentially increase in value as collectors' items in the future.

`` Fox & Friends '' convenes all-male panel to judge whether women are `` covering up their lady-parts '' On "Fox & Friends" sparked controversy recently by assembling an all-male panel to discuss whether women should 'cover up their lady-parts.' The show drew criticism from many viewers, who argued that having a panel of men decide on an issue relating directly to women's clothing is inappropriate and offensive. Critics suggested that including a diverse range of voices, particularly women themselves, could have contributed to a more nuanced and informed discussion of the matter at hand.

It 's safe to say Cleveland Browns cornerback and ASU alum Damarious Randall was n't expecting a response like this Cleveland Browns cornerback and ASU alum Damarious Randall promised to buy fans a jersey each if the Cleveland Cavaliers lost in the NBA Finals. After tweeting the bold statement, the bet quickly garnered over 820,000 retweets with fans requesting various expensive jerseys if the Golden State Warriors prevailed. The record-breaking tweet saw Randall engaging fans, quickly backtracking on the possible total cost – $70m by some calculations – and making an unexpected philanthropic compromise, agreeing to donate jerseys to a local charity or school district instead.

The sixth race of the Charlevoix Yacht Club's summer series was sailed on Aug. 8 in light and variable winds. Twenty-two boats finished the race, which consisted of a shortened course of six windward-leeward legs. Affinity was the fastest boat overall, and only 26 seconds corrected time separated the first three boats of the Spinnaker A fleet this week. Two more races and one more drop will determine the summer series totals. Race results provided by Mike Miller and Keith Attee, committee chairs. Jib and Main fleet: 1 - Sonnett (Lepmann); 2 - Exitus (Pung).

Baceapp Corp. and LightSpin Technologies will move to BU's Engineering and Science building. Two companies plan to create 39 jobs and invest $540,000 over the next five years while residing in tax-free zones at Binghamton University, Gov. Andrew Cuomo's office announced Monday. Baceapp Corp. and LightSpin Technologies Inc., which will move to the Engineering and Science Building at BU, were two of the 17 companies unveiled Monday as the newest participants in Start-Up NY, a program that offers no taxes for 10 years in locations near or on college campuses.

WATCH ABOVE : The National Lacrosse League and the Professional Lacrosse Players ' Association have yet to reach a new collective bargaining agreement, raising concerns about the 2018-19 season. Negotiations have been ongoing, but little progress has been made, and the deadline is fast approaching. Commissioner Nick Sakiewicz has commented that despite discussions with the players' association over the last six months, a meeting of the minds has yet to occur. With the new season due to kick off in December, players and fans are increasingly worried about a possible delay in start or cancellation of the entire season.

Want to end the war on whistleblowers ? Revise the Espionage Act . Over the past 100 years , the Espionage Act has become increasingly restrictive, often targeting whistleblowers and impeding investigative journalism. In order to support freedom of the press, accountability, and government transparency, the Act should be revised to establish clear legal protections for public-interest whistleblowers who disclose classified information. By setting specific standards for proof, shielding disclosures made in good faith, and acknowledging legitimate public interest, amending the Act can protect national security while fostering accountability and upholding the integrity of the US Constitution.

The Sparks added some much-needed inside muscle Wednesday when they completed a three-team trade with the Charlotte Sting and the San Antonio Silver Stars, landing dynamic power forward Sandrine Gruda from the Sting. In exchange, the Sparks will send their second-round draft pick in 2023 and the rights to an international player yet to be named to Charlotte. Meanwhile, the Silver Stars receive a 2022 third-round pick and forward-center Maria Colich from the Sting. Gruda's dominant inside presence is expected to bolster the Sparks' roster, bringing valuable experience and tenacity to the paint as they seek to contend in the upcoming WNBA season.

MOUNT PLEASANT, Sanpete County — School officials are asking students who aren’t up to date on immunizations to stay home for several weeks as Sanpete County deals with a mumps outbreak. There are two confirmed cases of mumps in Sanpete County, according to North Sanpete School District Superintendent Dr. Sam Ray. One of those is a student in the school district, he said. Another potential mumps case is currently pending while health officials await test results, Ray said. Ray did not say which school the student who has mumps attends, but said North Sanpete High School is “involved” in the outbreak.

SANTA MARIA , Brazil – Penny-pinching by a band known for its onstage pyrotechnic displays may have cost more than 230 lives in a nightclub in southern Brazil. Authorities investigating the January 2013 tragedy at Kiss Nightclub revealed that band members opted to replace the typical flares used for special effects with cheaper "hand flares" designed for outdoor use. The cheaper alternative did not have the necessary safety features, causing a massive blaze when it hit the club's soundproofing foam. The owners of the nightclub and two members of the band are currently on trial for multiple accounts of aggravated homicide.

Why ’ s an incendiary Dutch journalist on the payroll of the ex-Alaska governor ’ s political action committee ? Sarah Palin has hired Dutch far-right journalist and anti-Islam activist, Martin Bosma, as a media adviser for her Political Action Committee, raising questions about her motivations. Some believe this could signal her support for controversial anti-Islam stances, whilst others argue that she aims to amplify her voice in global affairs, amidst increasing extremism in Europe. It remains to be seen how the incendiary views of her new associate will affect her own image and potential influence on European political shifts.

The voter scam has been confirmed in several states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's chief election officer is warning residents of a potential scam to get sensitive information from would-be voters following similar concerns in several other states. The scam involves a caller claiming to work for a voter registration assistance organization. The callers offer to register residents over the phone and in some cases to send the voter an absentee ballot, said Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin. According to state law, residents can't register to vote or request an absentee ballot by phone.

Plenty of reasons exist to be skeptical of the 'smart home ' in its current form , but Amazon 's new partnership with KB Home, one of the largest homebuilders in the US, aims to change that perception. Together, they will create smart homes featuring an array of Amazon devices, like Echo, Ring doorbell, and Alexa-integrated technologies, all pre-installed during construction. These futuristic homes aim to give users an elevated and seamless living experience while providing maximum utility and automation capabilities. The tech giant believes that these innovations will effectively revolutionize the home building and smart home industries, addressing the needs of a technology-driven, connected society.

The Frenchwoman who received the world's first partial face transplant showed off her new features to the public Monday, saying in a heavily slurred voice that she now looks "like everyone else" and hopes to resume a normal life. Isabelle Dinoire's speech was difficult to understand, but she explained how she was disfigured by a dog bite last year, and she thanked the family of the donor who gave her new lips, a chin and nose. A fine, circular scar was still visible where the face tissue was attached in the 15-hour operation in Amiens on Nov. 27.

The life of the mind puzzles poets and neuroscientists who go about mapping it and labeling it, and, in my case, trying to find it. Thought itself is something to ponder in the Irish tradition and so, there are lots of concepts in the Irish language involving the mind, dreaming, and imagination. I'm only a student myself, so many of the nuances will be lost on me, but language is about conversation. I would love to hear native speakers offer more sophisticated thoughts on the vocabulary of Irish thought.

Four-term Governor Terry Branstad officially begins his fifth term today. Branstad, a Republican, left office in January of 1999 after serving 16 years as governor. In October of 2009, Branstad retired from his job as president of Des Moines University, the state’s largest medical school, and launched what he called a “comeback” bid for governor. Branstad is scheduled to take the oath of office at about 10:15 this morning. Branstad told a group of reporters and editors last week his wife, Chris, has urged him not to give a long, boring speech.

2019 is on the horizon , and plenty of companies hire fresh talent at the beginning of the new fiscal year. As 2019 approaches, numerous companies are gearing up to hire new talent to bolster their workforce for the new fiscal year. WASHINGTON , March 1 - Coming off a year of record-setting $ 1 billion-plus natural disasters , representatives of leading US insurers and environmentalists are meeting in Washington to strategize ways to tackle the effects of climate change on property insurance and ensure resilient housing policies. Extreme weather events in 2020 have highlighted the impact of climate change on homeowners, prompting collaboration between insurers, environmental organizations and real estate companies. The National Association of Realtors, American Family Insurance, Travelers and The Hartford are among the organizations participating in these discussions, seeking to enhance home-building codes and provide tools for improving infrastructure and hazard mitigation plans.

A senior citizen, 85-year-old Baburam Patil, was turned away for the third time when he to pay his water bill at the Maharashtra Jeevan Pradhikaran (MJP) office in Sai Centre, Ambernath. Patil, a resident of the area, was told there was a shortage of manpower. He has been trying to pay his bill, unsuccessfully, for weeks now. “This office is close to my house; the other centre is far away. I have always paid my bill here. While they always create a fuss each time, they eventually take my payment.

It’s a long walk from Billings, Mont., to Lincoln, Neb. – anywhere between 850 and 902 miles, depending on which road you take. But that’s the walk crusty and slightly addled Woody Grant has just set out on in the opening frames of Nebraska native Alexander Payne’s newest film. Payne has been nominated numerous times for directing and writing awards from the folks at both the Oscars and the Golden Globes, and he’s nabbed the scripting gold for "The Descendants," "Sideways" and "About Schmidt."

Contiki has launched its European campaign , ‘ Manny does Contiki ’ , featuring their hottest new star , Manny the Travelling Mannequin. This quirky campaign aims to capture the imagination of young travellers as they join Manny on exciting trips across Europe. Documented on social media platforms, like Instagram and TikTok, viewers can see Manny skydiving, mingling with locals, and even enjoying European nightlife. Contiki hopes Manny's relatable experiences and social sharing will drive interest among millennials and Gen Z for post-pandemic travels, blending inspiration, fun, and storytelling to resonate with its target audience.

Up and down the East Coast voters braved very cold weather in the pre-dawn darkness as they queued up to bring an end to one of the hardest-fought and most expensive election campaigns ever. Facing them was a choice between two men with very different visions of how to get economically struggling America back firmly on its feet. More than 100 people were already patiently waiting in line at the Falls Church community centre for more than half an hour when the basement gymnasium turned polling station threw open its doors at precisely 6am. "The polls are open! Go on in!"

A man has been jailed for keeping dogs for fighting at his home in Ayrshire . Tony Barbara , 50 , 50, from Ayrshire was sentenced to eight months in jail for keeping dogs for fighting at his home. A raid on his home by the police led to the discovery of 20 dogs suffering severe health issues, including scars and face wounds indicating involvement in dogfighting. The court sentenced Barbara under Scotland's Animal Health and Welfare Act 2006. Besides the prison sentence, he also received a ban on owning or keeping any animal for life.

Baceapp Corp. and LightSpin Technologies will move to BU 's Engineering and Science building . Two companies plan to create joint research and development initiatives within Boston University's (BU) Engineering and Science building. The collaboration aims to foster innovation, facilitate partnerships between BU's researchers and the companies' technological experts, and ultimately bolster growth and advancements in engineering and science sectors. Baceapp Corp., specializing in automation solutions, and LightSpin Technologies, focused on optical chip devices, will work closely with BU's faculty and students to integrate academic expertise into cutting-edge industry developments, expanding the horizons of both academic and technological achievements.

The Frenchwoman who received the world 's first partial face transplant showed off her new features to the public Monday Isabelle Dinoire, the French woman who underwent the world's first partial face transplant, made a public appearance to reveal her transformed appearance on Monday. Dinoire's revolutionary procedure had replaced her lips, cheeks, and part of her nose after an accident in 2005 left her face disfigured. Over the years, Dinoire regained control of her facial muscles and has been able to reintegrate herself into society successfully. She expressed immense gratitude for the groundbreaking medical breakthrough and hoped her case would provide a strong foundation for future transplants.

The work includes handling confidential information and responding to public inquiries regarding school policies and programs. Further, the employee is expected to be proficient in relevant software and technology to support efficient office functions. This position requires a high degree of organizational skills and the ability to multi-task effectively in a fast-paced environment.

Veteran congressman Jim Leach ( R-IA ) went down to defeat in the massacre of 2006 . I 'm no fan of political dynasties, but his likely successor Christine Pelosi, daughter of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, brings an impressive resume and unique skill set to the table. In an era of unprecedented polarization and divisive politics, Christine Pelosi's background in both public and private sectors provides a sense of renewed hope for cross-party collaboration. The next-generation Pelosi is well-versed in tackling pressing issues such as climate change, healthcare, and technology.

The main task of North Korea's junior minister for re-information is to refute everything ever said by French intellectuals. One year he did a special on Jean-Paul Sartre and began with Sartre's assertion that "Three o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do". As it was a drowsy Friday afternoon, the junior minister simply made a quick call and renamed his local football team 4.25 Sports Club. This made Sartre look very silly indeed, because the club play all their matches at 4.25pm. In fact every time they play, their fans chant "Are you watching, Jean-Paul Sartre?"

The Israeli ambassador and almost all staff have been evacuated from the country’s embassy in the Jordanian capital, Amman, amid growing fears of an assault on the mission similar to last week’s attack in Egypt. Fears of violent anti-Israel protests similar to those that erupted in Cairo were sparked following calls for a “million-man march” outside Israel’s embassy in Amman. The action, scheduled for Thursday, had been organized via Facebook. The motto, “No Zionist embassy on Jordanian territory” was published online earlier this week and has already attracted thousands of pledges to attend the demonstration.

The Bible teaches , “ Resist the devil and he will flee from you ” ( James 4:7 ) . James 4:7 offers important advice for living a righteous life: by resisting the devil, individuals can triumph over his wicked temptations. Upholding this teaching of the Bible will provide individuals with the guidance and strength they need to maintain a virtuous existence. Turning away from evil and staying steadfast in the pursuit of spiritual growth allows people to continually move closer to their divine purpose, and grants them the tools they need to recognize and confront moral adversity throughout their journey in life.

Seton Catholic ’ s Jenna Barker set a sectional record by winning the 1,600-meter run in 5 minutes , 13.04 seconds. Jenna Barker, a track and field athlete from Seton Catholic, broke the sectional record in the 1,600-meter run with an impressive 5 minutes, 13.04 seconds finish. This impressive victory not only marks a milestone in her high school career, but it also solidifies her position as one of the rising stars in the field of track and field sports. Fans and sports enthusiasts alike are looking forward to see what other achievements and accolades Barker can attain throughout her athletic journey.

England have called up Fulham 's uncapped goalkeeper Marcus Bettinelli for the games against Spain and Switzerland , while midfielder Adam Lallana is set to make his international return. Marcus Bettinelli is joining England squad ahead of matches against Spain in UEFA Nations League on Saturday and a friendly with Switzerland next Tuesday. Bettinelli, the Fulham goalkeeper, will provide backup alongside Stoke City's Jack Butland and Everton's Jordan Pickford. Meanwhile, Lallana makes a comeback to the squad after impressing manager Gareth Southgate in Liverpool’s recent wins against West Ham, Crystal Palace, Brighton and Leicester City.

Malawi Parliament has started soliciting views on interest rate capping bill which an opposition legislator moved in the 193 strong The Malawi Parliament has begun soliciting public opinions on a proposed interest rate capping bill introduced by an opposition legislator. The country has previously faced accusations from the International Monetary Fund over inflation rate targeting policy management, and experts warn that failure to enforce and stabilise monetary policies may risk Malawi’s eligibility for concessional financing facilities. Meanwhile, The International Chamber of Commerce in Malawi urged members to think through their decision on the bill, given that they could impede international investments if handled irresponsibly.

By detaining Haniyeh, Israel sent a message that Palestinian cash smuggling is coming to an end. It is an open secret that Hamas has been smuggling millions of dollars into Gaza through the Rafah crossing ever since the international community cut financial aid to the Palestinian Authority following Hamas's rise to power earlier this year. Yet Prime Minister Ehud Olmert's decision on Thursday to close the Rafah crossing to keep PA Prime Minister Ismail Haniyeh from bringing $35 million into Gaza was the first time Israel has actively intervened to stop the money flow.

It might not be the household name that devices like the Roku , Chromecast , or Fire TV are , but the new Nvidia Shield TV (2019) aims to give those devices a run for their money. Launching with an upgraded Tegra X1+ processor and support for Dolby Vision HDR and Dolby Atmos, the streaming media device offers more powerful performance and vivid display capabilities. Featuring Google Assistant and customizable app settings, the Shield TV (2019) includes features like 4K upscaling and access to Android TV's expansive content library, appealing to both casual and tech-savvy audiences alike.

Scout Gil Brandt of the Dallas Cowboys, the last member of the original group that built the Cowboys from scratch, was dismissed by new owner Jerry Jones on Tuesday. "(Jones) told me finances was the reason, that he's losing $29,000 a day," Brandt said. "He'll probably fire four or five scouts, including Bob Griffin. "I told him I know I did as good a job as possible. I feel good about the 29 years I had with the Cowboys. But it's a bad way for it to end.

LATROBE - Ainsley Battles is back in a Pittsburgh Steelers uniform . Battles , a safety , was brought in to fill the spot vacated by Morgan Burnett, who was released by the team. Ainsley Battles had been away from the team for over a decade, but was deemed to be the ideal choice to bolster the defensive secondary. He previously played for the team from 2000 to 2003 before stints with Jacksonville and Kansas City. As the Steelers seek to revamp their roster and defensive scheme, the hope is that Battles will help bring needed experience and depth to the unit.

A search for ‘ toxic mold ’ will result in hundreds of scary warnings and ‘ studies , ’ but recent research from experts indicates that toxic mold may not be as dangerous as it is believed. Many symptoms related to toxic mold can be traced back to moisture, rather than the mold itself. Additionally, experts at the American College of Occupational and Environmental Medicine stated that these scary studies' conclusions are unsupported and unjustified. Proper management of moisture and indoor air quality is the best way to mitigate potential issues, ensuring homes are less conducive to mold growth.

Brands are just starting to play with Facebook's full-screen mobile ads, but Wendy's social marketers already seem to be having lots of fun with the new format. The fast-food chain is running a campaign that uses a combination of photos, videos and GIFs to show how each layer of its hamburgers are made—like wavering pieces of cheese and a grilled beef patty. "The Wendy's quality story carries a lot of equity with our fans and we wanted to invite them into that story, literally layer by layer," said Mike Bueno, director, digital marketing at Wendy's.

If the U.S. presidential election were resolved on social media, Barack Obama would be the clear winner this year over Republican challenger Mitt Romney. The Obama campaign has embraced social media, with the president holding a huge lead in Facebook and Twitter followers, and the affiliated Democratic National Committee is using private social networking tools to communicate with some campaign operatives. There's also evidence that the Obama campaign has tapped into social media analytics to gauge voter sentiment and track the popularity of the campaign's messages. Neither campaign, contacted to discuss their social media strategies, returned messages.

THOMAS Duffy is a sculptor who is preparing a commemorative bronze to celebrate the life of a father he never knew. Thomas Duffy is creating a beautiful, commemorative bronze sculpture to honor the life and memory of his father whom he never met. The piece will stand as a heartfelt tribute that embodies the emotional bond he imagines he might have had with his late parent. Once complete, the bronze statue will serve as a personal reminder of his father's legacy, inspiring not just Duffy but also everyone who encounters the stunning and emotional artwork in its permanent display location.

BLOOMINGTON – The U.S. Attorney ’ s office has charged two local men with conspiring to distribute crack cocaine in Bloomington, Illinois. The defendants, Roosevelt Clayborn and Jessie Satterfield, were indicted by a federal grand jury last week for allegedly dealing narcotics across the city between July and November 2021. Clayborn is charged with two counts of possession of a controlled substance, while Satterfield faces multiple drug trafficking counts, including possessing crack cocaine with intent to deliver. If convicted, both men could face life in prison with a mandatory minimum sentence of 20 years due to prior drug convictions.

NASA will plunge a small robot into a volcano in Hawaii in order to map data and geographical features of its insides, such as fissures and volcanic vents. A similar robot is already exploring the volcano. “We don't know exactly how volcanoes erupt. We have models but they are all very, very simplified. This project aims to help make those models more realistic,” Carolyn Parcheta, a postdoctoral fellow based at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California, said, according to NASA. The robot, developed by NASA, can climb into areas that are inaccessible to humans.

From M1917 to M1A2 , American tanks have dominated the battlefield . The U.S. Army and Marine Corps are on the verge of deploying their latest cutting-edge armoured vehicle, the M1A3 Abrams tank. This new model promises enhanced speed, firepower, and survivability, ensuring the United States remains a leader in modern ground warfare. Some upgrades include lightweight composite materials, upgraded engine and suspension systems, enhanced 120mm ammunition and improved networking capabilities. This comes amid increasing global tensions, and experts say that maintaining superior land-based combat capabilities is crucial for the nation's strategic interests.

MOUNT PLEASANT , Sanpete County — School officials are asking students who aren ’ t up to date on immunizations to not come back to school until they comply with vaccination requirements. The policy has been implemented in Mount Pleasant, Sanpete County, Utah, as the area struggles to contain a hepatitis A outbreak, with eight new cases linked to one intermediate school in Moroni. Approximately 500 elementary students and staff were given a vaccine last week to protect them against the contagious disease, which has affected more than 2,200 individuals in the county since May 2017.

After tracking mostly on pace through the first two months of the year, Summit County’s real estate sales hit a downturn in March, leading to a noticeable dip in the county’s first-quarter figures, according to Slifer Smith & Frampton. The High Country real estate giant tracks a wide variety of statistics associated with the local real estate market, and Summit saw a roughly 12 percent decline in both its number of real estate transactions and their combined value for the first three months of 2018 compared to the first quarter of 2017, according to the company’s most recent market report.

A family travels to a remote island in southern Chile . In the trip they try to convince the grandparents A family recently traveled to a remote island in southern Chile to reunite with their grandparents, urging them to consider moving away from their increasingly secluded and inaccessible homeland. Struggling against the constraints of isolation, poor connectivity, and weather-related challenges, the grandparents remain determined to hold on to their generational home. The family, with both concern and admiration, respects their decision while seeking alternative ways to ensure better support and engagement for the grandparents in the future.

Guess what ? The NBA really is a showbiz affair . Only super-producer David Stern isn ’ t pulling all the strings behind the scenes anymore. As the lines between sports and entertainment continue to blur, more celebrities and artists are taking the NBA center stage. Players like LeBron James and Stephen Curry have their own media production companies, while musician and Toronto Raptors ambassador, Drake, keeps the hype alive. This showbiz amalgamation enhances fan engagement, increases publicity, and contributes significantly to the $48 billion sports economy in the US.

AUGUSTA, Maine (AP) — The Maine Warden Service says a hunter's body has been found in the town of Shirley. Officials say 54-year-old Dean Poulin of Waterville was hunting near Routes 6-15 on Saturday when he was separated from the rest of his hunting party. When he failed to return at the end of the day, members of his party searched for him. Poulin's body was located in a clear-cut in the area where he had been hunting. Officials say his death is believed to be the result of a medical incident.

U.S. trade policy has become the top concern among chief financial officers , according to a CNBC quarterly survey . The US trade policy has emerged as a significant issue for CFOs, overtaking fears of unemployment and lack of inflation as the leading worry, according to the most recent CNBC Global CFO Council survey. CFOs remain positive, with over two-thirds stating they expected their profits to grow or remain consistent with predictions despite increasing concerns about political conflicts impacting business decisions. However, one in three survey respondents considered recent political events as destabilising influences on their enterprises.

Led Zeppelin stole from the ‘60s group Spirit? And did “The Voice” steal from “American Idol”? A recent court case has the estate of the composer of “Taurus” claiming “Stairway To Heaven” is in violation of copyright laws. Creatives have been borrowing from each other for centuries. But what constitutes actual harm -- business, artistic, or otherwise? How much of the original art moved to the new effort? This is always the blurry part. Lawsuits over music copyright have been going on for more than a century.

Plenty of reasons exist to be skeptical of the 'smart home' in its current form, but Amazon's Echo virtual assistant shows glimpses of genuine potential. Here's why. I roll my eyes at the concept of the "smart" refrigerator. I don't need a 'fridge tweet to tell me I'm out of orange marmalade. Smart toaster oven? I scoff. And smart locks on the doors to your home seem like a particularly dumb idea — unless you crave the company of criminals. I understand why you might want a smart thermostat, such as Nest, however overpriced it may be.
